loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells footwear: shoes and slippers. She sells in the market square and also hawks her goods in her community. Comfort also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy more footwear to increase her stock.

Comfort is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children: some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is 58 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She deals in clothes and lace materials. Adwoa sells at the market square and also hawks to sell in her community. She treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well. She has been in business for 25 years and wants a loan to buy more textiles to increase her stock. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Son Of Man Group

texts.en:
Francis is a 43-year-old trader. He is married with eight children. Seven of them are schooling and his last is still nursing. For two years, he has sold used clothes in the local market in his community where he lives. He also sells by hawking during the market days in his surrounding communities. His major business challenge over the years has been obtaining funds to scale up the business. He has a lot of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable him to achieve remarkable business progress. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve his customers. He hopes to save enough money to support his children's entire schooling.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Son of Man’. He is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 38 years old. She is married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She deals in local soap. Charlotte buys the soap from Kumasi and sells it at the local market square. She also hawks to sell in her community and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy soap in bulk to increase her stock. Charlotte aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is 28 years old and single with no children. She lives with her family members. She is a baker and prepares pastries like cake, and she also sells fruits like watermelon, in bulk. In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to meet her customers' expectations with her pastries. She has customers who buy from her in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can make more profit and save part for the future. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 50 years old. She is married and has three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Naomi is a seamstress by profession. She sews all kinds of designs for women. She works in a shop by the road side. She has some apprentices under training. Naomi has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy more textile fabrics. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textile fabrics

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She sometimes sells by hawking: a personal selling method that she says makes her goods move very fast.

She is 45 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are in school. She is supporting her family with the proceeds she makes from her business. She has 15 years of experience in sales, but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds.

She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and bring in more profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more money to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk

loans.name: Nyame Tumi So Group

texts.en:
Anna is a food vendor selling kenkey with fried fish and pepper spices. She sells kenkey in the mornings, afternoons and in the evenings. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. 

Anna is 53 years old, divorced and the mother of three kids. All her children are girls and they are all traders in the community market. Anna is very resourceful in the provision of food and payment of bills for her family. She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her business output. 

Anna is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame tumi so’ which means ‘God power is great’. She is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, age 42, is a wife and mother with four children. All her children attend school and she is so proud of that – even though she does not have much money, her kids are academically solid. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, powdered skim milk, body and hair creams, etc.

Monica sees a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently requested by customers. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. All her children have finished the junior high school and have yet to continue to the senior high school. She is a trader and a dealer of used bags (both traveling and dressing bags). She has a good selection, matching the brand new ones they sell in the market. For that reason, she has widened her market share and has call for increments in demand. She is therefore appealing for your assistance to realize her dream of making more profits to aid in her children's future (education). With the loan, she wants to buy more from the importers to upgrade her stock. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy a supply of used bags for retail

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a business woman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen, government school uniforms and lace materials. She sometimes sells through hawking, that is, she uses a personal selling method. This, she said, makes her goods move very fast.  She is 44 years old and a married mother with six children. All her children are in school. She is very supportive to her family through the proceeds she makes from the business. She has four years of selling experience, but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase bulk of Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase bulk clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is 45 years old. She is a widowed mother with three children. All her children attend school and she is so proud of that. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Suzane Yessa

texts.fr: Suzane Yessa D. est une femme mariée de 44 ans qui s’active dans la plantation de banane, l’élevage et la vente de boeufs. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’entretenir sa plantation et d’acheter des boeufs à revendre. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The business of Suzane Yessa D., age 44, consists in growing bananas, as well as raising and selling cattle. The loan she's seeking will enable her to look after her plantation, and to buy cattle. Her goal is to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow bananas, and raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana C. M. tiene 62 años, esta casada con el Sr. Celso Medrano Velis, llevan 42 años de casados, viven en una zona periurbana. Tienen 4 hijos, los cuales estan casados y son independientes.

La Sra. Juana se dedica a la lacheria desde que se casó, tiene 7 vacas lecheras, entrega leche a una empresa local la cual produce toda clase de productos lacteos. Todo su ganado lechero esta en su misma propiedad. Necesita el prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera y alimento para que tenga almacenado debido a la escases en esta epoca de sequia. 

La Sra. Juana desea incrementar sus ingresos para poder vivir mejor y tambien para refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana C. M. is 62 years old and married to Mr. Celso Medrano Velis. They have been married for 42 years and live in a peri-urban zone. They have 4 children, all of whom are independent and married. Ms. Juana has been in the dairy business since she got married. She has 7 dairy cows. She sells the milk to a local business, which produces all types of dairy products. She owns all her dairy cows. She needs this loan in order to purchase another dairy cow and food for storage so that she can be prepared for shortages during this drought. Ms. Juana would like to increase her income so that she can lead a better life and refurbish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow and cattle feed

loans.name: Shirley Anabel

texts.es:
La señorita Shirley Anabel H. C. tiene 18 años y vive en casa con su madre y dos hermanas menores, su padre falleció hace unos 3 años y desde entonces es prácticamente ella la que se hace cargo de la chicharroneria (es un lugar donde sirven de comer un plato de chancho que se sirve frito en una paila, tradicional de Cochabamba). Cuando sus hermanas  vuelven de la escuela ayudan con la atención del local. 

La señorita Shirley vive en la zona "El Castillo" en Cochabamba, en su domicilio es donde tiene su chicharroneria  en la cual vende comida todos los días pero en mayor cantidad lo días sábado y domingo. La chicharroneria es famosa en la zona porque son muchísimos años los que está en funcionamiento y su calidad tiene muy buena reputación.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de mejor equipo de cocina ya que con el que cuentan en el momento es muy viejo y casi obsoleto, al tener mejor equipo de cocina podrán incrementar la cantidad de chicharron que venden y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su nivel de vida. La señorita Shirley  espera poder acceder a otro préstamo en el futuro para mejorar la infraestructura de su chicharroneria y poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Shirley Anabel H. C. is 18 years old and lives at home with her mother and two younger sisters. Her father passed away 3 years ago and since then it is practically her that takes care of the chicharroneria (a place where they serve plates of pork that are served fried in a large frying pan, traditional of Cochabamba). When her sisters return from school, they help out with the business. Shirley lives in the area called "El Castillo" in Cochabamba. The chicharroneria is located in their home where they serve food every day, but in larger quantities on Saturday and Sunday. The chicharroneria is famous in the area because it has been around for a very long time and the food has a reputation for good quality. The loan will be used for the purchase of better kitchen equipment since the current equipment is very old and almost obsolete. With better kitchen equipment, they will be able to increase the amount of pork they sell, increase their earnings, and consequently improve their quality of life. Shirley hopes to be able get another loan in the future to improve the infrastructure of the chicharroneria and be able to give better attention to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase better kitchen equipment

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita A. Vda. D. A.
Esta mujer ha trabajado desD. la edad D. trece años, dejó atrás su tierra natal Huancavelica con el propósito D. salir D. la pobreza extrema que atravesaba. 
Ella empieza a trabajar D. forma independiente a los 21 años, su negocio en ese entonces era la venta D. frutas, comida y reciclaba botellas D. vidrios, así como también realizaba labores D. limpieza D. casas, lavaba ropa; con estos ingresos apoyaba a su esposo quien pocos años después fallece y es a partir D. ese momento que sola afronta la carga familiar. Con el tiempo ahorró un pequeño capital que le sirvió para comprar un terreno, para su familia.
DesD. hace cuatro años y medio es cliente D. EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD, con los préstamos que recibió les dio educación escolar a sus hijos. Actualmente sigue dedicándose a la venta D. golosinas y lo hace D. manera ambulatoria, ofrece sus productos en los parques, en fiestas patronales, aniversario D. los distritos. Con el reciente préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en su mercadería y en la educación superior a su tercer hijo quien estudia en una universidad pública. Espera con las nuevas ganancias que obtendrá hacer posible alquilar un puesto para vender sus productos D. golosinas.
texts.en:
Margarita A. Vda. D. A. has worked ever since she was 13 years old. She left her hometown of Huancavelica behind with the aim of coming out of the extreme poverty she was in. She started working independently at age 21. At that time, she sold fruits and food, and she recycled glass bottles. She also cleaned houses and provided laundry services. With these jobs, she helped out her husband, who later passed away. From then on, she alone has been the head of the household. As time passed, she saved up some money, which she later used to purchase a plot of land for her family. She has been a client of EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for four-and-a-half years. With the loans that she has received, she has been able to proviD. an education for her children. She currently sells candy as a street vendor. She sells her products throughout different parks, at all the patron saint celebrations, and at district anniversaries. She invested this recent loan in purchasing merchandise and paying for her third child’s higher education, who is currently attending public university. She hopes that with the new profits, she will be able to rent a stand in which she can sell her candy.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Virginia Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Virginia Blanca S. A. tiene 31 años. Tiene 3 hijas, la mayor de 15 años, la segunda de 11 años y la menor de 9 años de edad.  Las tres acuden a la escuela de la zona, y las tres tienen muy buenas notas en la escuela porque dicen gustarles mucho aprender. Ayudan con el cuidado de las vacas todas las tardes después de la escuela. 

La señora Virginia vive en la zona de Monte Canto  en Cochabamba, en su domicilio es donde tiene su ganado lechero con el cual produce leche. Toda la producción de leche entrega diariamente a una empresa local que elabora toda clase de productos lácteos. Su esposo falleció hace no más de 2 años, quien era el que más trabajaba con el ganado, pero con lo sucedido ella y sus hijas se hacen cargo total del cuidado de las vacas.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de ganado lechero para poder incrementar la producción actual de leche que tienen, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su nivel de vida. La señora Virginia espera poder incrementar su ganado de tal forma que gane lo suficiente para contratar a alguien que la ayude con el cuidado de las vacas y así no tener que depender de sus hijas y poder darles más tiempo para que se dediquen a estudiar y poder salir de la escuela con buenas notas y entrar a la universidad y así cumplir con el sueño de su esposo.
texts.en:
Virginia Blanca S. A. is 31 years old. She has 3 daughters, the oldest is 15 years old, the second oldest is 11, and the youngest is 9. The three children attend the school in the area and receive very good grades because they say they enjoy learning. They help take care of the cows in the afternoons after school. Virginia lives in the Monte Canto zone in Cochabamba, and in her house is where she has her milking cow who produces milk. All the milk that is produced is delivered daily to a local company that manufactures all types of dairy products. Her husband passed away less than 2 years ago, and he was the one who worked with the milking cow. But when he passed, she and her daughters had to start taking care of the cows. The loan will be used to purchase another milking cow in order to increase the milk production that they have, and that way they will increase their earnings and consequently their quality of life. Virginia hopes to be able to increase her earnings to the point when she can hire someone to help take care of the cows, so she does not have to depend on her daughters. This way they can dedicate more time studying and succeeding in school with good grades, attend a university, and complete the dream of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow

loans.name: Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es:
el grupo Pueblo Nuevo son unas personas muy unidas y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, estas son  las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
MARTHA DE JESUS S. P. cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante. Doña Martha tiene 4 años de estar al frente de este tipo de negocio ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela por la calidad de mercaderia que compra y vende.- La Sra P. es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los que los cursan Educacion Primaria, tiene 28 años de edad, gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos actualmente ella esta solicitando el credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio.
JUANA LORENA P. confecciona ropa para dama, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace varios años, cuenta con una buena clientela por el buen trabajo que ella desempeña en la elaboracion de prendas. Doña Lorena es madre soltera, tiene 1 hija la que esta cursando el 5to año de educacion Primaria. Ella se siente muy feliz porque gracias a este tipo de actividad ella ha podido  sacar adelante su hija
MIRIAN LIDIANA M. S. su actividad principal es la venta de Pan de casa el que distribuye de manera ambulante en las diferentes pulperias de esta ciudad de Danlí, ella compra las bolsas de pan y le da un 15% de utilidad pòr bolsa, esta actividad la realiza los dias Martes y Virenes de la semana ya que es un producto de muy buena calidad y apetecido por el publico.
Doña Mirian es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos en el cual uno de ellos ya se graduo de Perito Mercantil y el otro esta cursando la secundaria, gracias a los buenos ingresos de capital que genera su actividad ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Pueblo Nuevo group is made up of three women who are very close and want to get ahead in life. The different activities they are involved in are as follows: MARTHA DE JESUS S. P. has a business selling new clothing, and distributes her products as a street vendor. Martha has had this business for 4 years and now has a good clientele that appreciates the quality of the merchandise that she buys and sells. Martha is a single mother with 2 children, both of whom are in primary school. She is 27 years old, and is grateful that her business allows her to support her children. She would like to use this loan to restock her business. JUANA LORENA P. makes women’s clothing for a living. She has been involved in this activity for several years, and has a good clientele that appreciates the excellent work she does in making garments. Juana is a single mother with one daughter, who is currently in her 5th year of primary school. Juana is very happy that her work allows her to support her daughter. MIRIAN LIDIANA M. S.’s main economic activity is selling bread, which she distributes to various local stores in the city of Danlí. She purchases bags of bread and is able to get a 15% return for each bag she sells. She is involved in this activity on Tuesdays and Fridays of every week. The bread she sells is very good quality and is exactly what her customers want. Mirian is a single mother who has 2 sons. One of her sons has already graduated from school and is now a qualified accountant, while her other son is currently in secondary school. Mirian is grateful for the income that her business generates, which has made it possible for her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sewing accessories, silk, men’s jeans, brassieres, blouses, and children’s shirts; and purchasing bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
el sr. JOSE MANUEL ORDOÑEZ FLORES de dedica a la venta de verduras, cuenta con un negocio que esta ubicado en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danli, vende al por mayor y menor, cabe destacar que con el esfuerzo diario que el hace a logrado salir adelante y poder generar mas ingresos para su negocio y su familia, mejorando asi su nivel de vida.
Don Jose es casado y tiene el apoyo de su esposa,  tienen una buena clientela porque su negocio 
luce muy surtido y lo mantienen muy higienco.
gracias a este negocio a podido manejar bien sus ingresos de capital y adquirir una mejor fuente de desarollo para su vida. el tiene 48 años de edad.
en estos momentos en necesita el credito para poder comprar mas verduras.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel O. Flores sells vegetables. He has a store located in the Pueblo Nuevo neighborhood in the city of Danli, and he sells wholesale and retail. He stands out because his daily efforts have caused him to succeed and generate a higher income for his business and his family, improving their quality of life.

Jose is married and has the support of his wife. They have a good clientele because their store has a good assortment, and they keep it very clean. Thanks to this business, he has been able to increase his income and create a better source of development for his life. He is 48 years old.

At this time, he needs a loan to be able to buy more vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia Antonia

texts.es: Doña Lucia ser una persona muy humilde de una comunidad muy lejana del departamento de Totonicapan su actividad principal es el bordado a maquina de coser manual ella viene ejerciendo dicha actividad cuando tenia doce años y hasta la fecha conserva dicho trabajo que lo heredo su querida madrecita, ella narra que sus vecinas de la comunidad le llevan la prendas de vestir para hacerles los delantales, adornos a los cortes, blusas hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales ya que se tiene un pedido para la feria de la comunidad de Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia P. is a very humble person from a far-off community in the department of Totonicapan. Her main business activity is embroidery by sewing machine. She has been in this business ever since she was 12 years old. Even today, she still works in this craft, which she inherited from her beloved mother. She states that her neighbors take her their garments so that she can make matching aprons, decorate the pieces, and make blouses. She now needs a loan in order to purchase supplies because she has a large order from a market in the community of Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señorita Maria cristina es originaria del departamento de Totonicapan a su edad ha emprendido su propio negocio la estuvo trabajando cinco años como operaria y lo que ganaba hera muy poco a comparacion de su trabajo hace tres años ha iniciado con su propio negocio  y la dificulta que encuentra es la falta de capital para poder surtir su producción hoy necesita de un credito para aumentar su caìtal y poder satisfaser la necesidad de los clientes, en los bordado.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Cristina is from the department of Totonicapan. At her young age, she has started her own business. She was a garment worker for five years, but her income was too low compared to what she produced. Three years ago, she decided to start her own business, but the biggest problem she faces is the lack of working capital to increase her inventory. She now needs a loan as working capital that will help her meet all of her customers’ embroidery needs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: San Pedro San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Pedro y San Pablo es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Cuarto ciclo con 24 socias. Las socias son del distrito de Callanmarca, Provincia de Angaraes, Departamento de Huancavelica. Las actividades principales son la agricultura y ganadería.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes en general, cereales, animales menores, frutas, comida.

Como es el caso de Lidia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Lidia se dedica a la compra de cereales en las diferentes ferias y luego los procesa para comercializarlos en la feria de Acobamba. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 500 soles, 800 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total de 13,400 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de cereales, animales menores, arroz, azúcar, tubérculos.

Los sueños de las socias son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The San Pedro y San Pablo Microfinance Institute is part of the Wari project. The microfinance institute is starting its fourth loan with 24 members, who are all from the Callanmarca districts in the Angaraes province of the Huancavelica departments. Their main businesses are in livestock and agriculture. The group members sell products like provisions, grains, small animals, fruits, and food. In Lidia’s case, she has a live-in partner and three children. She buys grains at the different street markets, then processes them to sell them at the Acobamba market. The group members need different loan amounts—anywhere from 200 to 500 to 800 and even 1,000.00 PEN—for a total of 13,400.00 PEN from their microfinance institute. The loan will be invested in purchasing grains, small animals, rice, sugar, and tubers. The group members dream of expanding their businesses and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, small animals, rice, sugar, and tubers

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es: Doña Rosita como lo conocen en su comunidad es originaria de departamento de Totonicapan su principal fuente de Produccion de dicha comuninidad es la artesania tipicas en la elaboracion de cinta, perrajes, morrales etc. Ella aprendio dicho trabajo  de su querido padre en la epoca de los ochenta y nonventa donde la tipica a nivel de Guatemala hera reconocido  que hasta la fecha lo siguen produccioendo, hoy necesita de un credito en donde  lo invertira en la compra de hilos, tintas, conos, para la elaboracion de su producto.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosita, as she is known in her community, is from the department of Totonicapan. Her main source of income is producing traditional Guatemalan handicrafts like headbands, shawls, shoulder bags, etc. She learned this craft from her beloved father in the 80’s and 90’s, when handicrafts were popular in Guatemala. Until now, handicrafts are still being produced. She needs a loan which will be invested in purchasing thread, dyes, and yarn cones to make her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Villa Hermoza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Villa Hermosa inicia su tercer ciclo con 15 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de cereales, comida, animales menores, abarrotes en general, golosinas, panes.

Como es el caso Norma que es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Norma viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, animales menores, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Mientras que Santona es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Santona vende comida en la puerta de la escuela de policías, además vende golosinas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles,  haciendo un total de 7,950 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de golosinas, cereales, arroz, azúcar y animales menores.

Los sueños de las socias son trabajar mas, sus hijos sean profesionales y salgan adelante y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Villa Hermosa Microfinance Institute is in its third loan cycle with 15 members.

The group members have different businesses in which they sell grains, fast food, small animals, groceries, candy, and bread.

In Norma’s case, she is a married 32-year-old mother with 3 children. Norma travels to the different street markets in the region where she purchases grains and small animals, which she then sells at different markets throughout the city of Ayacucho.

On the other hand, Santona is a married 36-year-old mother with 2 children. She sells food outside the police academy. She also sells candy with the help of her daughter.

The group members need different loan amounts—anywhere from 300 to 600 to 900.00 PEN—for a total of 7,950.00 PEN from their microfinance institute.

The loan will be invested in purchasing candy, grains, rice, sugar, and small animals.

The group members dream of working more, of seeing their children become professionals and get ahead in life, and of buying their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, grains, rice, sugar, and small

loans.name: Perla Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal PerL. inicia su sexto ciclo con 18 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta Pescado, golosinas, mercería, abarrotes en general, ropa, cereales, leña y brindan servicio mecánico, cabinas D. Internet.

Como es el caso D. Mary es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Mary tiene cabinas D. Internet en su casa, además venD. útiles D. escritorio y golosinas, actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. su esposo.
Mientras que Yuli es soltera, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Yuli venD. pescado, reparte al por mayor en el terminal pesquero.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,550 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. pescado, galletas, caramelos, materiales D. escritorio, arroz, azúcar y leña.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener una librería por mayor, sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The PerL. Microfinance Institute is currently in its sixth loan cycle with 18 members.

The group members have different businesses, such as a fish market, candy store, notions store, general store, clothing store, grain sales, firewood sales, internet café, and an auto mechanic shop.

In Mary’s case, she is a 37-year-old married mother with 4 children. She has an internet café at home. Additionally, she sells desk supplies and candy with the help of her husband.

Yuli, on the other hand, is a 37-year-old single mother with 3 children. She sells fish, distributing it wholesale at the fish market.

The members need different loan amounts—anywhere from 300.00 PEN, to 600.00 PEN, to 1,050.00 PEN—for a total of 8,550.00 PEN from their microfinance institute.

The loan will be invested in purchasing fish, cookies, candy, desk supplies, rice, sugar, and firewood.

The group members dream of having a wholesale bookstore, of seeing their children become professionals, and of improving their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish, cookies, candy, desk supplies, rice, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es: Asunción es una mujer muy trabajadora, lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, con quienes comparte gratos momentos, tratando siempre de brindar los mejores cuidados a sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 15 años y en todo este tiempo ha ido mejorando sus ventas gracias al trato que brinda a sus clientas, quienes están muy contentas de contar con Asunción como consultora de belleza. Pero para seguir progresando requiere de un capital adicional para instalar un puesto de venta en su casa, ya que tiene mucho interés de tener  un bazar donde venda diversos productos para el hogar. Para ello, Asunción seguirá trabajando  con el mismo ritmo, saliendo todas las tardes a visitar a sus clientes regulares y a nuevos clientes, con quienes pueda incrementar sus ventas. Asunción también trabaja con jóvenes que le ayuden a vender sus productos a cambio de un porcentaje de las ganancias, esta estrategia le está dando muy buenos resultados. Este es su 6to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, esta oportunidad de crédito le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que desarrolla junto a sus compañeras un trabajo coordinado en su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que ahora solicita serán invertidos en la compra de productos de belleza para entregar los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Asunción is a very hardworking woman who struggles hard to help her family get ahead, sharing great moments with them and always trying to give her 2 children the best care. She has been selling beauty products for 15 years. During this whole time, her sales have been improving thanks to her great customer service. Her customers are very happy to have Asunción as their beauty consultant. However, in order to keep making progress, she needs additional capital to set up a sales stand in her house because she is very interested in establishing a shop in which she sells various household products. For this, Asunción will continue to work in the same manner, going out every evening to visit her regular customers, as well as new ones who will boost sales. Asunción always works with young people who help her sell her products in exchange for a percentage of the profits. This strategy is yielding great results. This is her 6th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Her chance to obtain loans has allowed her to improve her quality of life because she and her fellow group members grow as entrepreneurs, working in conjunction with their microfinance institute. The 3,000.00 PEN that she is currently requesting will be invested in purchasing beauty products so that she can distribute her pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada al progreso de su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, gracias a la invitación de una amiga, quien la motivó a vender cosméticos, desde entonces trató siempre de realizar las mejores ventas durante el mes y entregar a tiempo los pedidos a sus clientes, quienes se encuentran muy contentas con las atenciones que les brinda. En esta actividad dedica gran parte del día, porque hay que visitar constantemente a sus clientas para mostrarles las nuevas ofertas de productos y de la misma forma, busca nuevos clientes que incrementen sus pedidos e ingresos. Ahora, Clara tiene proyectado instalar un pequeño espacio para la venta de productos en su casa, pues cuenta con gran cantidad en stock por vender, por ello espera poder ampliar su casa, en un futuro cercano, para abrir un bazar, ya que vender adicionalmente otros productos le ayudaría a progresar como comerciante. Ella es nueva en Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera trabajar con responsabilidad dentro de la institución, ya que su interés es permanecer por varios años para mejorar su negocio. Los 1500 soles que solicita le permitirán comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de belleza en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Clara is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family’s progress. Her family is comprised of her husband and her 2 children, with whom she lives in the house that she and her husband bought. For 10 years she has been selling beauty products thanks to the invitation of her friend, who motivated her to sell cosmetics. Ever since then, she has always tried to be the top seller of the month and deliver the products to her customers on time. They are in turn very happy with her customer service. She works in the business for the better part of the day because she has to constantly visit her customers to show them the new products. In so doing, she looks to add new customers who will increase their purchases and her income. Clara is now planning to set up a small sales area in her house where she can sell beauty products because she has a big stock. She is planning on expanding her house in the near future so that she can open up a miscellaneous store because selling additional items will help her grow as an entrepreneur. She is new to the Microfinanzas PRISMA team, and she hopes to work responsibly within the institute because it is of interest to her to stay there to improve her business. The 1,500.00 PEN that she is requesting will help her purchase a display cabinet in which she can place her beauty products at home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cabinet

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El señor Ceferino G. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente y con los cuales le ha hecho mejoras ha su vivienda y al negocio.
Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir el negocio con más variedad de productos y acondicionarlo mejor. 
En el negocio trabajan el y su esposa la señora Adriana Uresti ya que el señor Ceferino tiene ya mas de diez y nueve años dedicándose a vender tacos, refrescos y dulces afuera de una escuela, también  trabaja de velador en una compañía. 
Estos son los ingresos que tiene para ellos ya que viven solos y con el cual pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ceferino G. has already had three loans from FVP, which he repaid punctually and with which he has made improvements in his house and business. Now he is requesting a loan so that he can supply his business with a larger variety of products and so that he can set it up better. He and his wife, Mrs. Adriana Uresti, work in the business. Mr. Cerefino has spent more than nineteen years selling tacos, drinks and sweets outside a school. He also works as a guard at a company. These are the ways that the couple earns an income, since they live alone. This is also the income with which they will repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and set up his business

loans.name: Basiliana

texts.en:
Basiliana M. is 59, married with 10 children ranging from 14  to 40 years old and a resident of Old Fabrica in La Castellana, Negros Occidental.

Raising 10 children while depending on the income that her husband could generate made life very hard of Basiliana and her family. When a friend invited her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, she was very apprehensive because she did not want to be in debt, but she was determined to help her family, so with the agreement of her husband, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and with her first loan she started a small general store and to make sure that she could pay back her loan she went around her community selling specialty goods house to house. The business nets around PHP1,600.00 ($33) per month, but is able to feed her family.

She has used subsequent loans to slowly but steadily build her business. Now on her 11th loan cycle, the PHP 15,000 she is borrowing will allow her to widen the variety of goods that she could sell in her store. She continues to strive hard to provide for her family and dreams that all her children will have a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: additional inventory and working capital for the borrower's General Store

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia tiene 49 años, su prioridad, como toda madre, es el desarrollo y crecimiento de su hijo, ya que es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo en su casa, trabajando con mucho esmero por brindarle lo mejor. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de cosméticos y siempre ha tratado de brindar lo mejor de su trabajo, reflejo de esta dedicación es el cargo de empresaria que tiene dentro de la línea de belleza. Por esto, tiene como responsabilidad trabajar con un grupo de jóvenes muchachas a quienes orienta y ayuda para que logren sus metas de ventas. Esta actividad la realiza todo el día, tratando siempre de tener un espacio de descanso para estar con su hijo, siendo lo más difícil las horas de supervisión que realiza por las tardes, pues tiene que verificar la cantidad de los pedidos que se realizan. Ahora, Hortencia tiene proyectado abrir un bazar en su casa, donde instale vitrinas para exhibir sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos, sin salir de su hogar. Los 6 créditos que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA le han permitido mejorar sus ingresos económicos, pero sobre todo, le ayudaron a mejorar su trabajo como miembro activo de su banco comunal, el cual se formó hace 3 años. Los 1800 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de vitrinas para colocar sus productos y para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 49 years old. As any mother, her priority is the development and growth of her son. Since she is a single mother and lives with her only son, she is committed to work very hard to provide him with the best. She has been selling cosmetics since a very young age and has always sought to do the best she can. This determination reflects in the responsibilities that she assumes in the cosmetics line. For that reason she is in charge of a group of young girls to whom she gives guidance on the best way to achieve their sales objectives. She performs this activity throughout the day, always trying to take a break to be with her son. Her greatest difficulty is the supervision time in the evening when she must check the placed orders. Now Hortencia plans to open a store in her home, where she will install showcases to display her products and increase her income without leaving her home. The six loans that she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma have enabled her to increase her income, but above all they have helped her to improve her work as an active member of her community bank, which was formed three years ago. Hortencia will invest the 1800 nuevos soles of her loan in showcases to place her merchandise and in more cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy showcases

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La señora Felicita V. ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA los cuales a pagado puntual mente y está muy agradecida por su gran ayuda que le han brindado con estos préstamos, con los cuales a surtido y remodelado su negocio.   
Eso le ha permitido tener un mayor ingreso y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia.
Esta solicitando un tercer crédito para poder surtir su negocio de mercancía, como es de lácteos, productos congelados y verduras. Ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda estos productos, porque es la única tienda ya hay en la colonia y para ellos es más como acudir a su negocio a comprar el producto. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicita V. has already had two loans with Kiva, which she repaid punctually, and she is very thankful for the great help that she has been offered with these loans, with which she supplied and remodeled her business. This has allowed her to have a larger income and, in this way, to be able to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting her third loan so that she can supply her business with merchandise, like dairy products, frozen products, and vegetables. Because hers is the only store in the neighborhood, her clients are asking her to sell those products and they turn to Felicita’s business to buy the products. She plans to repay the loan with the income from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
La señora María Concepción I. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en anterior crédito con el cual su negocio a crecido bastante ya tiene mas mercancía y más clientes. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder empezar a vender, verduras y fruta ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo que venda esté tipo de producto también desea tener a la venta productos congelados y que será una buena inversión para su negocio.
Pero no cuanta con el capital necesario para poder invertir sin descapitalizar el negocio.
Es por eso que solicita nueva mente su cooperación en esté nuevo préstamo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Concepción I. is very grateful for her cooperation in her previous loan, with which her business grew a lot, since she had more merchandise and more clients. Now, she is requesting a loan so that she can begin to sell vegetables and fruit, since her clients are asking her to sell these types of products. She also wants to sell frozen products. This will be a good investment for her business. However, she does not have the capital necessary to invest without undercapitalizing her business. Because of this, she is once again requesting your cooperation for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Karín

texts.es: Karín tiene 25 años, es una joven que trata siempre de apoyar a sus padres, con quienes vive y con quienes disfruta gratos momentos. Desde que terminó sus estudios quiso tener un negocio propio y sus padres le ayudaron a instalar un puesto de zapatos en el mercado de su localidad. Lugar donde vende desde hace 2 años y en este tiempo ha logrado ganar gran cantidad de clientes, quienes la visitan todos los días, teniendo como ventaja sobre su competencia los precios cómodos que ofrece. Pero para incrementar sus ventas, comienza su jornada desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y su mercadería la compra en centro de la ciudad, aunque la mayoría de las veces la adquiere a través de comerciantes amigos de otras ciudades donde fabrican calzado de muy buena calidad y a precios bajos, posibilitando mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de sus productos. Ahora Karín tiene pensado ampliar su puesto para ofertar nuevas marcas de zapatos. Como parte de un banco comunal lo que más le agrada es el compromiso y esfuerzo que ponen sus compañeras de grupo, ya que hay un buen grado de compromiso por mejorar, y durante los 13 préstamos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA ha pasado por muchas situaciones difíciles que ha logrado superar. Los 3000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de un exhibidor para sus nuevos modelos de zapatos que adquirirá.
texts.en:
Karín is a young lady of 25 years who always tries to support her parents, with whom she lives and enjoys spending pleasant moments.

When she finished her studies, she wanted to have her own business and her parents helped her to set up a shoe stall at the local market. She has been selling shoes there for two years and during that time she has managed to gain many loyal customers who visit her every day, as she offers lower prices than her competitors. In order to increase her sales, she starts already at 9 a.m. and works until 6 p.m. She buys some merchandise in the city center, although most of it comes from merchant friends in other cities, where shoes of a very high quality are produced at a low price. Thus she can earn more money and yet offer good quality to her customers.

Now Karín is planning to expand her stall and offer new brands of shoes. As a member of a community bank, she particularly enjoys the commitment and effort of her group members. During the 13 loans she has had so far with Microfinanzas Prisma, she went through many difficult situations that she managed to overcome. She will invest the 3000 nuevos soles of her loan in the purchase of a showcase for the new shoes that she will buy.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a showcase for her shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es una mujer emprendedora y ser maestra de profesión y madre, le permitió educar a sus hijos, buscando brindarles todos los cuidados dentro y fuera de su casa. Su remuneración como profesora no era suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, por ello decidió emprender el negocio de la venta de ropa. Actividad que realiza desde hace 10 diez años, tiempo en el cual aprendió a manejar el negocio y a entablar amistad con algunos comerciantes, quienes le proveen de mercadería de buena calidad. Este es un gran beneficio, pues puede ofrecer las prendas de vestir a sus clientes a precios muy cómodos, lo cual marca la diferencia frente otros vendedores y ella. Aunque lo difícil es tener que cobrar semanalmente a las personas que vende al crédito, debido a las distancias que tiene que recorrer y para esta labor se toma todo el día, durante los fines de semana. Ahora Maribel se está proyectando para abrir una tienda en su casa, pues sus clientes conocen su domicilio y la motivaron a instalar un bazar donde ofrezca diversos productos, tanto como ropa y artículos para el hogar, lo cual espera conseguir pronto. Ya son 13 los préstamos con Microfinanzas PRISMA, éstos le permitieron mejorar su calidad de vida. Además es una buena oportunidad, la que brinda su banco comunal, en pro del desarrollo económico y social, personal y de sus compañeras. Los 3000 soles solicitados le permitirán invertir en la compra de vitrinas y exhibidores para su bazar.
texts.en:
Maribel is an enterprising woman, a teacher by profession, and a mother. Her background has allowed her to raise her children with a view to meeting their needs inside and outside her home. Her compensation as a teacher was not sufficient to meet the needs of her family and, because of this, she decided to enter the business of selling clothes.

She has carried out this activity for 10 years, time in which she has learned to manage the business and establish friendship with some dealers who provide her with good quality merchandise. This is a great benefit since she can offer the promise of dressing her customers at very comfortable prices. This marks the difference between other sellers and herself.

The difficulty she faces is having to make weekly collections from people to whom she sells on credit. Due to the distances she has to cover this task takes all day during the weekends.

Now, Maribel is planning to open a shop in her house. Since her customers are acquainted with her home this motivated her to establish a shop where she offers diverse products such as clothing and household articles which she hopes to obtain soon.

She has already had 13 loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA. These have allowed her to improve her quality of life. Furthermore, her community bank has offered a good opportunity for economic, social, and personal development to her and her friends. The 3000 soles she is applying for will permit her to invest in the purchase of showcases and other equipment for exhibiting merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of showcases for exhibiting merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María Del Carmen R. está construyendo un cuarto que será para su hija y sus nietos que viven con ella. 
A la construcción le está haciendo falta la losa en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Es por eso que nos esta solicitando un préstamo para que su hija y nietas tenga su privacidad en la casa y un lugar solo para ellos.
Doña María trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa particular ya que es madre soltera y solo cuenta con su ingreso, pero una parte de sus ganancias la utilizara para pagar el crédito.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es su hija y sus nietos ya que la señora María Del Carmen se encontraba en su trabaja cuando fuimos a vicitarla.
texts.en:
María Del Carmen R. is building a room that will be for her daughter and her grandchildren. They live with her. The construction is lacking the slab, and she does not have the money to pay someone to make this improvement. That is why she is asking for this loan. She wants her daughter and grandchildren to have their privacy and a place just for them in her house. María works as a maid in a private house. She is a single mother, and only has her income. However, she will use part of her earnings to repay the loan. The people in the photo are her daughter and grandchildren. María del Carmen was at work when the picture was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build the slab

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 46 años, es madre de 5 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que adquirió algunos años atrás y donde pasa momentos gratos con sus seres queridos. Desde joven aprendió a elaborar deliciosos pasteles, los cuales vende en los diferentes eventos sociales donde solicitan sus servicios, pues la mayoría de personas de su localidad la conocen y saben del excelente trabajo que realiza y la creatividad que pone en cada trabajo. Esta confianza es una ventaja para el incremento de sus ingresos y le permite renovar los utensilios y máquinas que utiliza para la preparación de sus deliciosos bocaditos. Ahora, Rosa espera instalar en su domicilio un espacio con todos los materiales indispensables para trabajar con comodidad e incrementar su producción para distribuir tortas en algunas tiendas de su distrito. Ella nos comenta, que la cooperación y el optimismo son las características que mantienen su grupo de compañeras con las que trabaja en su banco comunal, el cual cada vez va mejorando en sus ingresos, pues ya llevan nueve créditos con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 2000 soles que solicita le permitirán realizar la compra de utensilios y un horno adicional para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, has five children. They live in a house that she got a few years ago, where they have great times with their loved ones. As a young girl she learned how to make delicious cakes. She sells them for different social events that ask for her services. Most of the people in her area know her. They know the excellent work she does and the creativity she puts into each job. This confidence is an advantage in increasing her income. It allows her to update the utensils and machines that she uses to make her delicious snacks. Now, Rosa hopes to install in her house a space equipped with all of her indispensable working materials. She wants to do this to work comfortably and increase her production in order to distribute cakes to some of the stores in her district. Cooperation and optimism are the characteristics that describe the colleagues she works with in her community bank. They have had nine loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and each time they improve their incomes. The 2,000 PEN that she is asking for is to buy utensils and another oven to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baking utensils

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio O. P. trabaja como mesero en un Restaurant de la Ciudad, su esposa no ha podido encontrar un trabajo estable por su edad en estos momentos esta trabajando temporalmente para una empresa por un periodo de 3 meses. El señor  O. y su esposa tienen 3 hijos 2 estan estudiando la preparatoria y uno la primaria. Este matimonio recurre a nosotros para que se le pueda otorgar credito  para la compra de utiles escolares y uniformes de sus hijos, ellos se preocupan mucho por la educacion de los niños, ya que estas personas  cren que es la mejor herencia que pueden darles.
texts.en:
Julio O. P. works as a waiter in a restaurant in the city. His wife has not been able to find stable work. She is temporarily working for a business for three months. Mr. O. and his wife have three children. Two are in high school, and one is in elementary school. This couple is asking for a loan to buy school supplies and uniforms for their children. They care a lot about educating their children. They believe that education is the best inheritance they can give them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 47 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, ya que siente que el progreso de su familia es su responsabilidad como cabeza del hogar, por lo cual ha tratado de brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su bienestar. Desde joven se especializó en la reparación de electrodomésticos, posteriormente adquirió experiencia trabajando en diversos talleres, hasta que consiguió implementar su propio taller de reparaciones. Víctor tiene su pequeño local en una zona céntrica de su localidad, donde atiende desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sin embargo, los 20 años que lleva  trabajando en la zona le permitieron ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, debido a su capacidad y profesionalismo, además de su gran sentido del humor. Ahora se está proyectando para alquilar un local más amplio, pero para ello tiene que incrementar sus ingresos, ya que los pagos de alquiler serán mayores. A través de su banco comunal ha trabajado 10 préstamos con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde junto a sus compañeros han sabido desarrollar y potenciar sus capacidades, pues realizan actividades a favor del progreso de su grupo. Los 2500 soles que solicita le permitirán adquirir algunas herramientas que requiere para agilizar las reparaciones de los equipos que le llevan diariamente a su local.
texts.en:
Victor, 47, is a very hard working man. He feels that the progress of his family is his responsibility as head of the household. Therefore, he has tried to give his family the necessary living conditions for their well being. Since he was a young man he has specialized in repairing domestic electric appliances. He previously gained experience working in various shops until he was able to set up his own repair shop. Victor has his small shop in a central area of his region. He works from nine in the morning until eight at night. His 20 years of working in the area have allowed him to win his customers’ confidence due to his professional capacity and his great sense of humor. He is now planning to rent a larger place, but he will have to increase his income because the rent will be more. Through his community bank he has had ten loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Together with his colleagues they have know how to develop and improve their capabilities. They engage in activities that help the group progress. The 2,500 PEN that he is asking for is to buy some tools that he needs to speed up the repairs on the appliances that are brought to his shop every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva V. is 38, married with 7 school-age children, and a resident of Cabacungan in the town of La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She raises pigs to supplement her husband's income and to make life a little bit more comfortable for their family.

She joined NWTF- Project Dungganon in 1991 but stopped in 1999. She rejoined in July of 2006, so that she could get a loan to raise pigs to augment their family income. She buys the piglets, feeds and fattens them for several months and then sells them. This adds PHP 4,000 ($83) to her family's monthly income.

The income she earns from raising pigs in her backyard for the last 3 years has helped her family a lot especially with 7 children still going to school. This is why Nieva is committed to continue and expand with this activity so that she could increase her income potential.

The PHP 18,000 she is borrowing will allow her to buy more piglets and feed than her previous loan which she ably paid off because of the weekly easy-payment scheme.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: the purchase of more piglets to raise

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Ángel M. L. se dedica ala  venta de ropa usa desde hace catorce años de este negocio ha mantenido a su familia el cual le va muy bien. El local esta ubicado en un  buen lugar ya que esta en frente de una tienda muy conocida en la ciudad, aparte de que hay otros vendedores el es conocido por traer variedad de ropa.
Los clientes en este momento le están encargando cosas pero en este momento no tiene el suficiente dinero para ir a comprar la mercancía ya que donde la compra es en una ciudad de EUA donde vende la ropa por pacas, pero el traslado le cuesta es por ellos que recurre a esta institución para adquirir un préstamo para invertirle al negocio y así tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Ángel M. L. has sold used clothing for 14 years. From this business he has been able to support his family and for that he enjoys it. The business is located in a nice place since it is in front of a very well-known story in the city. Apart from other venders, he is known for having a variety of clothing. Right now his customers are buying on credit but he currently does not have enough money to go and buy more merchandise since the store is in a city in the United States where they sell clothing in bales. The transport to and from this store is very hard for him and this is why he turns to this institution - to get a loan and invest it in his business and therefore have more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Voluntad Solidaria Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
VOLUNTAD SOLIDARIA

La Alcancía Comunal Voluntad solidaria esta conformada por 11 socias; tienen como presidenta a la Sra.  Giovanna P., es una mujer empeñosa en su trabajo y muy dedicada a sus hijos, ella tiene un negocio de accesorios para mochilas  formando hace año y medio con mucho esfuerzo ya que como ella dice, debemos ser perseverantes, sin importar los obstáculos que se presenten.

La Tesorera Sra. María M. tiene negocio de venta de cerveza desde hace 15 años, ella nos comenta que mediante ese negocio pudo educar a sus hijos y como resultado ahora 3 de ellos son profesionales, además pudo construir parte de su casa., aún tiene el sueño de acabar con la construcción de su vivienda para dejarlo como herencia a sus hijos y nietos.

La Secretaria de la alcancía comunal Sra. Lourdes R. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, mediante sus pocos ingresos puede ayudar en casa, aunque nunca es suficiente.

Los socios de la alcancía comunal tienen diferentes negocios tales como venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa y algunas desde ahora hacen sus preparativos para las fiestas de fin de año.

Saben que el mercado es muy competitivo, es por eso que, con el préstamo obtenido invertirán para la compra de sus productos; todos ellos son optimistas ya que tienen la seguridad que  obtendrán mayores ganancias en sus respectivos giros de negocio.
texts.en:
Voluntad Solidaria Community Bank The Voluntad Solidaria Community back is comprised of 11 members. Giovanna P. is the president. She is a hard working woman who is devoted to her children. She has a business selling backpack accessories. She started the business with great effort one and a half years ago. She says that we all need to persevere without letting obstacles get in our way. The treasurer, María M., has been selling beer for 15 years. Through this business she was able to educate her children, and three of them are now professionals. She was also able to construct part of her house. She still dreams of finishing the construction on her house to leave as an inheritance for her children and grandchildren. Lourdes R. is the secretary of the Community Bank. She sells cosmetics by catalog. With her small income she is able to help at home, although it is never enough. The members of the community bank have different business like selling food, selling cosmetics, and selling clothes. Some of them make things to get ready for the end of the year celebrations. They know that the market is very competitive. That is why they will use the loan to buy products. They are all optimists because they are sure that they will obtain greater earnings in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Martha Guadalupe R. R. es Divorciada vive con una de sus hijas y cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, además de el negocio ella labora para una farmacia como intendente, con su negocio tiene 7 meses y mucha gente ya va a comprarle  ya que la ropa que vende es de muy buena calidad, solo que como no tiene suficiente capital para invertirle no ha lo ha surtido. 
Es por ello que llego a esta institución recomendad por otro cliente por que el apoyo que se daba era muy bueno y aparte le beneficiaria en sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Guadalupe R. R. is divorced and lives with one of her daughters. She operates a small business selling used clothing. In addition, she works for a pharmacy as an administrator. She has been in business for 7 months, and many people buy from her because the clothes that she sells are of high quality. However, she does not have sufficient capital to invest in more merchandise.

For this reason, she has come to the institution on the recommendation from another client. She was told that she would be well supported and that she should see some benefit in her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
“The thing I’ve learned is that you can’t wait for things to come to you,” says Katrina about her mobile massage company.  Since losing her job at a spa when it closed down, she has focused on her own business working mostly with motorcyclists, racers, and mechanics recovering from injuries and surgery.  Since her clients rarely seek out a massage therapist, Katrina has built partnerships with automotive businesses who bring her in to work on their employees.  This niche market has enabled Katrina to establish a loyal customer base, but she needs to expand her client list in order to build a sustainable business.

A $3,000 loan will help Katrina buy a car to that she can travel to more businesses, and even raceways and other events, in order to expand beyond her current client base.

loans.use: Purchase vehicle for mobile massage practice

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Juvy is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Juvy owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juvy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria purchased Parkside Postal three years ago to provide a neighborhood mail and shipping center for the community.  Despite strong sales in her first two years, she is still unable to qualify for a loan from a bank.  More recently, the recession has been hard on Gloria’s business, and she has been forced to draw down her savings to keep the business running.  

Gloria knows many of her customers by name.  The relationships she has built and the level of customer service that she provides are what set her apart from competitors.  A $5,000 loan helps Gloria to invest in more marketing and renew her notary license in order to expand her customer base, increase business revenue, and endure the economic downturn.

loans.use: Notary license and marketing

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn P. is from the village of Sebucao, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Erlyn is married. To make a living, Erlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Erlinda G. raises pigs in her backyard. She started her business with only two piglets. Now, she has a sow and she sells piglets also to her neighbors and contacts.

She needs additional capital. She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase feed. She hopes that by having a loan to support her business, she will be able to expand her business.

She actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings. CEVI is not just giving loans to people. They are also bringing education to all their clients to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married and has a son. She lives and works in Zaporozhye. Marina owns a small footwear sales enterprise at one of the biggest markets in her home town. She has a loyal clientele and offers a flexible pricing policy that attracts many customers. Marina has been in business for 15 years. Presently, she has about 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnyas.

Marina is seeking a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to restock her merchandise for the coming fall season. Summer is always a slow season for small market vendors in Ukraine, so Marina is hoping to catch up on her sales in fall when customer demand usually goes up.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad J., age 47, grows rice for her livelihood. She started farming when she married Melchor J., a farmer in her village. She has four children and wants to send all of them to school.

To do it, she needs to expand her farm. However, she needs additional capital to buy fertilizer and chemicals. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

Now, she is more delighted with CEVI services. CEVI provides not just loans to people, but education to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:

Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Imelda's 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.
