With the profit, Badamhand pays her youngest son's university tuition and she also invested in her eldest son Batbold's grocery store business. Since her business inventory has decreased she is requesting a loan to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To purchase sheep meat for her business

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida O. is an abiding resident citizen of San Isidro Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, happily married and blessed with six school-aged children. She is a good member and business partner of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since she became a member/client of the Cooperative.

Currently she is into an Agri-Business Venture and owns a business of raising crops and selling them to Public Markets and to its regular customers. She has owned and operated the business for 15 years now. In order to be more productive with her business operations, she availed herself of a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase fertilizers such as animal manure & other types of fertilizers which suits the needs of her business. With this she knew that she could uplift the general loving conditions of her family both financially and emotionally.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna H., 45, is a new member of PMPC. She is married with 4 school-aged children and lives in San Isidro Bajo. She owns and operates her own business in the food sector. She earns ~PHP 1,500 from making and selling snacks and delicacies in the community. She has happily enjoyed doing the business for 10 years. She is now requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients to make food products for sale. She hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food products for sale

loans.name: Chon's Group

texts.en:
This loan is for a small group of five low-income people who live in Siem Reap province. Chon S., 36, has been chosen as leader of this group loan by the other members.

Chon S. is a single mother blessed with two teenage children. One of her children works in a restaurant and receives a fixed salary and the other attends school. To generate a daily income, Chon S. sells used clothing in, and around the outside of, a local market. She earns around $2 USD per day. She has now attracted a large number of regular customers so her business is going well, but she complains that she lacks money to expand and upgrade her successful investment. She is therefore requesting a loan in order to accrue a larger quantity of clothing to sell.

R. will use the loan to build a new house to make family living conditions more comfortable.

R., a fish catcher, will use the loan to buy a boat for fishing.

S. will use the loan to purchase more nets for fishing.

C. is looking for a loan to buy a machine to adapt an existing boat for fishing purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of clothing to sell

loans.name: Merelou

texts.en:
Merelou M., 34, is from the town of San Isidro Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Merelou owns and operates a business venture running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products to the local community members. Merelou has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns ~1,800 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merelou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merelou is requesting a loan of 1,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод Худойдотов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Дилшод по специальности "историк". По специальности он проработал более 5 лет. В данный момент он занимается предоставлением услуги "ювелира" на дому. Кредит просит для того, чтобы арендовать магазин в центре города, т.к. там есть возможность  завести побольше клиентов.
texts.en:
Dilshod H. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. Dilshod's profession is a historian in which he worked for more than five years. Now he is a jeweler and works from home. He is asking for a loan to rent out a store in the center of the town so he will have an opportunity to have more customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent out a store in the center of town

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa E. has 5 children: 2 are high school students and 3 are elementary school students. Her husband is also her partner in their bamboo mat business, which was set up from small capital provided by PMPC. Marissa is a microfinance member of Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. She wants to improve her business so that she can get more customers for her "amakan" (bamboo mat) business. She has repaid her past loans and is thankful to PMPC for helping her with insurance and savings deposit for her entire family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her bamboo mat business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: “Leaf for shelter”…This is the main source of income for Mrs. Eva S., 49, a widow, and a resident of Dupol, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 2 children: one is single and works in Manila City, and second is married and cares for his own family. Mrs. Eva S. is presently engaged in buying and selling of “Nipa”, a leaf of a tree from the palm family which is used for shelter, particularly for making roofs, and is sometimes used in making walls of houses. She started this business 18 years ago with an initial capital of PHP 20,000 from PMPC. Although she receives a monthly pension from her late husband, she is eager to continue with this business as it generates additional income for the family and as she can employ her neighbors in her “nipa” forming (paod) business. She joined PMPC in February 2009 and has had a good credit record. She is now applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 as additional capital for her existing business. She plans to expand her business to other municipalities and cities near Misamis Occidental and Zamboanga Del Sur.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Nipa" buying and selling business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Before having her own farm, Cecilia N. was worried about meeting her expenses. She is a rice grower (owns a half hectare farm) and a mother of one child. Currently she is busy preparing the soil for the next planting. She needs additional capital to purchase 30 liters of crude oil and to pay the laborers.

With help from CEVI, she has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 as additional capital to grow her farm.

She actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings in her village and enjoys availing CEVI’s services such as loans, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase 30 liters of crude oil and to pay laborers

loans.name: Uhtamchon

texts.ru: Ухтамчон Гафуров проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Ухтамчон по специальности "шофер". Он имеет грузовую автомашину, на котором более 20 лет занимается перевозками. Кредит просит для отремонтирования машины, т.к. этот вид услуги является основным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Uhtamchon G. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 46 years old. He is married and has four children. Uhtamchon's profession is a driver. He has a truck on which he has worked and transported goods for more than twenty years. He is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle because this type of service is his main source of income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a truck

loans.name: Irmia

texts.en: Irmia M. owns and operates a general store.  She is selling a variety of different products to local communities.  She is 56 years old, married and blessed with three adult children.  She has had the store for 10 years now at San Isidro Bajo.  She earns an approximate income of PHP 2,500 per month from the business.  She joined Paglaum MPC and is now availing her first cycle loan.  The amount will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She desires to live comfortably and save for their future. She is hopeful too to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rona Group

texts.en:
Rona is the group leader of Rona group. There are two members in this group and they have requested a group loan of 20,000 Afghani.

Rona wants to take a loan for her husband’s mobile-selling business. He wants to make his shop larger.

Hafeza wants to take a loan for her son’s general store business.

They both thank AFSG and all Kiva lenders for helping the poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge her husband’s mobile-selling shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen I. is a rice grower and a mother of five children. As a young mother, she has been doing her best to be able to feed and clothe her children well. Now, the family is tilling a 1-hectare farm. The harvest greatly helped them in raising income to pay the schools and other family needs.

She is asking for a loan worth PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying the herbicide and fertilizer needs of her farm. 

CEVI helps her small business grow. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide and fertilizers

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Muth V., 46, is married with three children living at home in the Takeo province. She is a fortuneteller, typically making US$3 each day and her husband sells natural medicines. Her husband, Nov Tith, typically makes about US$2 each day. Two of the children are students and one is a mechanic, repairing motorbikes to earn approximately US$3 every day to help support the family. Muth V. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase mechanic tools for her son to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic tools.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано Ризоева проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 40 лет. Разведена, имеет 3 детей. Рано более 5 лет занимается бизнесом, торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует разными хозяйственными вещами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rano R. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 40 years old. She is divorced and has three children. Rano has been doing business for more than five years, she is in retail. She has a vendor spot on the market where she sells different types of home products. She is asking for a loan to increase circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Thelma O. is a rice grower. She manages a hectare (2.5 acres) of farmland that provides her family with all their needs. Aside from the farm that she has managed for years now, she is also starting a new business, which is pigs.

Because to start a business is a bit expensive, Thelma would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers for her farm and, for her pigs, two sacks of Lactatex feed and two sacks of Gestatex feed.

Thelma is active in the CEVI credit program. CEVI provides her with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is a rice farmer. She is 46 years old and has three children. She would like to grow her business even more but, because she doesn't have enough resources, she intends applying for a loan of Php 6,000. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers for her farm and, for her pigs, two sacks of Lactatex feed and two sacks of Gestatex feed.

Myrna is still joining the CEVI cluster meetings. She enjoys having the CEVI services like credit, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат Хамдамова проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Муж имеет хлебопекарню, где печет национальные лепешки. Она же сама имеет торговую точку, где торгует этими лепешками. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота. На полученную прибыль хотят сыграть свадьбу дочери.
texts.en:
Sanoat H. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband owns a bakery, where he makes traditional flatbread. Sanoat also has a retail stand, where she sells the flatbread. She is requesting a loan to increase her product turnover. They want to use resulting profits to hold their daughter’s wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L. is a microfinance member of Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband is a construction worker and has supported her farm business for years already.

Farming is what Arlene enjoys most. That's why she is happy that she became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative because she can obtain a loan and, most especially, she can benefit from savings and insurance for her whole family. She wishes to live comfortably, with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her farm

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline G. manages a small rice field. She is 40 years old and has four children who are all studying in school. She wants to send them to college but, because of poverty, she is afraid that she might not be able to do it. Young as she is, Evangeline will never just give up easily. She is doing all her best to be able to grow her farm even more. She needs a loan to buy the two bags of fertilizers and ammonium sulfate needed on her farm. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides all its clients with not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of fertilizers and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Salimchon

texts.ru: Салимчон Салимов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 24 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Салимчон имеет торговую точку, где торгует музыкальными и видеодисками.  Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 6 лет. Клиент на полученную сумму хочет увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Salimchon S. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 24 years old, married and has no children. Salimchon has a retail store, where he sells music and movies. He has been involved in this business for over 6 years. Client wants to use this loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie R. owns a small rice field in her village. She is 31 years old and has four children studying. She knows very well how hard it is having a family, especially that they are just too dependent on the size of their harvest. Margie would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase a sack of urea and a bag of ammonium sulfate. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to improve the normal yield of their farm. CEVI helps their small business grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Haidarkul

texts.ru: Хайдаркул Чуракулов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 59 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Хайдаркул имеет вулканизацию, где предоставляет услуги по отремонтированию машин. Этим видом услуги занимается более 5 лет. Кредит просит для покупки оборудывания, чтобы предоставлять услуги "балансировки".
texts.en:
Haidarkul C. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 59 years old, married and has 6 children. He owns a tire retreading shop, where he provides auto repair service. He has been involved in this business for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of equipment in order to provide balancing services.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balancing equipment

loans.name: Ma. Cynthia

texts.en: Ma. Cynthia R. grows rice for a living. She is a widow already and now it’s only her two children helping her to manage and run their business. Cynthia needs additional capital to buy the fertilizers and chemicals needed to grow their harvest. The two-hectare (5-acre) farm that she tills is what has kept their family sustained up until now. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia R. wants to improve the normal size of her harvest. She is 28 years old and has three children. To supplement their income, she also grows vegetables in their village. Currently they only have a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) farm. She wants to buy another farm in the future and that is why she is trying so hard to grow her business more. Letecia would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase pesticides and and insecticides for her farm. She believes that protecting the crops from pests and insects that may inflict damage and affect yield is a better way to improve her harvest. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. is a rice farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is 27 years old and has one child. Her dream is to have a stable income for her family. She also desires a bountiful harvest to be able to provide a brighter future for her family.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 that she will use to purchase three sacks of fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will help her grow the size of her harvest and provide income for her family as well. 

Now, Jocelyn is actively joining in the CEVI credit program. She obtains not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Bahrullo

texts.ru: Нозимов Бахрулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Бахрулло по профессии "шофер", он по специальности работал более 10 лет. В данный момент он более 6 лет занимается предоставлением услуги "такси". Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Bahrullo N. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Bahrullo's profession is a driver in which he worked for more than ten years. Now he has been providing taxi services for more than six years. He is asking for a loan to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
33-year old Wennie C. manages a small rice field in her village. She has five children and the income that she gets from growing rice is basically what she uses to buy their needs. Aside from rice, she also grows vegetables in their backyard. This also helps the family to earn additional income since most of the people in their village like vegetables.

Now, she needs additional capital to run her business. The loan will really go far in buying the herbicides and fertilizers needed on her farm.

Like other CEVI clients, Wennie is enjoying the CEVI credit services and the training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Клиентка Толибова Дилафруз занимается торговлей уже 5-лет.Возраст 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Проживает в городе Душанбе. Клиентка имеет собственную торговую точку, которая находится в городе Душанбе на рынке "Шохмансур". Клиентка  торгует  женской и мужской одеждой. Толибова Дилафруз закупает товар на рынке "Корвон". Она просит 1000 долларов сроком на 10 месяцев,  для пополнения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Dilafruz T. has been in the retail business for five years now. She is 36 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. The client has own vendor spot which is located in Dushanbe on the Shohmansur market. She sells women's and men's clothing. Dilafruz buys the merchandise on the market Korvon. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1000 dollars for a term of 10 months to increase circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun P., 38, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with her five children in Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$5 each day, while her husband works recharging batteries. Her husband makes about US$5 each day as well.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Oeun P. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for their transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар Ташарипова проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 40 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Дилбар более 5 лет занимается бизнесом. Она имеет торговую точку, где торгует разными мелочами, т.е. мороженым, напитками и т.д. Ей в этом также помогают ее дети. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Dilbar T. lives in the Gissar region. She is 40 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Dilbar has been doing business for more than five years. She has a retail spot where she sells all kinds of small stuff such as ice cream, drinks and etc. Her children also help her in this. She is asking for a loan to increase turnover of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Yar Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Y. M. is the group leader of Y. M. group. There are five members in this group and each of them would like to receive money for their business. Therefore, they have requested a group loan of 50,000 Afghani. 

Y. M. wants to take a loan for his business as a taxi driver.

M. Hasham and Laylama want to take a loan for their general store businesses.

A. kafell wants to take a loan for his metal-shop business. He has just begun his business wants to develop it.

Zowjana wants to take a loan for her beading business.

They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and thank AFSG and Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S., 34, has been working as a vegetable-seller since 2000 in her village in Battambong province. S. works so hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for her family.

S. is married and lives with her husband who is involved in the business with her, too. They both can earn collectively a typical income of US$15 per day. She has four children: three of her children are attending a local primary school, and the other one is employed as a building contractor.

S. wants to take a loan of US$1,200 as her first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to expand her inventory by purchasing more vegetables of various kinds.

loans.use: To purchasing more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vor

texts.en:
Vor A., 39, pictured with her husband, is married and lives in Takeo province with her three young children. She works as a farmer and is typically able to make US$2 each day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, as food prices have also been high.

Vor’s husband works as a construction worker and typically makes US$3 every day. Vor has seen an opportunity to expand her husband’s business and wants to take out a loan to make a new investment. She is asking for US$500 to purchase a motorbike for him to operate a moto-taxi business when he has free time from construction. She feels that this new aspect of her husband’s business will allow him to increase his income and to raise the standard of living of the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start her husband's business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie A. is a rice farmer. She is 46 years old and has three children. Aside from the rice farm, she also ventured into a pig business. She is doing all these things to be able to support the growing needs of her family. 

Elsie would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 that she will use to purchase two bags of urea fertilizer and farm chemicals. She believes that by doing so, she will be able to improve the size of her harvest, thus increasing the income of her family as well.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of urea fertilizer and farm chemicals

loans.name: Tek

texts.en:
Tek H., 53, works as a farmer in Battambong province, growing corn. She also owns an orchard of sapodilla trees, which are a kind of tropical fruit tree. H. works so hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for her family.

H. is married and lives with her husband (pictured) who is involved in the business with her too, and they both can earn collectively a typical income of US$9 per day. H. and her husband are blessed with a twenty-year-old daughter who works as a hairdresser in a local beauty shop.

H. wants to take a loan of US$1,200 as her first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to rent a tractor in order to level her farmland to do more corn and fruit-tree cultivation.

loans.use: To rent a tractor to level her farmland

loans.name: Larch

texts.en:
Larch K. is a 51-year-old woman who lives in Takeo province. She is married and has two school-aged children. In the photo, Larch is shown at home with her husband.

Larch and her husband started a business venture selling fruit and vegetables. Larch has been engaged in this business for over eight years. From this activity, Larch earns approximately 20,000 riel, or about US$5 a day.

Larch joined CREDIT MIF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from CREDIT. She is requesting a loan of US$1,000 which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
46-year-old Feliza R. is a rice farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has four children and a supportive husband who helps her manage their 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) farm. Her dream for her children is that all of them will be able to graduate from college so that, when they are older, they will be able to provide their families with a better future.

Feliza would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase herbicides and fertilizers. These two items are very important, especially in ensuring a quality and abundant harvest.

Now, Feliza actively joins in the CEVI cluster meetings where she obtains CEVI's credit services, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa G. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 47 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom S., 37, has been working as a teacher in a local primary school in his village in Battambong Province since 2001. He earns a typical income of US$2 per day.

S. is married and lives with his wife, who is a farmer who plants corns and also a grocery seller. With her current jobs, she is typically able to generate US$6.50 per day. They are blessed with two young children who do not yet attend school.

S. wants to take a loan of US$1,000 for the first time from Kiva partner, CREDIT, for his wife to purchase more various kinds of groceries for sale. He wants to save his income for his children’s education and expanding his wife’s current business. (S.'s wife is presented in the picture)

loans.use: To purchasing more groceries for his wife to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a carpenter since 2001 to provide, along with his brother, better living conditions for his parents. Today, Mahdi is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase a specific machine to cut wood in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a chancellor for his business

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa R. is a 39-year-old mother of five. She is a rice grower in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. From time to time, she is busy visiting her farm with the help of her husband, Jebrick R..

She needs additional capital to run her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to purchase certified rice seeds and 2 sacks of fertilizer. The loan will really help her achieve maximum harvest from their farm.

CEVI helps their clients grow their business. Like Adelfa, all CEVI clients receive not just loans but education as well about savings to mange their businesses well.

loans.use: For seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth S., age 49, has been involved with her business sewing on her own in Battambong Province since 2006. Typically, she makes US$4 per day. S. and her husband work very hard all day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for their family. They are blessed to have four children: three of them are enrolled in a local school, and the oldest one is employed at a gas station. S.'s husband is a teacher at a public school in their village and makes approximately US$1 per day.

S. wants to take out a loan of US$1,000 US to purchase a new motorbike for her husband; and with the remainder, she wants to use it to repair her house. She hopes that a new motorbike will allow her husband to go to work much easier and thus generate more income for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband and to repair her house

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth C. lives in the town of Lantay,Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old, married, has six school-aged children and makes a living running a sari-sari (or variety) store. Jeneth just started this business, but is confident that she will be successful selling various items to the people of her community.

Earlier this year, Jeneth joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy items to sell and expand the range of goods available in her store. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to educate her children and improve her family's living standards. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Seoub

texts.en:
Seoub S., 37, is married and lives in Battambong province with her five children. Daily, she is busy with her work of raising pigs, making around US$4. Her husband is a construction foreman who commutes from place to place for his business, typically making US$7 each day.

S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase pigs to raise. Raising pigs is a good way for her to generate some extra income for her family, and she will be able to raise her standard of living. It is a difficult time economically for most Cambodians because inflation has soared. However, S. sees these pigs as a good opportunity for her to help her family and to make it through these difficult times.

loans.use: Buying more pigs to raise

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline G. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector buying and selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community. Evangeline is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en:
Yeyen C. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old. Yeyen is married. To make a living, Yeyen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling personal home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Yeyen is just starting this business.

In 2009, Yeyen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yeyen successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Yeyen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Yeyen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie C.'s dream for her children is for them to finish a degree. She is 29 years old and married to Norberto C., a rice farmer in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. Now, they are renting a 4-hectare farm. Someday, she said, they will be able to buy their own farm to support the growing needs of their family.

Norie would like to ask a loan of Php 5,000. She will use the loan purchase herbicides and fertilizers. By making this move, she thinks she will have better yield now than she did with her previous harvest.

Through CEVI, Norie has been able to sustain her livelihood up to now. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vit  avec son époux et ses trois enfants dans le quartier d’apédokoè un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé près du quartier d’adidogomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois.  Elle est la seule à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier. Elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  30 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandises. Elle s’approvisionne à sokodé où le sac de charbons de bois est moins coûteux, ainsi elle réalise une plus grosse marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes.
texts.en:
This is a married woman, who is the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in Apédokoè, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Lomé, near the Adidogomé quarter. Her business consists in selling charcoal. She's the only one in this business in her neighborhood. She's currently out of stock, and in order to resupply, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy – and pay for the transport of – 30 sacks or charcoal. She gets her supplies in Sokodé, where charcoal is less expensive, so that her profit margin is higher.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy – and pay for the transport of – 30 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Esther is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2008, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esther from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
Ana Fe R. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Ana Fe is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ana Fe owns & operates a business buying and selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish in the local community. Ana Fe has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (about $313 US) a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Ana Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ana Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Mercy Grace

texts.en:
Mercy Grace L. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Mercy Grace is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy Grace owns & operates a retail business selling homemade products including peanut butter and dried fish in the local community. Mercy Grace is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Mercy Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercy Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adyasuren

texts.en:
Adyasuren Y. is a 47-year-old married man with four children between the ages of 10 and 25. His family lives in Harhorin, Mongolia's ancient capital city. His spouse Amar, 48, is unemployed and therefore stays home. His second child, Batsuh, 24, got just married and started living apart on his own.

Adyasuren is a welder. He makes iron stuff such as stoves, house roofs, and fence doors using thin and thick black iron and thin white iron. Mostly local residents and herders give him orders for stoves, stove tubes, etc. He has been running this business since 1990. For many years, it was the only source of income for his family. Starting this year, his eldest child started working and now helps to increase the family's income. Adyasuren is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Gemma owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Sochida

texts.ru: Сочида Курбонова проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 35 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Сочида более 5 лет занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. Она в основном торгует сухофруктами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sochida K. lives in the Gissar region. She is 35 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Sochida has been doing retail business in the central market for more than five years. She mostly sells dry fruits. She is asking for a loan to increase turnaround.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en: 27-year old Jonaliza F. manages a small rice field. She is not married yet and she plans to have a stable business before becoming engaged to be married. Aside from having a farm, she also raises pigs and has been doing these things to be able to help pay the expenses in her home. Jonaliza would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of complete fertilizer and herbicide. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of complete fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Raising pigs for sale is what Jovita T. loves to do. For fifteen years, she has enjoyed the business that primarily supports her family. She is 45 years old and has three children.

Jovita was recognized as an official PMPC member in 2007 and has religiously paid back her loan of PHP 20,000. Now she is requesting a new loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She deeply wishes that the profits will support the needs of her family and other family members, too.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma L. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Wilma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business selling used clothing in the local community. Wilma is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education of her children and supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada E. is 63 years old, is a widow, and lives at San Isidro. She has six adult children. She engages in agricultural business- planting and selling vegetables. She has been into this business for years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month.

Librada contacted PMPC for a loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticides. She hopes to make improvements to her house for a more comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita T. is from the village of Katipa. She is 55 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Anita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Anita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy F. is a 19-year-old rice grower from Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. Though she is still young, she has the ambition that, someday, she will be able to uplift their lives out of poverty.

Because her family is not able to support her education, Ivy engages herself in a farming business. However, she needs additional capital to keep going in her business, especially in buying urea fertilizer and herbicides. She hopes that, by buying these things, she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

CEVI helps Ivy grow her livelihood. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase a bag of urea fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика Худоерова проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 27 лет. Разведена, имеет 1 ребенка. Малика имеет среднее техническое образование. Она более 5 лет занимается пашивом одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. Кредит просит для закупа сырья, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Malika H. lives in the Gissar region. She is 27 years old. She is divorced and has one child. Malika has a technical secondary education. She has been sewing clothing for more than five years. She does this at home. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials so she can provide quality services.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Toet

texts.en: The smiling person shown in the picture above is Toet S., 32, at work on the farm. She has been farming rice for more than ten years. In addition, she has built a small stall next to her house where she raises a few pigs for sale. To help her with the hard labor on the farm, her husband works with her in growing the rice crop. Toet S. is married and has been blessed with two school-aged children. Toet S. will be using the loan to add to her little personal savings to purchase a small plot of neighbor’s farmland which she will use to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To purchase a small plot of neighbor’s farmland

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
31-year-old rice-grower, Merlita C., is dreaming of an abundant harvest on her farm. She has four children and a supportive husband, Gerardo C., who helps her manage their small business. Currently, they are tilling a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm, which Merlita acquired from her parents.

Merlita would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000. She intends buying the fertilizers, rice seed and chemicals needed to ensure an abundant harvest. She believes that CEVI could help her achieve that dream so that she will be able to better support the needs of her family.

Now, Merlita joins in the CEVI cluster meetings. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seed and chemicals

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma P. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Norma owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling snacks like banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer), camote cue (variations of cooked plantain rolled in sugar) and pancakes in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In July 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty L. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Betty owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In July 2009, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Betty is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
"When my parents gave me the 3-hectare (7.5-acre) rice farm after my marriage, I made a promise to them to value it and make it productive," says Edgardo T., 47-year-old father of four children. He is doing his best to become a good father and a provider for his family.

Edgardo would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 and will use the loan to purchase two bags of complete fertilizer and chemicals. The loan will really help him ensure a quality and abundant harvest on his farm.

Now, Edgardo still joins in the CEVI cluster meetings. He obtains from CEVI various services like loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To pay the farm laborer and to buy fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Chunaidullo

texts.ru: Чунайдулло Гузиев проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена работает колхозницей. Чунайдулло более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает рис и продает его на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить урожай.
texts.en:
Chunaidullo G. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 31 years old, married and has four children. His wife works on the farm. Chunaidullo has been in agriculture for more than five years. He grows rice and sells it on the market. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to sow a harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow rice

loans.name: Amsatou

texts.fr: D. est une jeune femme  très motivée qui s’est lancée en 2004 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, très tôt elle a maîtrisé tout les contours de ce commerce et a pu gagner la confiance de beaucoup de clients. Sa clientèle croît, elle veut aussi agrandir son stock pour pouvoir les satisfaire convenablement, elle sollicite alors un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 3 cartons de tomates concentrées, 3 cartons de savons, 2 bidons d’huile, 7 pagnes  et 2 sacs d’haricots.
texts.en:
D. is a very motivated woman who, in 2004, started selling food staples. Early on, she got to know the ins and outs of this business, and managed to earn the trust of many customers. Her clientele is growing, and she thus wants to increase her stock to adequately meet demand. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase 10 sacks of rice, 3 boxes of tomato concentrate, 3 boxes of soaps, 2 cans of oil, 7 pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 2 sacks of beans.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice, 3 boxes of tomato concentrate, 3 boxes of soaps, 2 cans of oil, 7 pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 2 sacks of beans.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion D. is a 58-year-old widow and the mother of three children. She has a small rice farm which is 1 hectare (2.5 acres) in size. She dreams of making it more productive in honor of her parents who gave her the farm.

Now, Exaltacion needs a little help to keep going with her business. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase two bags complete fertilizer and chemicals.

Exaltacion chose CEVI because of its services. CEVI provides not just loans but education as well to enable entrepreneurs to manage their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase two bags complete fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene E. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three school-aged children. Arlene owns and operates a service-based business, providing beauty services like manicure and pedicure to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Salman

texts.ru: Салман Сулаймонов проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 26 лет. Женат, детей не имеет.Салман более 3 лет занимаетося торговлей фруктов и овощей. Он закупает у населения продаваемый урожай и продает его в городе Душанбе. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Salman S. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 26 years old, married and has no children. Salman has been selling fruits and vegetables for over 3 years. He buys harvest that is made available for sale from people and sells it in the city of Dushanbe. He is requesting a loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn D. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Jennelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennelyn owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community. Jennelyn is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Jennelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jennelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 60 years old and a widow with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs and other items. She lives in Benin City, Edo. State.

She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs like rice, beans, peppers, and other items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
When Cholpon got married she learned many things regarding keeping a household in a rural area. She learned how to keep cattle. Now she is divorced and the sole supporter of her family. Her family consists of her 55 year old disabled sister and 18 year old son, a college student.

She makes living by selling milk but her income is not sufficient to meet her family's needs. Her current income is just thirty five dollars.

During fifteen years of keeping cattle, she has managed to repair her house and pay for her son’s college education.

Cholpon needs a loan to buy hay for her cattle. At this time of year, hay prices are low. She is planning to grow wheat and saving money to buy a house for her son.

Kulpira, Mars and Maikul are Cholpon’s partners. Kulpira is a 49 year old widower. She has one daughter and a grandson. Except for working in a kindergarten, she farms land she inherited after her husband’s death. She needs a loan to pay for grass. She wants to keep part of her supply for winter time and sell the rest.

Mars is 31. He sells foodstuffs: alcoholic drinks, bread, detergents, etc. His monthly income is $165. He understands that as his children grow up, he needs to expand his business to make more profits. A loan would let him purchase more goods and increase turnover.

Maikul is a widow. She is a mother of three children. For the last 15 years she has been a school teacher. Besides that, she sells milk and rears her grandchild. She earns $70 a month. She needs a loan to pay for hay cutting and transportation expenses. --------------------------------------------------------------- Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: Purchase hay for livestock.

loans.name: Essohouna

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, elle exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’elle appelle « Ets PETIT A PETIT », elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2008 mais elle dispose déjà d’une grande clientèle. Pour bien répondre à leur demande, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 4 cartons de lait « NESTLE »,  3 cartons de boîtes de lait « PEACK » en poudre, 4 bidons de 25 litres d’huile « NIOTO » et divers. 
elle est mariée et subvient aux charges de sa famille grâce au revenu de sa famille.
texts.en:
The business of this woman consists in selling food staples in her own shop, called "Ets PETIT A PETIT". She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She started this business in 2008, but she already has a large clientele. To adequately meet demand, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to increase her stock and buy 4 boxes of NESTLE milk, 3 boxes of PEACK powdered milk, 4 25-liter cans of NIOTO oil, and various other products. She's married and her income enables her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 boxes of milk, 3 boxes of powdered milk, and 4 25-liter cans of oil

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Mamerto F. is a rice farmer. He is 56 years old and has three children. As a father, he wants to provide for them, all their needs and give them a high quality life.

He is requesting a loan of php 6,000 to purchase four sacks of fertilizer and four sacks of Urea. Profits will help him pay for their home.

Now, he actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings. He avails various CEVI services like loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and Urea.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Beatriz M. nasceu na cidade de maputo tem 41 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais dois freqüentam escola e com idades compreendidas entre 7 e 24 anos.

Beatriz interrompeu os estudos na 7 classe devido à gravidez precoce. Actualmente vive sozinha na casa própria juntamente com os filhos depois que o marido lhe abandonou por muito tempo. Foi nessas circunstancias que os pais dela decidiram pedir lhe para que voltasse a casa para fazer o negocio de restaurante, trabalho que faz ate data hoje. É dona do negocio que exerce nessas instalações cedidas pelos pais, a mais de 7 anos. Aprendeu fazendo e tinha sempre o apoio por parte dos pais.

É primeira vez que solicita empréstimo bancário. Com o credito de 14.000,00MT pretende comprar produtos, para reforçar o negocio.teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas que também são clientes.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder outros empréstimos para realizar o grande sonho de construir um estabelecimento próprio.
texts.en:
Beatriz M. was born in the city of Maputo, she is 41 years old and has 3 children, two of them are in school and their ages are between 7 and 24 years old. Beatriz interrupted her studies when she was on the 7th grade because she got pregnant. Currently she lives alone with her children after her husband left. It was under these circumstances that her parents asked her to come back to start the restaurant business, where she works until now. She is the owner of the business now after her parents gave it to her 7 years ago. She learned by doing and always has her parents support. This is the first time she is requesting a bank loan. With the 14.000MT loan she wants to buy products to improve her business. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends who are also clients. She expects to pay the credit without problems to access new ones and fulfill her dream of building her own restaurant.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy first necessity products

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce depuis 2004 le commerce de charbons de bois, elle y a associé le commerce de tubercules. Elle est en rupture de stock de charbons de bois, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois et 15 tas de tubercules. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes.
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Since 2004, this woman has been selling charcoal, and also yams. She's out of stock of charcoal, and want to resupply. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of charcoal and 15 piles of yams. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country, which enables her to increase her profit margin. Being unmarried, it is with the income of her business that she provides for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of charcoal and 15 piles of yams

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita P. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Tita is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling used clothing in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Tita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional clothes. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Dodarbek

texts.ru: Чононов Додарбек проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Додарбек более 3 лет работал "медбратом". В данный момент он более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяством. Он выращивает арбуз, лук и морковь, а потом продает на рынке. Кредит просит для сбора урожая и нового посева.
texts.en:
Dodarbek C. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Dodarbek had worked as a nurse for over 3 years. Currently, he has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He grows watermelons, onions and carrots and then sells them at a market. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and sowing fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Normumin

texts.en:
D. Normumin is 52 years old. He is married and has seven children. Normumin produced the national chest box used to save the dowry of brides. The national chest in Tajikistan is made of wood and very colorful. Normumin has been in this business for 20 years. He strives to improve his family's living conditions.

Because of the high demand for his products, Normumin requests a loan of 3500 Somoni to purchase raw material to produce more chests. Normumin thanks all lenders who are giving him a chance to get ahead. ----------------------------------------------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase raw material for production of the chest.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions, including drinks and foodstuffs. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Comfort is requesting a loan of N40000 to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs, and other provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs, and other provisions to sell

loans.name: Lizete

texts.pt:
Lizete M. nasceu no distrito municipal da catembe, tem 37 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 14 e 21 anos. O mais velho frequnta 10 classe na escola secundaria da catembe. Vive também com uma sobrinha sob sua responsabilidade na casa própria.

Lizete cresceu com os seus pais, mas muito cedo teve que interromper a escola na 6 classe para emigrar a África do sul para trabalhar para durante 13 anos.
Em 2004 casou se e passa a viver com o marido no distrito de Boane (matola rio) este que edifica um pequeno estabelecimento comercial com o intuito de vender produtos de primeira necessidade, trabalho que faz a mais de 2 anos de experiência e conta com uma empregada.

Aprendeu fazendo, mas também com ajuda das amigas que lhe dão coragem e dicas para melhor gerir o negocio.
Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e é pela primeira vez que solicita o empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de diversos produtos de primeira necessidade. Pretende aumentar o volume do negocio satisfazer a demanda.
