Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder os outros empréstimos para cumpri o sonho de ampliar o estabelecimento comercial e expandir para novas zonas circunvizinhas.
texts.en:
Lizete M. was born in Catembe. She is 37 years old and has 3 children between the ages of 14 and 21. The eldest is in 10th grade in the school in Catembe. She also lives with a niece under her care, in a house she owns. Lizete grew up with her parents, but had to leave school in 6th grade in order to emigrate to South Africa and work for 13 years. In 2004 she married and went to live with her husband in Boane (Matola Rio). She opened a small shop for staple goods. She has more than two years of experience and has one employee. She learned on the job, but her friends' support gave her courage and hints on how to improve her business. She's never had loans with other institutions, and this is the first time she's requested a loan. The loan is in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase a variety of staple goods. She plans to expand her business in order to satisfy demand. She intends to pay off the loan without problems and request others in order to achieve her dream of expanding her shop to serve nearby areas.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple goods

loans.name: Akossivi

texts.fr: Cette femme a embrassé un commerce qui lui réussit bien, elle exerce dans la vente des articles de mercerie, après étude d’autres besoins de sa clientèle, elle a associé à la vente des articles de mercerie le commerce de produits de beauté. Son stock d’article de mercerie a baissé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et agrandir en même temps le stock de produits de beauté. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES.
texts.en:
This woman started a business that works well for her, namely selling sewing supplies. After surveying the needs of her clientele, she also started selling cosmetics. Her stock of sewing supplies has dropped, and she wants to resupply and, at the same time, increase her stock of cosmetics. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Aqelah Group

texts.en:
Aqelah is the group leader of Aqelah group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their own businesses: Nasema and Saleha want to take a loan for the business of tailoring, and Aqelah would like to take a loan for her father's vegetable business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families better.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Rahmidin

texts.ru: Мухридинов Рахмидин проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена колхозница. рахмидин более 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает рис и продает его. Кредит просит для сбора и повторного посева урожая риса и пшеницы.
texts.en:
Rahmidin M. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 29 years, married and has 3 children. His wife is a farmer. Rahmidin has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He grows rice and sells it. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing of rice and wheat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and new sowing of rice and wheat

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn M. is from the village of Puntian, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily from selling RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to pay the registration fee of a small van (multicab) used as a transportation vehicle in their community. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Soatmumin

texts.en:
K. Soatmumin is 60 years old, married and has two children. He has had a trying life, but he keeps an optimistic outlook. He is a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living.

Soatmumin sells fuel like: petrol and diesel fuel at his own fuel station. Soatmumin’s children are adults and help their dad with the business.

Today Soatmumin is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to increase sales. He sincerely thanks you.

------------------------------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase goods to sell to expand his business.

loans.name: Lira's Group

texts.en:
The group’s leader Lira. She sells milk products and eggs. These days she barely sees her husband as he works in the field. He grows wheat, barley and clover. They have three children. Their eldest son is serving in the army. The other son and daughter are at home. After the collapse of Soviet Union, they obtained a piece of land and started farming. They put in all their energy and devotion to obtain a good harvest and were able to buy a house and car.

Now their monthly income is $290. They need a loan to buy gas to cultivate their land and to purchase chickens. They are hoping for a good harvest this year and when it happens they plan to buy a new lorry and some livestock: a horse, cows and sheep. They are making plans to help their son find a job, after he completes his serve in the army.

Lira’s partners are excellent examples of hardworking people, who are not afraid to try new things. Damira, Gulnara and Istatai. Damira is forty eight. She sells milk and milk products. Her husband and son raise livestock and are farmers. Damira wants to get a loan to purchase hens, ducks, turkeys, to sell their eggs, chickens and ducklets.

Gulnara, a mother of three children is 46. She milks cows, sells milk and grows vegetables in her garden. Her husband looks after cows and works in the field. Their earnings constitute around $150 a month. Gulnara has decided to get a loan to purchase sheep for feeding, getting meat and wool for sale.

Istatai is a widower and mother of four children. She earns $120 by selling milk and hay. During twelve years of hard work she has been able to provide all her children with a proper high school education and now wants to start farming. However since it involves expenses she needs to obtain a loan. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: Purchase livestock.

loans.name: Heab's Group

texts.en:
Three low-income people are requesting this Kiva loan. They will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Heab N., 35, was selected to be the leader of this group by the other members. To earn a living, Heab N. currently raises pigs in a pigpen next to her house and plants a rice crop on her own farmland. Her family gets additional income from her husband, who works driving a motor taxi. This couple was married years ago and has been blessed with five children, two of whom are working in construction.

Heab N. has been raising pig for years; she learned this skill from her grandmother, who died of senility years ago. Heab N. currently succeeds in her daily work of raising pigs. Using this Kiva loan as the capital she needs, she hopes to buy another pig and feed it.

The other group members include S., a local cultivator, who is applying for a loan as a capital to begin selling grocery items and to buy a bicycle for traveling needs; and S., who will be using the loan to buy additional pigs to raise from home.

loans.use: To buy another pig and pig feed

loans.name: Sainiso

texts.en: Sainiso, 39 years old, is a widowed mother with a daughter. She has worked at selling children’s clothing for six years. Sainiso rises very early to prepare her garments in the market. She works with much diligence to see her daughter happy and to ensure that in the future she’ll be a professional and a good and respectful person. Sainiso's objective is to grow her business, which is why she is requesting this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of merchandise. With your help she will achieve her goal in very little time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for kids in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr:
Revendeur de charbons de bois, ce monsieur a fait face à la détérioration d’une partie de son stock de charbons de bois due à la pluie de ces derniers jours. il veut reconstituer son stock c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour acheter 30 sacs de charbons de bois.
il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a man who resells charcoal. Part of his stock was recently damaged by the rain. He wants to rebuild his stock, and is therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 30 sacks of charcoal. He's married and the father of 2 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 30 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Here is Nazgul, the leader of the group. Nazgul is the mother of three children. Her eldest son goes to college, whereas her two other sons go to kindergarten.

Even though her spouse is a farmer and in addition to that rents a warehouse, where he works as a salesman, Nazgul has a business of her own. She owns a pub and sells beer on tap. She showed her determination when she started her business nine years ago with only twelve and half dollars.

Nazgul used to work as a saleswoman in two shops. She saved some money and managed to buy back these shops. Eventually, she sold them to buy an empty building, and made it into a pub. Now she earns twenty five dollars monthly. During this time, she has been able to buy a new lodging – a two-room flat in the rural city of Tokmak – and has increased her turnover.

“I have a piece of land next to my pub, which is empty now. I am keen to build a big grocery store with a broad range of goods. This would help me attract more customers to my pub and increase my turnover! I am sure it would work if I got a loan,” exclaims Nazgul, as she points to the empty place.

Nazgul plans to bring her business to a high level while her sons are at school. Thus, she wants to ensure a secure future for her children. 

Nazgul’s partners are Jelmira, Kanchoro and Kuku.

Jelmira is thirty eight. She sells foodstuffs in a food store that she takes on lease. She needs a loan to purchase stationery before the school season. Her dream is to buy a house and move out from her flat.

Kanchoro is a widow and the mother of three children. At age of fifty two, she works as a security guard in Chui oblast’s tax inspection. She needs a loan to buy a new carpet.

Kuku is a widow as well. She has raised nine children. She sells women’s bags and needs a loan to buy a container. This would enable her to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Essomassina

texts.fr: Cette femme est veuve et a ses 04 enfants à sa charge. Elle exerce le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Voulant reconstituer son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow and is raising her four children by herself. She has a general store, and it is with the income from that business that she supports her family. She buys her supplies at the big market in Lomé. Wishing to replenish her stock, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy various grocery products for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
S. Bahodur has been selling clothing in the markets for the past 10 years. He started off helping his mother, but because of the need to help his family get ahead, he decided to work on his own. For the past 5 years the sale of clothing has been the main source of income for his family. Bahodur is requesting a loan for 3000 Somoni to buy merchandise in order to have a greater variety of products to offer his customers.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Sanamhol

texts.ru: Санамхол Худойкулова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама же клиентка занимается сельским хозяйством. она выращивает арбуз и рис. Кредит просит для сбора урожая и повторного посева. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать дом и женить сына.
texts.en:
Sanamhol H. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 44 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband works in Russia. Our client is involved in agriculture. She grows watermelons and rice. Sanamhol is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing. She wants to use resulting profits to repair her house and marry off her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and new sowing

loans.name: Zurafo

texts.en: Zurafo is a widow and has a son. Two years ago she started a little business selling women’s clothing in the local city market. Today her business is doing well. Zurafo is a focused, hard-worker. Many weeks she will work without days off to make sure her dearest son has everything he needs. Because of her cheerfulness and customer-friendly service, her total number of customers is constantly growing. Zurafo would like to get a loan of 3,000 Somoni to increase her available stock. One of her long-term plans is to open a new vending facility. She believes that this loan will help her succeed in her business endeavors and boost her economic activity. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women

loans.name: Logossouvi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce le métier de tailleur depuis près de 10 ans déjà, il dispose d’un atelier qu’il a appelé « ANNIS COUTURE », une de ses machines est tombée en panne or il a des commandes de ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir acheter une nouvelle machine afin de pouvoir exécuter les commandes de ses clients.
Il est marié et père de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been working as a tailor for almost 10 years already. He has a sewing workshop that he calls «ANNIS COUTURE». One of his sewing machines is broken but he has orders to fill from his clients. He is asking WAGES for a loan to buy a new machine so that he will be able to finish the orders for the customers.

He is married and the father of 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia E. is 70 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs and has been in the business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of N 70000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs  to sell

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en: F. Gairat has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and two children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Gairat provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Gairat sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. His wife (pictured) helps him with taking care of and feeding his animals. Currently Gairat needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of 3,000 Somoni. He thanks Kiva for the support that it presents to small entrepreneurs. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more young cattle to raise

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells foodstuffs like rice and other items. She lives in Benin City. She is 31 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs and other items to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. kokou a ouvert en 2001 un bar qu’il a appelé « CAFE CHAUD » dans le quartier d’adidogomé à Lomé. il ne dispose plus suffisamment de boissons pour servir ses clients il veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 casiers de boissons.
Etant marié et père de 03 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
In 2001, Mr. A. Kokou opened a bar that he calls «CAFE CHAUD» in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. He doesn't have enough drinks to serve his customers, so he would like to replenish and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 20 crates of drinks.

He is married and the father of 3 children and it is the income from his bar that allows him to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of drinks

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mr. Phen S. lives in Roka village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for rice cultivation. His wife, Mrs. Poeu Nim, is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. 

Thus, Mr. Phen S. decided to ask for a loan to expand his wife’s business. He is a 59-year-old father of five children. Two of the children are employed in a garment factory, while one stays at home to do housework and the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Normat

texts.en:
K. Normat is a humble man who earns a living in the cattle-farming business. He is the father of three children, who motivate him to work harder every day to be able to meet their needs. It is important to note that this business requires a lot of physical work, mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another, crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. This can cause illnesses and can weaken the body. Nonetheless, Normat continues to work hard and has now come to IMON International to obtain the loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Nozimchon

texts.ru: Бобокулов Нозимчон проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Нозимчон по специальности "налоговик". Но вот более 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает арбуз и лук. Некоторую часть для продажи, а некоторую для потребности семьи. Кредит просит для посева урожая.
texts.en:
Nozimchon B. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 28 years old, married and has 1 child. Nozimchon is a tax collector by trade. However, he has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He grows watermelons and onions; some for sale and some for his family’s use. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and sowing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akuvi  Mawuli

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la restauration, elle fait des plats togolais et sa spécialité est le plat de FUFU fait à base d’ignames pilés, elle a dénommé son restaurant « DA VERO ». Elle s’est fait une bonne réputation dans sa zone d’activité. Elle veut se réapprovisionner en produits nécessaires à l’activité de restauration, elle sollicite alors son premier crédit pour acheter 10 tas  d’ignames, 1 sac de riz et divers produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman works in food service. She makes Togolese dishes and her specialty is a dish called "fufu" made of pounded yams. She calls her little restaurant «DA VERO». She has earned a good reputation in her line of work. She wants to replenish her stocks of the products necessary for food preparation. She is therefore requesting her first loan to buy 10 piles of yams, 1 sack of rice, and various other ingredients for her business.

She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making cooked food to sell

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en: This group’s leader, Zamira, is 28. She earns her living by milking her cows and selling 15 liters of milk daily. Her husband, apart from helping her look after cows, works as a plumber. She has two children, a little son and a daughter. Six years ago, Zamira and her husband started dealing with real estate. After successfully selling some of their property, they bought a cow and a calf. They took a risk to put in $625, which was quite a large sum of money at that time. Now, they have turned it into a monthly income of $100. By means of saving money, they have obtained some necessary equipment for her husband’s work and a car. Zamira and her husband need a loan to buy another cow. This would enable them breed their cattle and increase its population. "Everything we do, we do for the sake of our children. Our son is growing up. Very soon, he will be going to school. So we need to purchase everything needed for his education, including stationary and (a) school uniform," says Zamira. Taalaibek, Suyorbubu and Kayir are in the same group with Zamira. Taalaibek is 40. He is married and has three children. Taalaibek provides for his family by collecting milk from local villagers and producing milk products. He sells these products in the city of Alma Ata. He needs a loan to purchase sheep and cows and to increase turnover. Kayir is 44. She sells yogurt that she produces from her cow’s milk, or from milk that she buys from other villagers. She urgently needs a new fridge to put the milk products in since the old one cannot contain all of her products. She cannot buy a fridge unless she obtains a loan. Suyorbubu is a housewife. She keeps a cow and sells milk. Some years ago she obtained a loan and bought a car. Since then, by selling milk she has managed to save enough money to buy new furniture for her son. She wants to obtain a loan to purchase calves and feed for them. After fattening them up, she is going to resell them. "Even though raising livestock requires certain amount of efforts, it is not that troublesome. In a rural area like ours, it is the most convenient business," says Suyorbubu with enthusiasm. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the three Ps concept: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit Partner 135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cows, calves, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mao K. is a villager in Srae Kouk village in Kandal province. She is a housewife who is taking care of her babies. 

Her husband, Mr. San Bunthorn, is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from the house, he has a problem, needing to reduce his expenditure on motor taxi fares. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Srey Mao K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband.

Mrs. Srey Mao K. is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are just five years and one year old. Her husband and two children are shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
En 2005 cette femme a commencé le commerce des articles de friperie, elle est une revendeuse ambulante et va chercher sa clientèle de maison en maison. Elle a reçu des commandes de ses clients, pour les satisfaire, elle doit se réapprovisionner, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 03 ballots de friperie.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2005, this woman began selling used clothing. She does traveling sales, going looking for customers from door to door. She has orders from her customers and to satisfy them, she needs to stock up. For that reason she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 3 bales of used clothing.

She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Gaza City, Palestine. Nidal manages a poultry farm. Now he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy chicken feed for his poultry business. Nidal thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for his poultry

loans.name: Mohammad Taher Group

texts.en:
M. Taher is the group leader of M. Taher group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive a small loan for their businesses.

Pastah wants to take a loan for her business of purchasing beading materials. Parwen wants to take a loan for her husband’s fruit cart business. Farozan wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. Fahema wants to take a loan for her bakery business. And M. Taher wants to take a loan for his business of selling of books, pens, and other things in his shop.

They all want to expand and improve their businesses and they are really happy that these loans will help them expand their businesses. They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor people in their country.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Adakouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme  est divorcée de son époux dans le quartier tokoin à Lomé avec son seul enfant. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses charges et à celle de son enfant est le commerce de tubercules. Faisant face à  une réduction de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs d'ignames.
texts.en:
This is a divorce woman who lives in the Tokoin neighborhood in Lomé with her only child. Her business consists in selling yams, and enables her to support herself and her child. Her stock is currently low, and she wants to resupply. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of yams.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sack of yams

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is 50 years old, married with 9 children some of whom are still going to school, and a resident of Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental.

She and her husband have been raising a head or two of cattle to sell to supplement their family income even before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998. But with 9 kids to clothe, feed and send to school, life was very tight for the L. family. This is why Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon: to get the badly needed capital to increase their family's income capacity. This venture earns them an average of PHP 3,000.00 per month. 

By the grace of God, in the 10 years that she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has kept a good credit record, and her older children have already finished their schooling.

For this 18th loan cycle, Evelyn is borrowing PHP 22,000.00 to buy more livestock to raise and sell. Evelyn and her husband continue to strive and work hard in the hope that their children will have a better life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Phurng

texts.en: Mrs. Phurng S., a  60-year-old housewife living in Tos Prak village in Kandal Province, is married to Mr. Yong Morn,  a farmer who owns a piece of land upon which he cultivates vegetables. Mrs. Phurng S. is requesting a loan to buy a pump machine to support the field. She has a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine to support the field.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie, ce commerce lui réussit très bien. Elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de pagnes. Présentement elle veut augmenter ses recettes, elle doit pour cela augmenter  son stock de marchandises. Ayant déjà obtenu deux prêts de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour agrandir ses marchandises avec divers articles de mercerie et 11 pièces de pagnes.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman's business consists in selling sewing supplies and works very well for her. She also sells pagnes (colorful African cloth). At this time, she would like to increase her revenue, and to this effect she needs to increase her stock. After having repaid without problems the two loans she obtained from Kiva's partner, WAGES, she's now seeking a third loan to buy various sewing supplies and 11 pieces of pagnes. She's married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and 11 pieces of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Pertei

texts.en: Mrs. Pertei Y. lives in the village of Rolus in Takeo Province where she is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Because her field is currently infertile and far from an irrigation system, she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and a pump machine to support her production. Her husband, Mr. Tith Ban, shown on the right in the photo, is a construction worker. This couple has a child who is yet too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a pump machine to support her production.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled, a 28-year-old married father of three children, operates a blacksmith's shop with his father (shown in the picture) where they make wrought-iron gates, railings, gates and iron chairs. 

Khaled would like to use this loan to buy pipes in bulk,  from which he will make fences and gates. By buying in bulk, he will get a better price on the materials he needs to do his work, and thus earn more for each piece that he sells.

loans.use: To buy pipes in bulk.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits génériques, il aide  ainsi les malades disposant de peu de moyens la possibilité de s’acheter des médicaments pour se soigner.il fait cette activité depuis 1999. Son stock de produits génériques a baissé raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de reality Extra, 3 cartons de cypron plus et divers autres produits génériques.
texts.en:
This man's business consists in selling generic drugs. In doing so, he makes it possible for patients lacking financial means to buy medication to take care of themselves. He's been running this business since 1999. His stock of generic drugs has dropped, which is why he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 2 boxes of "Reality Extra", 3 boxes of "Cypron Plus", and various other generic drugs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of "Reality Extra", 3 boxes of "Cypron Plus", and various other generic drugs

loans.name: The

texts.en:
Mrs. The O., a 57-year-old resident of Pnouv village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Her field is currently infertile, and she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers.

Her husband, Mr. Duong Chheng, owns a rice miller and has been hired by the villagers. This couple has four children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the others are attending the local school. Both Mrs. The O. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en:
Mena is the group leader of Mena group. There are two members in this group. They are requesting a group loan of 20000 Afghani for their businesses. They want to develop and improve their businesses.

Mena wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring in her house. She is very happy. She wants a new machine so she can increase her business. Mastora wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of mobile selling. He want to make his shop larger. They are very happy with this small loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa, a 24-year-old single man living with his parents, is a market vendor who sells clothes in the local market of Hebron. He is trying to satisfy the various tastes and income levels of all his customers and is requesting a loan of $2000 to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell.

Be an important part of the growth of Alaa’s business!

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell.

loans.name: Nurchamol

texts.ru: Нурчамол Джураева проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 40 лет. Женат имеет 6 детей. Нурчамол вместе с мужем занимается сельским хозяйством. Она в основном выращивает арбуз и помидоры и продает его на рынке. Кредит просит для посева урожая. На полученную прибыль хочет купить крупно рогатый  скот.
texts.en:
Nurchamol D. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Nurchamol and her husband are involved in agriculture. She primarily grows watermelons and tomatoes and sells them at a market. Nurchamol is requesting a loan for harvesting and sowing. She wants to use resulting profits to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and sowing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hann

texts.en: Mrs. Hann Y. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Men Sophorn, owns an electric cow for plowing, which has been hired out by other farmers. Now Mrs. Hann Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and she will use the rest of money to repair the electric cow. She is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is present on her right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to repair the electric cow.

loans.name: Bornoi

texts.en: Bornoi T. is 54-years-old, divorced, has five children and lives in Zuunmod town. He used to work as an engineer for the military, but retired in 2000. As soon as he retired, he opened a car service center on a plot of land he owns. In 2007, he decided to expand his retail business and built a larger car center service near his previous workplace. He also bought professional equipment and tools. He makes most of his money working on minibuses. After getting divorced, he began caring for his children on his own and has put all of them through college. He plans to use this loan to buy equipment to repair tires and other items.

loans.use: to buy equipment to repair car tires

loans.name: Abdulboid

texts.ru: Перимов Абдулбоид  проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абдулбоид более 4 лет работал по специальности "бухгалтером". В данный момент он более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает арбуз и лук. Кредит просит для сбора урожая и повторного посева.
texts.en:
Abdulboid P. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. Abdulboid had worked as an accountant for over 4 years. Currently, he has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He grows watermelons and onions. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and new sowing

loans.name: Reoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun S. leads a loan group with six members, all of whom live in Tranh village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She is facing problems because she does not have enough money to buy gasoline, plow her field or purchase fertilizer. She has applied for this loan to meet those needs. Mrs. Roeun S. is a 44-year-old widow with three children who are in school. 

All the members of this group have applied for end-of-term loans which do not require them make any payments on the principal until the end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they benefit Cambodia’s poor by allowing them repay portions of the principal when they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, plow her field and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is 21 years old and single. He makes a living running a grocery store in Hebron, Palestine. Mahmud would like to expand this business by buying sacks of rice, canned goods and other products to sell to his customers. By doing this,  he will be able to contribute to the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette femme vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé avec son époux et ses 04 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’objets plastiques. elle veut agrandir son stock et sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter diverses assiettes en plastiques, des seaux en plastiques et divers autres objets plastiques. Elle pourra ainsi grossir ses recettes journalières.
Avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood with her husband and her four children. She sells plasticware to earn a living. She wants to expand her stock and is asking WAGES for a first loan to buy various plastic plates, buckets, and various other plastic goods. Thus she will be able to expand her daily receipts.

With the revenue from her business, she contributes to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of goods made of plastic

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Назирова Хафиза проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в государственной страховой компании. Хафиза более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Она в основном выращивает арбуз и кукурузу. Кредит просит для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить урожай. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Hafiza N. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband works at a state insurance company. Hafiza has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. She mainly grows watermelons and corn. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds, needed for sowing. She wants to use resulting profits to repair her house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
MARY CRIS V. of Sitio Sutay, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental is married with 6 children ranging from 6 to 18 years old.

Having a large family necessitates for Mary Cris and her husband to explore a variety of income generating ventures. Armed with only her entrepreneurial spirit, Mary Cris joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 to borrow capital for a new business venture to augment the income she generated from her "sari-sari" store - the local version of a General or neighborhood convenience store.

She used her 1st to 3rd loans to capitalize a barter trade with local farmers: they bought food stuff and goods from her general store on credit and paid her with grain at harvest time. She also bought several piglets to raise and sell. This side business earns her an additional PHP 1,500.00 per month.

Now on her 9th loan cycle, Mary Cris wants to borrow PHP 7,000.00 to buy cattle to raise and sell to supplement her family income. 

Mary Cris continues to explore other business opportunities in the hope that all these help support her growing family's financial needs. With 3 teen-age kids and 3 youngsters, Mary Cris also prayes that her business activities will inspire the entrepreneurial spirit in her children so that they will grow up knowing that they have the power to become independent and be financially stable if they're willing to work hard.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Purchase livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bekpulat

texts.ru: Хайдаров Бекпулат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 38 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Бекпулат по специальности "техник-электрик" проработал 17 лет. Вот более 5 лет, он начал заниматься сельским хозяйством. Кредит просит для посева урожая. Сеить хочет он арбуз. На полученную прибыль хочет купить мелко рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Bekpulat H. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. Bekpulat had worked as an electrician for over 17 years. It has now been over 5 years since he became involved in agriculture. He is requesting a loan for sowing watermelons. He wants to use resulting profits to buy small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sowing watermelons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items to sell from his shop

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru: Хикоят Юнусова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж также помогает своей жене. Сама Хикоят по специальности "педагог" работала более 18 лет. Но вот как более 10 лет начала свой бизнеса. Она имеет торговую точку, на котором торгует коврами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hikoyat U. lives is the Gissar district. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband helps his wife as well. Hikoyat spent 18 years working as a teacher. However, she started her own business over 10 years ago. She has a retail store, where she sells rugs. She is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Lady

texts.en:
Lady is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells cooked food which she carries in a wheelbarrow. She has been doing this business for a long time.

She is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and rent a new place for her business. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.ru: Шабнам Косимова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 24 года. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж работает в строительной компании Российской  Федерации. Шабнам сама более 4 лет занимается выращивает овощей. У нее имеются постоянные покупатели. Кредит просит посева урожая, т.е. покупки минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Shabnam K. lives in the Gissar district. She is 24 years old, married and has 1 child. Her husband works at a construction company in the Russian Federation. Shabnam has been growing vegetables for over 4 years. She has loyal customers. She is requesting a loan for planting the crop, i.e. purchasing mineral fertilizers and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For planting crops

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells second hand clothes. She is 65 years old and married with 5 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: re-stock her general store

loans.name: Алибой

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Алибой мужчина 42 лет , женат имеет пятерых детей. Он работает в колхозе бригадиром, его доход не достаточен для проживания его большой семьи. Алибой вместе с семьёй занимается этим бизнесом. Его жена продаёт домашнее молоко и кефир.Для расширения численности скота Алибой хочет получить кредит.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en: Mazen is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He makes a living selling flowers. Mazen has applied for a loan of 2,100 USD, which he will use to grow more flowers to sell to his customers. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To grow more flowers to sell

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Gaza City, Palestine. Maher owns a barber shop, for which he requested a loan of 1,000 USD from Ryada in order to change the décor of his salon. This is the first time that Maher has requested a loan.

Maher is special in his work because he does nice haircuts and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family members, friends, and neighbors. In the future, Maher plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To change the décor of his salon

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a member of the Upendo North borrower group in Kinyanambo. She is a 26-year-old woman, and she is married. She cares for 4 dependents. 

Regina started her own business selling charcoal 2 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Regina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 TZS in order to buy more charcoal. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Regina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: 34-year-old Tareq is a simple person and is responsible for raising his only child. He earns his living by running a small grocery store. He plans to use the loan to increase the stock in his store—to buy items that are in daily use such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, and candy. His greatest dream is to provide his child with a nice home.

loans.use: To increase the stock in his store

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 45 years old. He is married with two children. He has been in clothing sales business for 7 years. Vasil used to work as an accountant.
He would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to increase his inventory. Vasil uses every business opportunity to increase his sales and profit.

loans.use: increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wooden planks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying a freezer and ingredients for her product

loans.name: Olena

texts.en: Olena is married with one child. She sells men's clothing at one of the open markets in Melitopol city. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her growing experience and the constant demand for the type of goods she sells motivated Olena to start a second location. It will not only increase her sales and profit, but give some one a job and a stable income. Olena is requesting to borrow 13,900 UAH. She has used business loans before and considers them very helpful.

loans.use: to open new business location

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one grown up son. She owns a retail business that sells clothing. She has been in this business for 9 years. There is almost no competition in the area where Svetlana works. It gives her a great sales advantage. Svetlana is a very active, honest and hard working person. She develops her business all the time increasing the sales and income.

Svetlana would like to borrow 13,800 UAH to purchase school uniforms for sale. This will give her additional income that she is going to use to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms for sale

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
La Señora Miguela Sànchez Salinas tiene 34 años de edad, Vendedora de Championes (Zapatillas Deportivas) hace 21 años en la zona del Mercado Municipal Nº 4 de Asunción. 
Esta viviendo en pareja con Eustacio Chaparro de 40 años de edad quien tambièn trabaja como vendedor con quien tiene una hija llamada Pamela de 9 años, la niña va al 4to grado de la Escuela Primaria y en sus horas libres ayuda a su madre en la venta, ofreciendo a la gente, colaborando mostrando a los posibles clientes las mercadería, reciden en la casa ubicada en la Calle Enfermeras del Chaco del Barrio Villa Bonita de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Miguela es una mujer muy emprendedora desde pequeña aprendio de su madre el oficio de la venta, desde la adolescencia siguió los pasos de su madre con quien salia a vender todo tipo de prendas, por lo general prendas deportivas de mucha demanda en nuestro pais., pues tiene una cultura futbolistica muy arraiga, además de los calzados para caminar o hacer ejercicio. Ella se levanta muy temprano, prepara a su hija para ir al Colegio, prepara la comida para el almuerzo y luego sale en Omnibus para su lugar de ventas que posee desde hace 21 años tiene un puesto de Ventas en el corazón mismo del Mercado Municipal Nº 4, el más concurrido de nuestra ciudad capital. Entre las calles República de Colombia c/ Battillana, Frente a una muy conocidad Importadora – Andrade Importaciones. 
Tiene Championes para Hombres de todos los nº desde el 36, 37, 38, 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, hasta el 44, para Damas desdes el 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39, 40, y para niños de los nùmeros más pequeños para Bebés recien nacidos hasta los de 14 y 15 años (adolescentes) 
Todas las demás vendoras la quieren mucho pues una mujer muy sacrificada, amable y servicial.
Miguela agrada a los clientes desde se acercan a ella trata de encontrar lo que ellos buscan, posee la pasciencia necesaria para hacer provar las prendas y lleven lo que deseen para su casa.
Ella utilizó el crédito para aumentar su cantidad calzado en Stock
texts.en:
Mrs. Miguela Sánchez Salinas is 34 years old, and a saleswoman of Champions (athletic shoes), as she has been for 21 years in the area of Municipal Market Number 4 of Asunción. She is living as a couple with Eustacio Chaparro, who is 40 years old and also works as a salesman and with whom she has a 9-year-old daughter named Pamela. Pamela is in the 4th grade of primary school and in her free time helps her mother in sales, catering to people, collaborating to show goods to perspective clients, and all of them live in a house in Enfermeras del Chaco street of the Villa Bonita neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. Miguela is a very undertaken woman, and since she was young learned the sales trade from her mother. Since her adolescence, she has followed in her mother's footsteps with whom she used to go out to sell different types of garments, but more than anything sports garments which are in high demand in her country because of the strong deep-rooted football culture, in addition to shoes for walking or doing exercise. She gets up very early, prepares her daughter to leave for school, prepares food for lunch and then leaves on the bus to her place of sales that she has had for 21 years, a sales stand in the heart of the Municipal Market #4, the most busy market of the capital city, between the streets of Republica de Colombia and Battillana, in front of a well-known import business, Andrade Imports. Miguela has Champion shoes for men of all sizes from size 36 to 44, and for women from size 34 to 40, and for children, sizes for newborns all the way up to those for adolescents of 14 or 15 years old. All of the other vendors like her a lot because she is a very friendly, sacrificed and accommodating woman. Miguela takes a liking to the clients from when they approach her, and she tries to find what they are looking for. She possesses the patience necessary for them to try on the garments and take what they desire home with them. She would use the loan to increase the amount of shoes she has in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of different goods such as athletic shoes for women, men, adolescents and children

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi F. est un homme de 47 ans, marié et père de 32 enfants. il est revendeur de planches à Adeta, un village situé au sud-ouest du Togo. Il désire avec ce crédit ouvrir un dépôt de planches afin d’accroître la taille de son entreprise.
texts.en:
Koffi F., 47, is married and the father of 2 children. He sells wooden planks in Adeta, a village situated in the south-west of Togo. He wants to use this loan to open a lumber yard so that he can expand his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase wooden planks for resale

loans.name: Fatou Moussa

texts.fr: Fatou Moussa D. est une femme mariée, mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du commerce sur étal de fruits comme les mangues, melon, orange et mandarine. Ce prêt lui permettra d’assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Moussa D. is married and the mother of 4 children. On her stall, she sells fruits such as mangoes, melons, oranges, and mandarines. This loan will enable her to ensure a better standard of living to her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits (mangoes, melons, oranges, and mandarines)

loans.name: Oksana's Group

texts.en: Oksana is married with no children yet. She runs a small production company that produces and installs windows. She has been in this business for 2 years. Many people live in old houses and want to fix their windows, so there is a high demand for new windows in the area. Being a hard-working and active person, Oksana has plans to develop her business and increase the sales. Oksana would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase materials for window production.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is determined and hopeful to get out from under the spiral of poverty. She is 50 years old but still full of determination to rise above poverty. She is married to Polly a 53 year-old and her business partner. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with the hope of having opportunity and access to capital to start a business. Since her first loan up to present, she invested her money in raising of hogs as her primary business and resale of frozen foods as the secondary one. Her businesses went well and she receives proceeds that can sustain their family needs. Now, on her 6th loan, she is requesting the amount of 20,000 pesos to pay for 7 piglets and 8 sacks of feed for her hog-raising business.

Teresita is hopeful that with the good performance of her businesses, she will be able to save for her and her husband’s future since they are getting old now and her children may settle down in their own families in the near future.

loans.use: To pay for 7 piglets and 8 sacks of feed for her hog raising business

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio cuenta con 55 años esta casado con la señora Julia Ramírez de 51 años, tiene cuatro hijos uno se encuentra en la Argentina trabajando, los otros en el colegio.
El señor trabajó desde joven en construcción, en la actualidad el señor es contratista de obras con varios empleados a su cargo. 
Le gustaría mas adelante poner en su domicilio un criadero de lombrices, este es un proyecto que tiene desde hace ya un buen tiempo pero no lo ha hecho aún hasta hoy por falta de capital ya que toda la ganancia que puede obtener de su trabajo como constructor  prefiere invertirlo en los estudios de sus hijos. Actualmente el esta ahorrando para los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido que no contaban con el dinero suficiente.
texts.en:
Emilio is 55, and he is married to Julia Ramrírez who is 51. They have four children. One is working in Argentina, and the others go to school. He has worked in construction since he was a young man. He is currently a contractor with various employees. Later, he would like to set up a worm farm at his home. He has had this project in mind for quite a while, but he has not done it yet for lack of capital. He prefers to use his income from his construction work on his children’s education. He is currently saving for his children’s university studies. He did not have the opportunity to go to school due to lack of money.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials, cement, hydrated lime

loans.name: Cidalia Antonio

texts.pt:
Cidalia Antonio N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 40 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 5 e 14 anos. Estudou ate 6 classe na escola secundaria de Tsalala tendo parado por causa da guerra civil que terminou no ano de 1992. Vive com o seu esposo na casa própria que trabalha para o governo na área de imobiliária.
Casou se há 21 anos e há seis anos começou a fazer o actual negocio (venda de produtos de primeira necessidade).

Vende mais peixe que compra na cidade de Maputo (desloca cerca de 9 km) uma caixa custa 1.050,00MT e vende a 1.500,00MT, consegue uma receita diária no valor de 400,00MT. Algumas vezes tem poupado através de um esquema tradicional de poupança composta por um grupo de cerca de 10 senhoras homologas. Não tem mais pessoas sob sua responsabilidade.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este é o seu quarto credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de produtos de primeira necessidade. Os primeiros empréstimos foram todos para o comercio, 5.500,00MT; 6.500,00MT e 6.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Conheceu a hluvuku através de sua vizinha, também cliente da mesma instituição. 
Espera ver o seu negocio sempre a crescer e com mais receitas passara a depositar o dinheiro no banco, numa conta por abrir brevemente.

Propõe se a pagar bem o seu credito para poder aceder a mais empréstimos e cumprir o sonho de construir um estabelecimento comercial com material convencional.
texts.en:
Cidalia Antonio N. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children with ages between 5 and 14 years old. She went to school through the 6th grade at the secondary school of Tsalala. She stopped because of the civil war that ended in 1992. She lives with her spouse in their own home, and she works for the government in the real estate area. She was married 21 years ago, and 6 years ago she began her business (selling products of primary necessity). She sells a lot of fish which she buys in the city of Maputo (about 9km away) for 1,050MT per box and sells for 1,500MT. She is able to earn 400MT daily. Some times she has been able to save through a traditional savings schedule composed of a group of about 10 ladies. She is not responsible for any more people. She has never had a loan through other institutions, and this is her 4th loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 10,000MT. She will use it to buy products of primary necessity. The first loans were all used for the business, 5,500MT, 6,500MT, and 6,000MT respectively. She came to know Hluvuku through her neighbor who is also a client. She hopes to see her business continually grow and deposit the increased receipts in the bank, in an account she will open soon. She plans on paying back her loan to be able to access more loans to fulfill her dream of constructing a commercial establishment with conventional materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products of primary necessity

loans.name: Nery

texts.en:
Nery B. is a young mother to two young sons. She is only 27 years old and married to Emmanuel who is 31 years old and a fisherman. At her young age, Nery dreams of a better future for her kids. She dreams of bringing them up with a decent lifestyle, a life that is away from poverty. She lives in the town of Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Her desire to rise above poverty brought her to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. Her husband is engaged in fish vending and when she joined ASHI, she was thinking of a business that would be of help to her husband. She invested her previous loans in doormat making. She has regular costumers and she even receives orders. From now on, doormat making is her primary business.

Just recently, she applied for a loan in the amount of 15,000 pesos as additional capital to her business. The loan will be used to pay for assorted kilos of new and used clothes as raw materials, scissors, and other expenses like transportation of products.

She dreams of having her own house and being able to send her children to school until they finish college and find jobs. Also she hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: To pay for assorted kilos of new and used clothes as raw materials, scissors, and other expenses  such as  transportation

loans.name: Aladji

texts.fr: Aladji M. est âgé de 32 ans, marié, et père 2 enfants. il est menuisier à Adeta. Aladji exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des outils de travail notamment du bois pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.
texts.en:
Aladji M., age 32, is married and the father of 2 children. He's been a furniture maker in Adeta for 3 years. He wishes to use this loan to buy work tools, in particular wood to realize his artworks.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and wood

loans.name: Ilda Ernesto

texts.pt:
Ilda Ernesto N. nasceu no distrito da Namaacha, tem 39 anos de idade e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 6 e 14 anos. Estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado quando perdeu seus progenitores e passou a viver sob responsabilidade dos seus familiares que não foram capazes de suportar os encargos escolares (uniforme livros dinheiro de transporte).

Ilda saiu de namaacha com os seus familiares para Boane (km 16 antes da cidade de Maputo) e actualmente trabalha numa empresa de produção de bananas em Boane (que ate exporta para África do sul). O seu trabalho na Bananalandia é de sacha ha mais de 2 anos com um salário mensal de 2.000,00MT.

Para alem do emprego formal, vem fazendo negocio a mais de 5 anos de experiencia. Vende panelas (compra cada a 130,00MT e vende a 230,00MT) e consegue poupar um pouco para momentos difíceis.
 
Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigas que foram primeiras a tomar o empréstimo com a hluvuku.
Esta é o seu terceiro credito no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de panelas e outros produtos para revenda. Os primeiros empréstimos foram de 2.000,00MT e 5.000,00MT, respectivamente para a mesma actividade.
Não tem tido problemas para fazer o seu negocio, mesmo sem empregada, consegue harmonizar bem o tempo.
Espera ver o seu negocio a crescer bem e depois de pagar este empréstimo vai solicitar outros créditos para construir casa com material convencional
texts.en:
Ilda Ernesto N. was born in the Namaacha district. She is 39 years old. She is the mother of 4 children of ages between 6 and 14. She studied until fourth grade and she had to stop because she lost her parents. She had to live under the responsibility of family members who were not able to support her schooling fees (such as books and money for transportation) Ilda left namaacha with her family members to go to Boane (km 16 before the city of Maputo) and she currently works in a Banana production enterprise in Boane (which exports to South Africa). She´s been working in Bananalandia as a weeder for over two years with a monthly salary of 2.000,00MT. Besides formal employment, Ilda has been doing her own business for over 5 years. She sells pots (she buys each of them for 130,00MT and sells them for 230,00MT). This is how she gets to save a bit of money for the difficult times. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through some friends who were the first ones to request loans from Hluvuku. This is her third credit of 10.000,00MT to purchase more pots and other products for resale. Her other two credits were of 2.000,00MT and 5.000,00MT, respectively, for the same activity. She has not had a problem doing her business, despite being employed, she manages to harmonize her time very well. She hopes to see her business grow and after repaying this loan she expects to requests other loans to build her home with conventional building materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resale of domestic articles (pots, pans, etc..)

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela V. nació en la ciudad de Altos departamento Central y hace varios años que se mudó a vivir a la ciudad de Luque en donde radica actualmente. Ella está casada con Pedro Resquín, tienen tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de ropas, jeans entre otras mercaderías.

 Tiene una muy buena cantidad de clientes. También trabaja para una fábrica de ropas muy conocida en el país llamada  Martel, en cierto horario del día.

 Gracias a créditos anteriores que le ha otorgado la Fundación Paraguaya, pudo aumentar su inventario de ropas para vender,  de este modo ella ha logrado mejorar su ingreso familiar a través del comercio. Su meta es tener una mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela was born in the city of Altos in the Central Department. It has been many years since she has moved to the city of Luque, where she is currently located. She is married to Pedro. They have three children. She sells clothes, jeans, and other merchandise. She has a good number of customers. She also works in a clothing factory called Martel, which is well known in the country. She has a steady job at the factory. Thanks to past loans that have been given through Fundacion Paraguaya she has been able to increase the inventory of clothes that she sells. In this manner she has been able to improve her family’s investment in the business. Her goal is to increase her client base.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama K. is a 47-year-old married mother of two. She lives with her family in Mariakani, Coast Province. At the centre of Mariakani Market, Dama operates a fish-selling stand. She has been in this business for the last 12 years and she mainly deals in small dried fish.

This loan will be Dama's second one from KADET. With the money from this loan, she plans to purchase five bags of small dried fish to resell. People in Dama's area eat the small fish as a staple food, which makes the fish very marketable.

In future, Dama hopes to become a major supplier of dried fish and also wants to start selling bigger, fresh fish as they are also gaining popularity in the area.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy five bags of dried fish to resell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama I. est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de fruits et légumes à Adeta depuis 5 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des fruits et légumes auprès des agriculteurs et de venir les revendre au marché. Elle désire avec ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son commerce.
texts.en:
Mariama I., age 35, is married and the mother of 2 children. She's been reselling fruits and vegetables in Adeta for 5 years. Her business consists in buying fruits and vegetables from farmers, and to resell them at the market. She would like to use this loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zaituni's Group

texts.en:
N. Zaituni is the leader of Mukama Mwesigwa in Busega. She is a hard-working and devoted lady who strives for success. She has a business selling produce and greens and vegetables from her stall and as a result, she has been able to cater for her 3 children from the profits from her increased capital.

At the moment, her business is not doing badly and she is able to ask for a small loan since the demand is not so high but hopes that in future, she will be able to diversify. Zaituni needs to buy more produce and fresh greens and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce and fresh vegetables for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is the owner of CineCipher, a multi-media videography company located in the San Francisco Bay Area. He works with small businesses and non-profits to help them tell their stories.

Michael loves owning his own business, but ever-changing developments in technology mean he needs to undertake significant expense to remain competitive.  This loan will allow Michael to upgrade his equipment and software and will help to increase his number of clients and the services that CineCipher is able to provide.

loans.use: Upgrade equipment and software

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline W. is a married woman aged 34 years old who is a born-again Christian. She has two children who both go to school.

Caroline plans to use the money from this loan to buy additional stock for her general store, including bags of sugar, crates of soda, mineral water, cooking fat and other household items.

Caroline's dream is to one day own a big supermarket, hence creating more job opportunities for other people where she lives. She also plans to be a supplier of household goods, and hopes this will boost her profit and enable her buy a plot of land on which she could build her own house.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy addititonal stock for a general store such as bags of sugar, crates of soda, etc.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William (far left) is pictured here with his father and nephew at the original Gentle Parking location.

“Owning my own business is a vehicle to help. I work with all local businesses and I like to help grow the local economy.”

William is the owner of Gentle Parking, a parking lot management company located in San Francisco, CA.
