After working in the parking services industry for over ten years, William was excited to start his own business and, in just one year, is already expanding by opening a new lot location. He currently has six employees and hopes to continue providing jobs to the community by growing his business. 

William’s credit was severely affected by the recent economic downturn, and finding financing for his business has been nearly impossible. This is his 2nd loan with Opportunity Fund, and the money will help purchase the insurance he needs to keep Gentle Parking in business.

Gentle Parking is an eco-friendly company. All of the parking booths are made out of reclaimed materials and run on solar energy. They also recycle everything from old parking tickets to rubber bands. William is also very focused on helping to grow the local economy and he works with local companies whenever possible. By staying local, William is able to keep costs lower and pass the savings on to his customers who enjoy a lower rate than at competing lots.

Gentle Parking is the sole income for William’s family of 5.

You can learn more about Gentle Parking at: www.gentleparking.com

loans.use: To pay for insurance for a new location and to expand his business

loans.name: Blas Orlando

texts.en:
Señor Blas is 29 years old, married to Señora Zulma García, with one son. They have their own house in the rural area of Aguaity, E. Ayala district. Doña Zulma grows fowl: chickens and ducks for family consumption.

Señor Blas manufactures and sells bricks commonly used for construction. He began this line of work thanks to his father, who had sufficient experience. He already has an established clientele, thanks to the quality of his products. The work he does with his own hands, helped by two other people, whom he pays when the product gets sold. The loan he is asking for is for the purchase of primary materials: clay and wood.

loans.use: Purchase of materials: clay and wood.

loans.name: Gina Constantino

texts.pt:
Gina Constantino B. nasceu na cidade de Matola (capital da província de Maputo, a 10 km da capital do paìs) tem 38 anos de idade e mãe de 8 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 15 anos (nasceu dois gêmios) o seu marido é serralheiro numa empresa Metalúrgica. Todos os filhos freqüentam escola e vivem juntamente com os pais na casa própria.

Gina tinha parado de estudar na 5 classe devido à gravidez precoce e neste momento frequnta 10 classe na Escola secundaria Joaquim Chissano de Boane no curso Nucturno.

Gina mudou se de Matola para Boane logo após o casamento já há bastante tempo.
É comerciante e dona do negocio a mais de 3 anos sem empregado. Vende roupas para adultos e crianças num estabelecimento precário, compra cada fardo a 3.500,00MT e consegue uma renda semanal de 1.200,00MT.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este é o seu terceiro credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupa. Os primeiros empréstimos foram também para a mesma actividade (8.000,00MT e 10.000,00MT).
Pretende ver o seu negocio a crescer bem e pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a novos empréstimos e fazer uma pequena loja convencional.
texts.en:
Gina Constantino B. was born in the city of Matola (capital city of the Maputo province, which is 10 km from the country´s capital). She is 38 years old and is the mother of 8 children who are between 3 and 15 years of age (she has a couple of twins). Her husband is a locksmith at a Metallurgical enterprise. All of her children go to school and they live with their parents at home. Gina stopped going to school after 5th grade because she had an early pregnancy. However, she went back to school and is now studying 10th grade at the Joaquim Chissano de Boane highschool during the night shift. Gina moved from Matola to Boane after she married a long time ago. She has been a merchant and owner of her own business without an employee for three years. She sells clothing for adults and children in a precarious establishment. She purchases each bundle for 3.500,00MT and achieves a weekly income of 1.200,00MT. She has never had a loan with other institutions and this is her third credit with Hluvuku-Adsema. She is requesting a loan of 10.000,00MT to purchase and sell clothing. Her first loans of 8.000,00MT and 10.000,00MT respectively were used for this same activity. She wants to see her business grow and repay the credit without any problems in order to be able to access new loans to make a conventional store.

Translated from Portuguese by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell clothing

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El señor Marcial tiene 65 años, esta casada con la señora Delia de 62 años tienen 7 hijos todos mayores de edad y de los cuales 5 se encuentran sirviendo en el Ejercito Paraguayo.
Anteriormente, la pareja, se dedicaba a la venta de comestibles poseían un copetín, pero luego con la ayuda y orientación de algunos familiares ingresaron al rubro de confecciones. Luego de un tiempo empezaron a trabajar en la confección de kepis (gorras) rubro en el cual hoy día ya cuentan con una gran clientela formada, la mayoría son empresas grandes que solicitan en grandes cantidades gorros para sus empleados o para regalar a clientes.
 Le gustaría mas adelante contar con un taller con mejores comodidades y nuevas maquinarias. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, entre otros elementos.
texts.en:
Marcal is 65, is married to Delia, 62, and they have 7 grown children, five of which serve in the Paraguyan Army. Before, the couple was dedicated to selling food, but later with the help and orientation of some relatives they invested in the clothing industry. After a while they started to work in making hats in which today they count on a large, established clientele, the majority of which are large businesses which ask for large quantities of hats for their employees or to give to their customers. They would like to move forward with a factory with better commodities and new machines. In this occasion they are asking for a loan to buy needles, threads and other elements.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying needles and threads among other things

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L. is a thirty-eight-year old woman who is married to Nathan Katam, a farmer.  They live in Leibanet in Eldoret and are blessed with six lovely children.

Lina sells bread at a school near her house called the Leibanet Boys' High School. The shop she sells from is in the school compound, so most of her customers are the boys who attend the school.  She has had one other loan from KADET, which she repaid successfully. With this second loan, Lina plans to buy more bread to stock her shop so she will be able to better serve her customers.

In future, Lina hopes to expand her shop and also would like to be able to serve her neighbours. She also hopes to be able to continue to pay school fees for her children.


About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase the stock in her bread shop

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
58-year-old Señor Angel L. has three children and lives in San Antonio neighborhood in the city of Tobati. He has dedicated more than 15 years to manufacturing bricks. One of his children helps him with his work with much responsibility. They are humble and self-sacrificing people.

Señor Angel has an established clientele thanks to the good quality of his products. He stocks up on his material deposits from different areas of the country. This line of work is very difficult because there is a lot of competition in that area; 80% of the inhabitants in that area work in the same line of work.

The credit that he is asking for will be used to purchase primary materials (clay and wood). He is very content with the loan support that the institution has offered him, and he hopes it will continue so that his business can grow and he can better the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials: clay and wood

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Lidia es viuda, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Lidia vende helados, chupetes de manera ambulatoria en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Lidia hace papa seca en su casa y luego lo comercializa a los mayoristas.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Lidia son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is a 45 year old widow and has 7 children. She is a traveling merchant selling ice cream and lollipops in the Ayacucho central market. In addition to her daily market sales, Lidia also makes dried potatoes at home and then sells them to wholesalers.

Lidia needs a loan of 1400 soles to purchase more potatoes. She hopes to buy a plot of land on which she can build a house and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Beatriz es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Beatriz vende ropa a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, además Beatriz trabaja como agente vendedora de productos de limpieza.
Beatriz necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Los sueños de Beatriz son que su hija sea profesional y tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Beatriz sells clothing upon request. She sells her merchandise to friends and relatives on a credit basis. Beatriz also works as a cleaning products salesperson.

Beatriz needs a loan of 600 soles to buy various types of clothing. She dreams that her daughter will grow up to become a professional and of owning a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various types of clothing

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.es:
Fortunita es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Fortunita es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita tiene un puesto en el mercado las Américas en donde vende papa, los productos los adquiere de los productores.
Fortunita necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños e Fortunita son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Fortunita is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. Fortunita has a vending stall in the Las Américas Market where she sells potatoes that she acquires from producers.

Fortunita needs a loan 600 soles in order to buy more potatoes. She dreams that her children will become professionals and of running a grocery store from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Monica L., 36, is a very hard-working lady and a widow with 6 children of whom 5 are still in school. She has owned and managed a restaurant at a nearby market for 13 years, serving local food every day.

Since receiving her first micro-credit loan, Monica has been able to purchase non-perishable items in bulk and thereby save time and money and up her profit. In order to further increase the efficiency of her restaurant and earn still more profit, which will be used to continue educating her children, Monica is requesting a loan to be able to buy more raw foodstuffs that will help bring in more income and increase profitability to be able to continue paying school fees for her children. She is happy that now she can also offer cold drinks to her customers during and after meals.

loans.use: Buying more food stuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Justina es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Justina tiene un puesto en el mercado D. las Américas en donD. venD. papa variada, además Justina viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales.
Justina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa, cereales.
Los sueños D. Justina son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children. Justina has a vending stall in the Las Américas Market where sells various kinds of potatoes. In addition, she travels to other markets in the region to buy grain.

Justina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy potatoes and grain. She dreams of providing a good education for her children and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes & grain

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 1 hija, Nancy tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Nancy son que su hija sea profesional y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is 35 years old, single, and has one daughter. Nancy operates a store out of her parents’ house where she sells groceries and beverages every day.

Nancy needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy milk, rice and sugar. She dreams that her daughter will become a professional and of growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice & sugar

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou P. est une veuve avec 16 enfants dont l’aîné assure les charges familiales. Elle souhaiterait ce prêt pour s’activer dans la vente de mangue afin d’aider aux dépenses pour mieux améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou P. is a widow with 16 children. Her eldest son provides for the family. She would like to use this loan to sell mangoes, in order to help with the family expenses and to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell mangoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Calixto

texts.en:
Don Calixto has been a businessman for more than 10 years, with an established clientele thanks to the good service and high quality of his products. His clients constantly visit him for music CDs and movie DVDs that are specific to his or her liking. 

The loan that he is asking for will be used to expand his business and venture into selling haberdashery. He hopes to buy merchandise, such as like discs, blouses, jerseys, socks, undergarments, among others, and be able to satisfy the demand of his clientele.

loans.use: To purchase CDs and DVDs

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio V. tiene ya mas de veinte y siete años dedicándose a ser taxista, esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso para su familia, ya que tiene dos hijos adolescentes y quieren ayudarlos a terminar sus estudios.
Ya a tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente, nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo, para poder comprar un vehiculo y así acondicionarlo como taxi, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar y así tener dos carros en ruta. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito para  realizar la comprar, planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que genere el nuevo taxi que tendrá.
texts.en:
Sr. José Antonio V. has more than twenty-seven years experience as a taxi driver. This business is the source of income for his family. He has two teenage children and wants to help them complete their studies.

Sr. José Antonio had a previous loan with FVP that was repaid on time. He is requesting a new loan in order to buy a vehicle that is equipped to use as a taxi. He does not have the necessary funds at the moment since he has two vehicles already in use. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for the purchase and plans to make his payments using the revenue he will generate from the new taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another vehicle

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata D. est mariée avec 7 enfants en charge. Elle veut ce crédit pour faire du commerce de mangues sur étal et de cola aussi. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie des membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatoumata D. is married and has 7 children to support. She wants this loan to sell mangoes and cola on a her stall. Her goal is to improve the living standard of the members of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell mangoes and cola

loans.name: Herlinda Trinidad

texts.es:
la sra. HERLINDA TRINIDAD M. L. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "ISIS KARINA", es casada y madre de 6 hijos, pero de ellos ya solo dependen 5 hijos. el esposo de ella es comerciante individual, tiene un carro en el cual hace su negocio, con los ingresos que les generan sus trabajos entre ambos
cubren los gastos familiares, pero siempre el aporta la mayor parte de los gastos en el hogar.
ella en estos momentos necesita comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que la situacion en nuestro pais es muy complicada y los precios de todos los productos de la canasta basica se van a incrementar mediante pase el tiempo y ella quiere tener guardado producto para que no le afecte mucho cuando esto suceda.
texts.en:
Sra. Herlinda L. Trinidad M. sells popular consumer products from her small grocery store named ISIS KARINA. She is married and the mother of 6 children, but only 5 of them are still dependents. Her husband is an individual trader and has a car that he uses for his business. With the income they generate from both of their jobs, they are able to cover the family expenses and make the most out of what they earn.

At the moment, she needs to buy merchandise at wholesale because the current situation in the country is very complicated and prices for all basic consumer products have increased over time. She wants to guard against these increases so that she is not affected too much whenever this happens.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné C. est une femme mariée, mère de 2 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de s’activer dans la vente de savon, lait, huile, café et céréales. Les revenus générés lui permettront de s’occuper de la santé de ses enfants et de subvenir à ces besoins.
texts.en:
Ngoné C. is a married woman and the mother of two. She is requesting this loan to become active in selling soap, milk, oil, coffee, and grains. The generated revenues will allow her to take care of her children’s health and to provide for their needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell retail soap, milk, oil, coffee, grains, and charcoal

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is fifty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to eight children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Yaa is a trader. She sells smoked fish. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community and also sells at her local market. Yaa also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy the fish in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children good education.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Ama is a trader. She sells rice in cups to local food vendors in her community and also sells in her local market. Ama treks to other towns to sell on their market days, as well. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy the fish in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is forty years old. He is married and has five children, all of whom are all still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Mohammed is a trader. He deals in livestock, such as goats, sheep and cattle. He supplies meat to the chop bar (cafe) and restaurant operators in his community. He gets the animals all the way from Northern Ghana. Mohammed has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy livestock in bulk to increase his stock. He aspires to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Diama

texts.fr: Diama K. est une mariée de 37ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de charbon de bois et d’huile en détail. Elle voudrait assurer une bonne scolarité et une meilleure santé à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Diama K., age 37, is a married woman and the mother of six. She does commerce in charcoal and in oil at the retail level. She would like to ensure that her children have the right schooling and better health.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in charcoal and oil

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is seventy years old. She is widowed and has children. She lives with some of her grandchildren in a family house in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Margaret is a trader. She sells smoked fish on a table top in her local market. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Margaret has been in business for over thirty-two years and wants a loan to buy the fish in bulk to make more profit. She wants to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Angélica María A. tiene ya mas de 21 años con su negocio de ferretería, es el ingreso de su familia ya que tiene paco tiempo se quedo viuda, con tres hijos adolescentes los que son su responsabilidad.
A ella se le presentó una oportunidad de comprar varilla para la construcción por mayoreo en la ciudad de Monterrey, Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacer la comprar de inmediato. 
Está solicitando un préstamo y así poder obtener esa oferta que se le está presentando en este momento.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica María A. has over 21 years experience in the hardware business. This is the main source of income for her family since she became a widow. She has three teenage children who are her responsibility.

She was presented with an opportunity to buy lumber at wholesale in Monterrey, but she did not have the money to make the purchase immediately. She is requesting a loan so that she can take advantage of the offer that was presented to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lumber

loans.name: Everything By God Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of one child who is currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop where she sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits in her neighborhood. She lives with the husband and her dear child. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children in school. She believes that with her four years of experience, she can make good use of the loan.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Everything by God." She is the one squatting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Joyitas De Villa Adela Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Villa Adela, a este pertenece la asociación “Joyitas De Villa Adela”, formada por catorce miembros que trabajan con mucho entusiasmo por mejorar en sus pequeños negocios.
Diversas son las actividades que tienen dentro el grupo, por ejemplo: Venta de queso, elaboración de comida, venta de frutas, dulces confitados, artefactos eléctricos. La asociación Joyitas De Villa Adela afirma que desean ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan reforzar su capital comprando mayor mercadería, tienen la seguridad que podrán generar mayores ganancias para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of El Alto, you can find the center Villa Adela. This is where the association "Joyitas (little gems) de Villa Adela" can be found, formed by fourteen members who work with a lot of enthusiasm to improve their small businesses.

The members of this group are involved in diverse activities, including: selling cheese, making food, selling fruit, sweet preserves, and electric goods. The Joyitas de Villa Adela association says that they wish to expand their businesses, which is why they need to increase their capital to buy more merchandise. They are sure that they will be able to earn more income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her children and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Yaa is a trader. She sells second-hand textiles, such as bed sheets. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community and also sells in her local market. Yaa also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy second-hand textiles in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Adwoa is a trader. She sells maize to local food vendors in her community and also sells in her local market. Adwoa treks to other towns to sell on their market days, as well. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda N. est une veuve. Elle vend des fruits de saison comme les mangues actuellement. Son objectif est d’améliorer de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda N. is a widow. She sells seasonal fruit, such as mangoes right now. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit in season

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is married, with three boys. She is an entrepreneur from the Novomoskovsk region, where she owns several cafes and cafeterias. Ruslana offers public catering services and sells food in her cafeterias. She owns 3 neat and clean cafes in busy neighborhoods, which makes her business very successful.

Ruslana has been in business for 10 years. Presently, she has about 20,000 hryvnias invested in her trade. This time, Ruslana is requesting a loan of 12,800 hryvnias to purchase new microwaves for her cafes. New equipment will improve the quality of service and will help serve customers much faster than before. Ruslana is very energetic. She has a vision and is hoping to implement all of her ideas. We believe all this will help her repay the current loan and succeed in her business endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase new microwaves

loans.name: Eye Awurade Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in the western region of Ghana. 

Veronica is a trader who sells assorted products, such as cooking utensils and groceries. She has been in this trade for five years. Her good humor has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. 

Recently, she has been facing challenges in her business, because she does not have enough funds to buy goods to sell. She is requesting a loan to buy more products, like cooking utensils. She has rented a store where she trades. With the loan, she believes she can expand her shop in no time.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Eye Awurade," which means "It's God." She is the person who is seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small-scale traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increased her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his shop

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo is fifty years old. He is married and has four children, all of whom are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Kwadwo is a licensed chemical seller. He runs a drug store in his locality. He gets the drugs from big pharmacy shops in Kumasi. Kwadwo has been in business for twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to increase his stock. He aspires to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia M. tiene ya mas de dos años con su negocio de papelería y renta de computadoras, esté es el ingreso de su familia ya que en trabajan ella y su esposo, para darles lo mejor a sus dos hijos pequeños que tiene.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y una muebles para tener en mejor condición las maquinas y unos anaqueles para la mercancía pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así realizar la comprar que necesita para la inversión del negocio. Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera el negocio con la mercancía que se compra.
texts.en:
For more than two years, Sra. Julia M. has been operating her stationery and computer rental business. This provides income for her family. Sra. Julia and her husband both work to give the best to their two young children.

Her business is lacking a variety of merchandise, the computer furniture is not in the best condition, and she needs more shelves for displaying products. At the moment, she does not have the money necessary to make these changes but doesn’t want to cripple her business. This is why she is requesting a loan and will buy everything she needs to invest in her business. She will repay the loan with the income she generates from the merchandise she plans to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and furniture for her business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married, with a daughter. She lives in Novomoskovsk. Svetlana works with clothing merchandise, selling men’s footwear and outfits in the central marketplace. She has been in this business for 5 years. A focused approach and additional rented space have facilitated business growth. Currently, Svetlana has about 70,000 hryvnias invested in inventory.

Svetlana is seeking a loan of 9,100 hryvnias to purchase additional merchandise for her retail kiosk. The type of inventory she offers for sale is always in high demand, as Svetlana adjusts to all the new fashion trends and has a nice seasonal selection of clothing and footwear for customers with different tastes and incomes. Svetlana can boast a stable standing at the market. We believe her personal characteristics and consistent business-management skills will ensure repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena is forty-four years old. He is married and has five children who are all still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong-Ahafo Region of Ghana. Kwabena is a dealer in agrochemicals such as fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, etc. He sells in a store by the roadside in his community. He procures the chemicals from big agrochemical shops in Kumasi. Kwabena has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure more chemicals to increase his stock. He aspires to give all his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals

loans.name: Jheny Marisol

texts.es:
Yheny es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Yheny es soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Yeny es agente vendedora de productos diversos que ofrece a diferentes tiendas.
Yheny necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los estudios de su hijo.
Los sueños de Yheny es terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yheny is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is single, 38 years old, and has two children. Yheny is a salesperson, offering various products to different stores. Yheny needs a loan of 1000 soles- money that will be invested in paying for her son's education. Yheny's dreams are to finish building her house and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Peace And Love Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old. She is a divorcee and mother to two boys. Currently both her children are working. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She sells from a rented shop in the community market and sometimes hawks her goods, going from house to house. She has been trading for ten years now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils and other items which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan, she believes she will have the resources to make enough profit to expand her store. She would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Peace and Love." She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of inventory, including cooking utensils among others things

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is fifty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming and commercial town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Adwoa is a trader. She trades in fresh groundnut and spices such as pepper. She supplies mostly local restaurant operators in her community and also sells at her local market. Adwoa treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy groundnut and pepper.

loans.name: Fatou A

texts.fr: Fatou C. est une femme mariée et s’active dans la vente de mangues. Elle souhaiterait avec ses revenus améliorer une meilleure vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou C. is a married woman and is active in selling mangoes. She would like to use her revenues to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in fruit, such as mangoes

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Aïcha M. est une femme de 45 ans, marié et mère de 4 enfants. Elle revendeuse de divers articles au marché d’Adeta. Avec ce crédit, Aïcha espère améliorer sa prestation en achetant plus de produits. Elle désire ouvrir un magasin pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Aïcha M. is a 45-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four. She is a retailer of various goods at the Adeta marketplace. With this loan, she hopes to improve her business performance by buying more merchandise to sell. She would like to open a store to respond better to customer needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a new store

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 26 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Georgina is a hairdresser by profession. She has a workshop located by the roadside in her community. She has some apprentices under training. Georgina has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy working materials such as artificial hair, lotion, pomade, creams, shampoo, etc., to be able to render quality services to her clients. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty N. is the leader of the Nyikira Okole group in Kikajjo. She is a very hardworking 30-year-old mother of 2 children, aged 4 and 7, who also cares for 2 orphans belonging to her late sister. Betty has owned and operated the Seaman Bar for 3 years, and so far her business is good. It’s from the profits derived from the bar that she is able to pay school fees for her dependents plus their general care. She hopes to expand the bar with more space, and more beers and sodas, once she has access to the loan, since she hopes to buy a plot of land with the proceeds. She still has her hopes of one day owning a beer and soda depot to be able to supply other retailers.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas and wines for the bar

loans.name: Bisa Nyame Group

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old; she is married and the mother of three children. She has two boys and one girl, with two of them in school. She is a trader and sells cereals like Tom Brown in bulk. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi and supplies at retail prices. She has been in business for the last nine years now. With her rich experience, she believes that she can use this loan to buy more bags of Tom Brown to upgrade her stock and make adequate profit. It is her dream to save more to take care of her children's educational needs.

Florence is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Bisa Nyame’ which means ‘Ask God’. She is the one sitting in the middle, in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals like Tom Brown

loans.name: Safinah's Group

texts.en:
S. Safinah is the leader of Bisoboka group in Lugazi. She is a married lady with 4 children aged 30 – 24, and one of them is still in school while she also cares for other orphans.

Safinah is a farmer with mostly maize and beans plantations and her major challenge is the dry season. Otherwise, she always has good produce which brings in good revenue. She has a business experience of 20 years and she is happy that she has enough land to carry out the farming.

Safinah has a dream of building a family house as well as increasing her production by buying more land for cultivation. She is a determined and friendly lady with a drive to succeed. Safinah needs a loan to help buy some beans and maize for resale since the dry season is affecting her farms somehow. (The Credit Officer recorded a video instead of taking a photo.)

loans.use: Buying produce for resale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes M. tiene ya más de veinte años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, es el única ingreso que cuenta para salir adelante ella sola. 
Le están ofreciendo una mercancía a muy buen precio pero no cuenta con el dinero para hacer la comprar de inmediato.
Esta solicitando un préstamo y así obtener esa oferta que se le está presentando en este momento, esto le permitirá comprar la mercancía a un precio baja y así sus ingresos se incrementaran y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. has been selling new and used clothing for over twenty years now. This is the only source of income that she disposes of to make it on her own. She is being offered a batch of merchandise for a very good price but she doesn't have the money to make the purchase right now. She is requesting a loan to be able to get the deal that she is being presented with at this moment. This will allow her to buy the merchandise at a very low price and in this way her income will increase and she will be able to pay off her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cartons of soap and beauty lotions

loans.name: Cusi Ccoyllor De Chinchero Group

texts.es:
Los socios son un número de 18, ellos pertenecen al banco comunal “CUSI CCOYLLOR DE CHINCHERO”, ubicado en el distrito de Chincheros, perteneciente a ala provincia y departamento del Cusco. A una distancia de 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios de este banco son personas emprendedoras con muchas ganas de salir adelante, y se dedican a diversas actividades, entre ellas la agricultura (papa, habas, olluco), la ganadería, la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, pollos, gallinas, patos), Nuestros socios requieren el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios menores.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the 18 members of the community bank "Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero," located in the district of Chincheros, in the province and department of Cusco, about 40 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

The members of this bank are entrepreneurial people with a great desire to succeed. They are involved in various activities, including agriculture (potatoes, beans, and olluco), livestock, and the raising of small animals (guinea pigs, chickens, hens, ducks). Our members need a loan to invest in their different small businesses.

Our members are grateful for and value the loan given by this medium, and promise to comply with the repayment schedule that has been established.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: All Shall Pass Group

texts.en:
Gladys, seated in front in this photo, is 34 years old, married and the mother of four kids who are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop and has sold jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, headscarves and all kinds of clothing for men and women for the past four years. She has funding constraints in running her business.  She is seeking a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up the progress of her shop. It is her belief that the loan will grant her the resources to improve both the quality and the quantity of her inventory. With the loan, she plans to purchase jeans, ladies wear, headscarves and slippers. 

Gladys is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘All shall pass.’ Most of the members of this group are small traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies wear and slippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en: Alice N. is the chairperson of Stone Quarry group in Mukono. She is a very hard working lady who works together with her husband in making bricks for construction. She employs up to 5 more people to help in her business depending on the demand. Alice’s business has been running since 2003 and together with her husband, they have 5 children of which 3 are in school as they care for 3 dependants. Alice admits that they have been able to buy some land as a result of using her loans well and she hopes to achieve more as she continues to pay school fees for her children. Alice needs a loan to be able to employ more labor for her business since this is a dry season and the best time for making bricks.

loans.use: Employing labor in her brick making business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary started selling fish six years ago in her neighborhood. She takes delivery of fishes from Yeji, in the eastern region of Ghana. Because she stocks tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. Mary is 46 years old, married, and she has six children. She is currently taking care of four children who are in school; the other two are working. 

Mary plans to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make more sales and income to support her children’s education and to grow her business. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more assorted fish

loans.name: Houma

texts.fr: Houma B. est une femme de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter du mil et de l’arachide destiné à la vente. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital d’investissement et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Houma B. is a 55-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 6 children. She is requesting a loan to buy millet and peanuts destined for sale. Her goal is to increase her investment capital and to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanut butter and millet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow her business capacity

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a un congélateur et sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de rafraîchissant comme crème glace. Elle pourrait ainsi augmenter son capital d’investissement et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa D. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three. She has a freezer and is requesting a loan to bolster her business selling refreshments, such as ice cream. She would thus be able to increase her investment capital and to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream

loans.name: Khadidiatou Foulo

texts.fr: Khadidiatou Foulo D. est une mariée de 33 ans, mère d’un enfant. Elle voudrait renforcer son activité de vente de rafraîchissant en cette période de forte chaleur. Son objectif est d’assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Khadidiatou Foulo D., age 33, is married and the mother of one child. Her business consists in selling refreshments, and she would like to strengthen it at this time since it is very hot. Her goal is to ensure a better standard of living for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream and other food products

loans.name: Kémé

texts.fr: Kémé D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle vend des rafraîchissant et en même temps des draps  et rideau à domicile. Ses revenus générés lui permettent de régler ses factures d’électricité et d’augmenter son capital afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Kémé D., age 39, is married and has 6 children to support. She sells refreshments, and also sheets and curtains at home. Her income enables her to pay electricity bills and to increase her working capital, in order to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell ice cream

loans.name: Souna

texts.fr: Souna B. est une dame de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente d’huile de palme, d’huile d’arachide et de divers autres produits alimentaires. Elle compte renforcer sa capacité et mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Souna B., age 54, is married and the mother of 2 children. Her business consists in selling palm oil, peanut oil, and various other food products. She intends to bolster her sales capacity to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell palm oil, peanut oil, and various other food products

loans.name: Dobaly

texts.fr: Dobaly DIATTA est une femme mariée de 49 ans, mère de 2 enfants. Elle achète du savon local et des balaies pour les revendre en détail. Elle souhaiterait renforcer son activité de commerce et mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Dobaly DIATTA, age 49, is married and the mother of 2 children. She buys local soap and brooms, and retail them. She would like to bolster her business to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail local soap and brooms

loans.name: Konaba

texts.fr: Konaba F. est une mariée de 47 ans avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle achète en gros divers produits tels que thé, sucre, huile de palme, arachide qu’elle revend en détail dans la boutique qu’elle tient. Elle voudrait renforcer la quantité d’huile de palme qu’elle achète et avec ses revenus générés assurer une bonne condition de vie à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Konaba F., age 47, is married and has 6 children to support. She buys various products wholesale, such as tea, sugar, palm and peanut oil, and retails them in her shop. She would like to buy larger amount of palm oil, and use the profits to ensure a good standard of living to her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie D. est une jeune femme de 27ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle veut utiliser son prêt pour s’activer dans la vente de produis rafraîchissant à domicile puisqu’elle a déjà un congélateur. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de payer ses frais d’électricité et de subvenir aux différents besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Marie D., age 27, is married and the mother of 5 children. She wants to use this loan to sell refreshments at her home, since she already own a freezer. Her profits will enable her to pay her electricity bills and to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell refreshments

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Señor Virgilio is 40 years old and married to Señora Danisa Villamayor. They have five young children and own their own house in the rural area of Almadas, Tobati district. In 2002, with the help of his wife, Don Virgilio started a hair salon downtown in the city of Tobati. They now have an established clientele thanks to the quality of their service. Moreover, Don Virgilio buys hair to sell in Sao Paulo, Brasil, an activity that provides much profit. He is now requesting a loan to increase his operating capital and to provide services to satisfy the demand of his clients.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions/wigs and to improve his services

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor  Pablo cuenta con 65 años esta casado con la señora Efemia  de 59  años y tienen 2   hijos mayores que trabajando.

Pablo empezó a trabajar como fletero, con las ganancias de este negocio logró comprar unos animales para armar una pequeña  granja en un terreno que ya tenía.Hoy día realiza ambas actividades, el posee un camión con el que realiza fletes de cargas pesadas y también posee la granja que su familia administra.

Hoy día su granja ya genera muy buenas ganancias e inclusive ya posee clientes fijos que cada día compran leche, queso y huevos, además de carnes.

Le gustaría para el futuro poder comprar maquinas para la elaboración de yogurt ya que es un buen negocio y es muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en:
Pablo is 65 years old and is married to his wife Efemia who is 59 years old. They have two adult sons that are working. Pablo started to work as a freight driver and with the earnings of this business he managed to buy some animals to start a small farm on land that he already had. Today he does both jobs- he has a truck with which he transports heavy freight and also has a farm that his family manages. Now, his farm generates good earnings and he even has regular customers that buy milk, cheese, eggs and meats every day. In the future he would like the be able to buy yogurt-making machines since it is a good business and is very profitable in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Aureliano

texts.en:
Señor Aureliano L. is from the rural area of Espartillar in Carapeguà. He is married to Señora Lucila Matto, with 2 children of school age. They live in a house of their own. They have dedicated more than 15 years to selling their artisan products and own a truck that helps them do so. They are very well known in their area for being hardworking people and entrepreneurs who have progressed with so much sacrifice and determination.

He is asking for a loan so that he can buy bedspreads.

loans.use: The purchase of bedspreads

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Antonio M. tiene 20 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a sus Papas, él y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio M., aged 20, is single and lives with his parents. He is a weaver by trade and has two looms in his workshop named "Making of Traditional Ladies' Wear". He and his parents are engaged in the same trade. They have hired two workers for this activity. They have been making dresses for six years in their home in a hamlet near Aldea Vásquez in the department of Totonicapán in Guatemala. Recently the demand of his customers has grown, but his economic situation prevents him from making the necessary capital investments. For this reason he came to Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan, intending to buy raw material and thereby increasing his sales and giving his family the chance of better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Juan Félix

texts.es: Don Juan Felix  M. tiene 22 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposa  e hija, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación  ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Félix M., aged 22, is married and lives with his wife and his daughter. He is a weaver by trade and has two looms in his workshop named "Making of Traditional Ladies' Wear". He and his wife are engaged in the same trade. They have hired two workers for this activity. They have been making dresses for six years in their home in a hamlet near Aldea Vásquez in the department of Totonicapán in Guatemala. Recently the demand of his customers has grown, but his economic situation prevents him from making the necessary capital investments. For this reason he came to Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan, intending to buy raw material and thereby increasing his sales and giving his family the chance of better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: Don José C. tiene 32 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposa  e hijos, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Tzansiguan, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 32-year-old weaver in a workshop made up of two textile mills called “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres.” He lives with his wife and kids and has worked with his wife in the same office with two employees for the past six years. “Cortes” has operated from his home in Tzansiguan, V. village in the Totonicapán department of Guatemala.

Currently customer demand has increased but economically he is not able to increase his capital. For this reason he has turned to la Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to purchase raw materials. By doing so he will be able to increase his sales and also hopes to help his family move forward and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raw materials to make crafts

loans.name: Santiaggo Ignacio

texts.es: El Joven Santiaggo C. tiene 23 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a sus Papas, él y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 7 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Tzansiguan, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santiaggo C. is 23 years old and single. He is a weaver in a workshop, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres”, that has 2 looms and makes women's garments. He lives with his parents, who work in the same trade as him. They have 2 employees and for 7 years have run Cortes from their residence, which is in Caserío la Tzansiguan, the village of V. of Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, demand from his customers has grown but his economic situation doesn't allow him to expand. That's why he went to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, with the intention of buying raw materials. In this way he hopes to increase sales and also be able to provide for his family so that they will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artisan crafts (working capital)

loans.name: María Albertina

texts.es: Dona María T. tiene 26 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Secretaria,  “Receptora de ASDIR”  habita junto  a su Esposo, lleva 3 años de laborar en la Asociación ASDIR su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Xequiac, de la Aldea Nimasac del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,   por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de cubrir sus Gastos, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 26-year-old married secretary who lives with her husband and has worked for la Asociación ASDIR for 3 years. She lives in a country house in Xequiac in the village of Nimasac and for this reason she has turned to la Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of using it to cover her expenses. She also hopes to help her family move forward and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: medical expenses

loans.name: Pedro Clemente

texts.es: Don Pedro V. tiene 29 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposa, él y su Esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 7 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro V. is 29 and married. He is a weaver, and he makes women’s typical skirts. He has a shop with three looms. He lives with his wife. They both do the same work, and they have two employees that help them. They have been making typical skirts in their home for seven years. They live in the community of V., in the Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has grown. However, his economic situation has not allowed him to increase his capital. That is why he has comes to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will use the loan to buy raw material. That way he will be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to help his family get ahead so that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts       (buy raw material)

loans.name: Luna Brillante Group

texts.es:
En la zona Senkata de la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Luna Brillante” formado por trece  miembros que trabajan junto  a Pro-Mujer hace nueve años aproximadamente.
La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con familias numerosas. Existen varias actividades dentro el grupo, por ejemplo Amalia se dedica a la venta de muebles, Eugenia vende condimentos y especies, otras de ellas venden pollos a la canasta y hamburguesas. La asociación Luna Brillante necesita comprar productos o insumos para ampliar sus negocios, de esta manera generaran mayores ingresos para sostener económicamente a sus familias.
texts.en:
The association "Luna Brillante" (Bright Moon) belongs to the neighborhood of Senkata in the city of El Alto. It is formed by thirteen members who have been working together with Pro-Mujer for about nine years.

The majority of them are married with large families. The group members are involved in various activities. For example, Amalia sells furniture, Eugenia sells condiments and spices, others sell fried chicken and hamburgers. The members of the Luna Brillante association need to buy products or raw materials to expand their businesses, and thus will be able to earn better incomes to economically sustain their families.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and raw materials

loans.name: José Jeremías

texts.es: Don José Y. tiene 21 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposa, él y su Esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 3 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Pajucbalicaj, de la Aldea Nimasac del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José Y. is 21 and married. He is a weaver, and he makes women’s typical skirts. He has a shop with two looms. He lives with his wife. They both do the same work, and they have two employees that help them. They have been making typical skirts in their home for three years. They live in the Pajucbalicaj Caserío, in the Aldea Nimasac, in the Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has grown. However, his economic condition is not sufficient to be able to increase his capital. That is why he has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will use the loan to buy raw material. That way he will be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to help his family get ahead so that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts      (buy raw materials)

loans.name: Noemí Bulux

texts.es: Doña Noemí Bulux tiene 45 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Consumo Diario”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años de vender productos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje la Planta Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Noemí Bulux is 45 and married. She sells daily consumption products. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband do the same work, and they have two employees who help them. They have been selling products for 12 years. They live in Paraje la Planta, in the Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has grown. However, her economic situation has not allowed her to increase her capital. That is why she has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will use the loan to buy raw material. That way she will be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her family get ahead so that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gloria Herminia

texts.es: La Señorita Gloria B. tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera de oficios Artesana,  “Confección de Delantales para Mujeres”, habita junto  a sus Papas, ella y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de vender productos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje la Planta Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Gloria B. is 26 and single. She works in handicrafts, and she makes women’s aprons. She lives with her parents. She and her parents do the same work, and they have two employees who help them. They have been selling their products for six years. They live in Paraje la Planta, in the Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has grown. However, her economic situation has not allowed her to increase her capital. That is why she has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will use the loan to buy raw material. That way she will be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her family get ahead so that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts     (buy raw material)

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Las Sras. del grupo "San Marcos"  estan ubicadas en el minucipio de Danli, El Paraiso.  
ellas se conocen muy bien, siempre han trabajado juntas ya que son vecinas el credito que solicitan es de mucha importancia ya que podran adquirir mas materia prima y mercaderia para las ventas en su negocios.
a continuacion se detalla las actividades de cada una de ellas:

la sra. ELSA DEL CARMEN S.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comida, golosinas, refrescos, etc. tiene 10 años de estar laborando en este tipo de actividad comercial y de este negocio saca  ganancias para poder contribuir con los gastos del hogar, ella le ayuda a su esposo a cubrir con los gastos del hogar.

la sra. AMADA GRISELDA L.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comidas, golosinas actividad  
que viene desarrollando desde hace 2 años,  su negocio se encuentra ubicado dentro de la fabrica de tabacos Plasencia donde laboran mas de 1500 obreros, La Sra. L. nos comento que durante este tiempo le ha ido bien pero con ganas de salir adelante, una desventaja que ha tenido es que cuenta con poco capital para poder surtir mas su negocio.

la sra. EVELIN JOHANA T. H.: Su actividad principal es la  elaboracion de venta de comidas y golosinas, gracias a este negocio le permite apoyar a su compañero de hogar con los gastos que se generan en el hogar. ella nos comento que durante todo este tiempe le ha ido muy bien y esto debido a la buena administracion que ella le da a  su negocio y con el credito que esta solicitando le permitira satisfacer la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
The women of the San Marcos Group are located in the municipality of Danli, El Paraiso. They know each other very well. They have always worked together since they are neighbors. The credit they are applying for has a lot of importance for them since it will allow them to acquire more basic material and merchandise for the sales in their businesses. Below we specify the activities of each woman:

Elsa is engaged in the preparation and sale of food, sweets, soft drinks, etc. She has 10 years of experience working in this type of commercial activity. From this business she draws profits in order to be able to contribute to household expenses. She helps her husband with the household expenses.

Amada is also engaged in making and selling food and sweets, a business she has been developing for 2 years. Her business is located inside the Plasencia tobacco factory where more than 1500 laborers work. Amada told us that she has done well during this time but, with her desire to move forward, one disadvantage she has had is that she has little of the capital required in order to be able to supply more for her business.

Evelin’s principal activity is the making and sale of foods and sweets. Thanks to this business she is able to support her housemate with the expenses they generate in the household. She has told us that during all this time things have gone very well and that this is due to the good management she gives her business. The credit she is applying for will permit her to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tortillas, rice, lard, beans, meat, soft drinks, salt, spices, water, bread, vegetables, chicken, pork, and rice

loans.name: Lucila Otilia

texts.es:
La señora LUCILA OTILIA C. D. C.    tiene 65 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios Hasta 6to D. primaria  , tiene 3 hijos mayores y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Lucila  se dedica a la vender en la bodega D. su casa productos alimenticios como: arroz, azucar,fideos,leche,aceite,gaseosa,etc
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas productos para implementar su bodega.
 Con el crédito D. 800  soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra productos D. abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros; los cuales venD. en la tienda D. su casa.
Lucila tiene como sueño implementar con mas productos alimenticios su negocio y empezar a vender carne D. res, pollo, gallina, pato
texts.en:
Lucila Otilia C. D. C. is 65 years old and lives in the Laredo district of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur has finished schooling through the 6th level of primary school. She has 3 grown children and none of them are dependent on her. Lucila sells food products from her cellar such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, soda, etc. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought more products to stock her cellar. With this loan of 800 PEN she will invest in her business by buying grocery items such as rice, sugar, pasta, and milk, among others. She will sell these in the store in her house. Lucila dreams of offering a greater variety of food products and beginning to sell beef, chicken, and duck.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items such as: rice, sugar, pasta, and milk, which she will sell from the store in her house.

loans.name: Victoria Roxana

texts.es: Doña Victoria Cuá tiene 24 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Consumo Diario”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de vender productos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje la Planta Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria Cuá is 24 years old, is married, and sells general products. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband work together, and they have an employee working with them. For 6 years, they have sold products from their home, which is located in Paraje la Planta Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her clients’ demands are growing, but the economic conditions in which she finds herself do not allow her to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, which she will use to buy primary materials and, in this way, increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her family and allow them to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business (selling general products)

loans.name: Teofila Ricardina

texts.es:
La señora TEOFILA RICARDINA G. C.    tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el distrito de LAREDO  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 1º de primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales depende económicamente de ella, ya que la mayor se encuentra en el instituto y la segunda se encuentra en etapa escolar.
Teofila  se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de Laredo, vende menús y por las tardes salchipapa, salchipollo, tallarín, papa con miga, jugos, sandwich.
 Con su primer crédito de 300 soles compro insumos para preparar sus platos.
 Con este crédito de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en compra de mas mesas, sillas, utensilios de cocina y tambien en la compra de insumos alimenticios, como arroz, azucar, pan, leche, fideos, aceite, condimentos, etc.
Teofila tiene como sueño arreglar la infraestructura de su local, en especial su techo, pintar las paredes, para mejorar su imagen y tenga mas clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teofila Ricardina G. C. is 53 years old and lives in the district of Laredo, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. This businesswoman has studied up to the first year of primary school. She has 2 children, who are financially dependent on her; the older child attends a state secondary school and the younger one is in school. Teofila sells food in the market in Laredo. She sells a set menu, and in the afternoons, she sells meat-and-potatoes, chicken-and-potatoes, noodles, potatoes, juice, and sandwiches. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought supplies to make her dishes. With this loan for 1500 soles, she will invest in the purchase of more tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, and food supplies, like rice, sugar, bread, milk, noodles, oil, condiments, etc. Teofila dreams of repairing the infrastructure of her premises, especially fixing the ceiling and painting the walls, to improve its image and allow her to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, and food supplies, like rice, sugar, bread, milk, noodles, oil, condiments, etc.

loans.name: María Roberta
