texts.es: Doña María G. tiene 49 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Ropa de vestir”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 14 años de vender ropa   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chisocop Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar mas Mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. María G. is 49 years old, is married, and sells clothing. She lives with her husband and children, and she and her husband work together, with an employee. For 14 years, she has sold clothing from her home, which is located is Paraje Chisocop Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her clients’ demands are growing, but her economic conditions do not allow her to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, which she will use to buy more merchandise and, in this way, increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her family and allow them to have improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business (selling clothes)

loans.name: Flor De Mariscal Group

texts.es:
Doce personas conforman la asociación “Flor de Mariscal, trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer  hace seis años en el centro focal Panamericana ubicado en  la ciudad de El Alto.
Varias son las actividades que realiza este grupo algunas se dedican a la venta de mantas, otras tienen tiendas de barrio, pero la mayoría del grupo tiene a los alimentos  como base principal de sus negocios, es decir; elaboran y venden comida, venden pan, papa, verduras y frutas. La asociación Flor de Mariscal afirma que necesitan generar mayores ingresos, ya que lo que obtienen no les alcanza para mantener económicamente a sus familias, para esto necesitan de créditos para comprar insumos en mayor cantidad.(arroz por Quintal, frutas de la temporada, harina y otros dependiendo el caso)
texts.en:
Twelve members make up the "Flor de Mariscal” Association. They have been working with Pro Mujer for 6 years in the Pan American community center in the city of El Alto.

The group is involved in a number of different business activities. Some members sell blankets, some own storefronts in the neighborhood, but most of them sell food as the mainstay of their businesses. These include preparing and selling bread, potatoes, vegetables, and fruit. The "Flor de Mariscal” Association claims they need to generate better earnings because their current incomes are not enough to support their families. For this reason, they need a loan to purchase supplies in large quantities (bags of rice, seasonal fruits, flour, and other items depending on the type of business).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & merchandise

loans.name: Eva Julia

texts.es:
la sra. EVA JULIA R. AGUILAR se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tambien tiene unos cuartos que los alquila, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 13 años, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, con los ingresos  que le genera este negocio cubre todos sus gastos familiares y compromisos adquiridos, doña julia es bien conocida por la activiadad que ella realiza ya que sus 
ricas y calientitas tortillas son bien apetecidas por su clientela ya que las consumen a todas horas, este es un aliemento basico en la dieta de los catrachos. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas y asi tener mayores ganancias. la meta de ella es poder tener muchos cuartos para alquilar, porque ella se siente cansada y quiere pasar su vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Señora Eva Julia R. Aguilar makes and sells tortillas. She also owns a few rooms, which she has been renting out for the past 13 years. She is a widow and has 2 sons. With the income generated by her work she covers all of her family's expenses as well as any debts she may have acquired. Doña Julia is well-known for her warm, delicious tortillas, which are demanded by her customers at all hours of the day. Tortillas are a basic food amongst Hondurans. Doña Julia needs this loan in order to purchase more raw materials so that she may make more tortillas, and by doing so increase her earnings. Her goal is to be able to own more rooms to rent, because she is feeling tired from her work with the tortillas, and wishes to live more calmly in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de maiz, agua, cal, leña

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
La señora MARIA FRANCISCA A. D. R.    tiene 60 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3º D. secundaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales no depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Maria  se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza como: talcos, colonias, perfumes, cremas, labiales, etc los cuales los distribuye en diferentes puestos del mercado D. Laredo y también venD. a sus familiares y amistades.
 Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas productos D. belleza para aumentar su stock.
 Con este crédito D. 900 nuevos soles lo invertirá en compra D. mas productos D. belleza y también ropa para niños y adultos, los cuales tambien distribuira en los puestos del mercado D. Laredo y también los vendera a sus amistades y famliares.
Maria tiene como sueño tener un puesto propio en un centro comercial en el Distrito D. Trujillo, donD. pueda vender sus productos D. belleza y ropa.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca A. D. R. is 60. She lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. This entrepreneur completed her third year of high school. She has three children who are not economically dependent upon her. Maria sells beauty products like powders, colognes, perfumes, creams and lipsticks, etc. She distributes them to different stands in the Laredo market. She also sells to family and friends. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought more beauty products to increase her stock. With this loan for 900 PEN she will buy more beauty products and clothing for children and adults. She will distribute them to the stands in the Laredo market as well as selling to friends and families. Maria’s dream is to have her own stand where she can sell her beauty products and clothes in a commercial center in the Trujillo district.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more beauty products and clothing for children and adults, which she will distribute in the Laredo market

loans.name: Carmen Soria

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Soria T. D. C. tiene 61 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Víctor Larco, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6º año D. primaria, tiene 6 hijos y solo 3 D. ellos  dependen económicamente D. ella.
Carmen se dedica a la venta D. desayunos, caldo D. gallina en el terminal pesquero D. Buenos Aires.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro productos alimenticios como fideos, papa, zanahoria, gallina, pan, lechuga, etc para la preparación D. sus desayunos y caldos.
Con este crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles comprarà utensilios D. cocina como tazas, ollas, cubiertos, etc y productos alimenticios para la preparación D. sus desayunos y caldos.
Carmen sueña con mejorar la infraestructura D. su puesto, colocar techo, pintarlo y comprar mas mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Carmen Soria T. D. C. is 61. She lives in the Víctor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. This entrepreneur has a 6th graD. education. She has six children, but only three are economically dependent upon her. Carmen sells breakfasts and chicken soup in the Buenos Aires fish market. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought food products like noodles, potatoes, carrots, chicken, bread, and lettuce, etc. for the preparation of her breakfasts and soups. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy kitchen utensils like cups, pots, and cutlery, etc. She will also buy food products to make her breakfasts and soups. Carmen dreams of improving her stand’s infrastructure by putting on a roof, painting it, and buying more tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils like cups, pots, and cutlery, etc. and food products

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es: Doña María G. tiene 51 años D. edad, es soltera D. oficios en servicio,  “Molino D. Nixtamal”, habita junto  a sus hermanas, lleva 10 años D. brindar los servicios   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chisocop Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento D. Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda D. su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención D. comprar más Activos y D. esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones D. vida
texts.en:
María G. is 51 years old, single, and lives with her sisters. Her occupation is operating a grain mill, something she has been doing for ten years. She lives in Paraje Chisocop Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, in Guatemala.

The demand of her clientele has grown but her economic situation is not sufficient to increase her capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying more materials. In this way she can increase her sales. She hopes to be able to further her family's situation and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital (Grain Mill)

loans.name: Manuela Modesta

texts.es: Doña Manuela R. tiene 45 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de fajas Típicas”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años de laborar en tejidos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chisocop del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Manuela R. is 45 years old, married, and works as a weaver in the production of traditional decorative belts. She lives with her husband and children. Her and her husband both work in the same business and employ three people. She has worked as a weaver for twelve years.She lives in Paraje Chisocop de Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, in Guatemala.

Recently the demand of her clients has increased but economic consitions mean that she does not have sufficient funds to increase her capital. For this reason she came to Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan in order to buy raw materials. In this way she hopes to increase sales in order to improve the situation of her family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying primary materials for weaving

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
el sr. LUIS ARTURO P. IRIAS se dedica  a la tapiceria y tiene un negocio que opera bajo el nombre de "DISEÑOS" el tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio.
con la experiencia que el maneja desde hace 14 años ha podido tener una buena clientela por la calidad de trabajo que el elabora y diseña en sus trabajos.- su negocio esta ubicado en el Barrio La Reforma de la ciudad de Danlí. 
Don Luis tiene 2 hijos y que les brinda todo el apoyo en sus estudios y en sus deberes, el tambien da el apoyo suficiente para su hogar.
Su negocio se encuentra instalado en su propia casa de habitacion, El Sr. Irias trabaja arduamente dia a dia para poder generar mayores ingresos y asi poder mejorar su condicion de vida y la de sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Arturo P. Irias is in the business of furniture upholstery. He has a business the operates under the name "Diseños" (Designs). He has a lot of experience in this type of business.

With experience in management for 14 years, he has been able to acquire a good clientele that appreciates the quality of his work and designs. His business is located in the neighborhood La Reforma in the city of Danlí.

Don Luis has two children and he supports them in their studies and offers them a home.

His business is located in his own home. Mr. Irias works hard every day in order to increase his income and improve his quality of life and that of his two children.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics, imitation leather, sponges, a gallon of glue, springs, studs, and thread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lidia Elcira

texts.es:
La señora LIDIA ELCIRA C. C.    tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el distrito de LAREDO  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios en la Universidad, la carrera de Administración, tiene 2 hijos los cuales depende económicamente de ella.
Lidia  se dedica a la venta de tallarines, papa con miga, menús en su domicilio (Alimentos). Empezó con este negocio hace 2 años con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, debido a que se divorciò de su esposo, quien no le pasaba la pensión para sus hijos.
 Con su primer crédito de 300 soles compro mesas y sillas para su negocio.
 Con este crédito de 200 nuevos soles lo utilizarà para comprar insumos: aderezos, papa, fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc para la preparación de sus menús y platos fríos que vende por las tardes.
Lidia  tiene como sueño implementar su local y que también funcione como bar para que pueda vender cerveza y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Lidia Elcira C. C. is 49 years old, lives in the district of Laredo, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, in Peru.

The entrepreuneur studied administration at university. She has two children who are economically dependent on her.

Lida sells tallarines (pasta dishes), potatoes, and daily menus at her home. She started with this business two years ago with the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She divorced her husband who did not help pay for their children.

With her first loan of 300 soles she bought tables and seats for her business.

With this loan of 200 soles she want to buy raw materials: seasonings, potatoes, noodles, rice, sugar, oil, etc for the preparation of her lunches menus and the cold dishes that she sells in the afternoon.

Lidia also dreams of having her restaurant double as a bar where she could sell beer and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw goods like seasonings, potatoes, noodles, rice, sugar, oil, etc for the preparation of her food

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es: Doña Rosario C. tiene 24 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos”, habita junto  a su esposo e hija, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de laborar en tejidos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xerachochac del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Doña Rosario C. is 24 years old, married, and has one daughter. She is a craftswoman who makes traditional fabrics. She and her husband work in the same shop with their two employees. They have been operating their weaving business for 6 years from home in Paraje Xerachochac in the Poxlajuj sector, Totonicapán District, Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, they are not in a financial position to increase their capital. For this reason, they have approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. They intend to buy raw materials needed to increase their sales. Doña Rosario hopes that her family will get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Rosario Florinda

texts.es: Doña Rosario T. tiene 28 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Ropa Típica”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de laborar en el comercio   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xolcaja del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Doña Rosario T. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is a merchant who sells traditional clothing. She and her husband work in the same shop with their two employees. For the past 8 years, they have been operating their business from home in Paraje Xolcaja in the Poxlajuj sector of Totonicapán District, Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, they are not in a financial position to increase their capital. For this reason, they have approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. They intend to buy raw materials needed to increase their sales. Doña Rosario hopes that her family will get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA CONCEPCION C. I. cuenta con una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "Mary" esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danlí,  tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta tipo de actividad el cual durante todo este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar muy bien, y con ello poco a poco ha sabido ganar la clientela por lo buen surtido que luce su negocio. 
La Sra. Concepcion es madre soltera, y su negocio que le permite generar mayores ingresos para poder mantener su hogar, ella desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida, nos comento que su sueño es tener un mercadito grande en el cual tenga todo tipo de productos para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria has a small grocery store that operates under the name “Pulperia Mary”. It is located in her house in the Pueblo Nuevo community in the city of Danlí. She has been working as a storekeeper for three years. During this time she has obtained the knowledge of running a profitable business. Little by little she has been gaining more customers because of the good assortment of products they see in her store. Mrs. Maria is a single mother and her business helps her generate the income necessary to support her home. She would like to improve her life. She told us that her dream is to have a larger market in which she would have all types of products to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy soft drinks, milk products, pastas, sugar, beans, tortillas, rice, wheat and corn flour, cookies, candy, lard, oil, salt, spices, canned juice, toilet paper and eggs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cenia

texts.es:
La señora Cenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, y es madre de 03 hijos, esta estudiando segundaria (3ro grado), vive en el Barrio Progreso.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra ropa. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, una parte del dinero lo utilizara para comprar ropa para vender en el mercado de Ilave, y también comprarà abarrotes para su tienda: arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos, aceite, kuaquer, etc.

Su deseo es tener una casa propia y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las charlas, los ahorros y los encuentros deportivos.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos, aceite, kuaquer, etc.

loans.name: Marla

texts.en:
Marla P. P. is 56 years old and is a single mother of four children. She sells beauty products, soft drinks and candies out of her home. Marla lives in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Puccallpa.

Marla invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in a small grocery shop. She is currently requesting a loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles which she will invest in purchasing more products for her current business.

Marla is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for the financial support and for the trust that the organization places in her. She also appreciates the educational sessions given by Manuela Ramos during each monthly meeting of her communal bank, "Las Manguitos" (The Little Mangoes). Marla is committed to progressing with her business and to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Ma Brigida

texts.es:
la sra. Ma Brigida S. se dedica a la venta y produccion de tortillas, actividad que tiene de realizar hace varios años, ella tiene 58 años de edad, todos los dias se levanta temprano para empezar a elaborar sus tortillas, tiene dos empleadas que le ayudan a la produccion de las mismas. 
este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos ya que ella por su edad no puede laborar en ninguna empresa, para las personas de la tercera edad es dificil conseguir trabajo, ella se siente muy feliz porque todo le va saliendo bien, tiene muchos deseos de superarse y tener una vida justa y comoda.
necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ma Brigid sells and makes tortillas. She has been doing this for many years. She is 58 years old. Each day she gets up early in order to begin making her tortillas. She has two employees that help her make them. This business is her only form of income. Because of her age she is not able to work in a business. It is difficult for older people to get a job. Brigid is very happy because everything is working out well. She has a strong desire to succeed and to have a just and comfortable life. She needs a loan in order to buy raw materials that will be used to make her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood, coal, water and lime.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miguel Isaías

texts.es: Don Miguel Isaías R. T. cuenta con 29  años de edad  casado con dos hijos se actualmente se dedica prestando servicios entregando materiales para construcción para viviendas el cual diariamente utiliza su transporte pesado para transportar a diferentes lugares de su comunidad  diariamente, se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR  por un préstamo,  debido a su herramienta de trabajo no cuenta con servicios necesarios el cual tuvo una falla mecánica con su trasporte y como consecuencia no puede cubrir la demanda de sus clientes   diariamente  en su actividad por las misma razón necesita la compra de unos repuestos  para  su vehículo como también poder seguir mejorando sus fuentes de ingresos y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Don Miguel Isaías R. T. is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Every day, he operates a delivery service that transports home construction materials to different places in the community.

Don Miguel has come to Asociación ASDIR seeking a loan because the vehicle he uses for his business is experiencing mechanical problems. He cannot meet the demand of his customers so he will purchase spare parts so that it can be repaired. He hopes to continue improving his earnings and provide his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his service vehicle

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
la sra Aura Estela M.  tiene 47 años de edad, ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, dicho alimento es muy consumido por todos los pobladores de Honduras, este alimento es indispensable en muchas familias en los tres tiempos de comida, (desayuno, almuerzo y cena.
ella elabora sus tortillas en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de su hija para dicha produccion. este tipo de negocio es la fuente de ingresos que ella tiene, siempre le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. en estos momentos ella necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las torillas, ya que la situacion que atravieza el pais es dificil y todo se esta poniendo mas caro, ella quiere comprar al por mayor para abaratar los costos.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura Estela M. is 47 years old. She makes and sells corn tortillas, a food consumed by all Hondurans. It is an essential food for many families at every meal – breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Sra. Aura makes the tortillas at home and her daughter helps with the production. This business provides her with a source of income and allows her to always help her husband with the living expenses.

At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ingredients for making tortillas. The economic situation throughout her country is difficult and everything is getting more expensive. She wants to buy products at wholesale in order to reduce her costs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, lime & firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios son un número de 16, ellos pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”, ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento del Cusco. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, ellos requieren este capital de trabajo para invertir en sus diferentes negocios pequeños, ellos venden comida, algunos tienen sus stand en colegios y laboran en el recreo de los alumnos, otros solicitan para aumentar su negocios en el mercado de confraternidad, otras socias tienen un pequeño cafetín y tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual solicitan el préstamo.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
There are 16 members in the Señor de Puquin Community Bank, which is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province and department. The members have different small businesses. They need working capital to invest in their different small businesses. They sell food. Some of them have stands in schools and work at the students’ break time. Others are asking for a loan to increase their businesses in the fellowship market. Other members are asking for a loan for their small café and grocery store. The members are grateful for and value the loan given through this medium. They promise to make their payments according to the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La maestra Bertha Z. es soltera, ella labora para una escuela desde hace 29 años, vive con una hija en edad escolar. Ella esta tramitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa ya que se acercara la temporada de lluvias y su techo quedo dañado por el granizo.
texts.en:
Bertha Z. is unmarried and has worked in a school for the past 29 years. She lives with her school-age daughter. Ms. Z. is asking for this loan in order to water-proof her roof, since rainy season is coming and it was damaged in a hail storm.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: water-proof roof

loans.name: Maria Xiomara

texts.es:
la sra, Maria D. tiene 43 años de edad, ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las cuales las elabora en su casa de habitacion, ella vive en el cerro Juan A. Lainez de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, este lugar queda cerca del centro de la ciudad, lo cual es ventajoso para ella, porque en el centro hay muchos restaurantes y locales de comidas que le compran mucho su producto.
Maria se levanta muy temprano para empezar a producir sus tortillas. gracias a este negocio ella a logrado darles estudio, alimentacion y salud a su familia.
en estos momentos necesita un credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio, ella desea en un futuro comprar una maquina para elaborar tortillas y asi tendria una produccion mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria D. is 43 years old, and works at home making tortillas which she later sells. She lives on Juan A. Lainez hill in the city of Tegucigalpa (near the center of the city) which is a very good location for her since there are many restaurants and stores which buy her product. Maria gets up very early to start making her tortillas. Thanks to this business, she has been able to feed her family in addition to providing for their schooling and health needs. At the moment, she needs a loan to expand her business. In the future she wants to buy a machine to make the tortillas so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lime, firewood, and flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santos Juliana

texts.es: La señora Santos Juliana G. Menchú cuenta con 35 años casada vive con sus tres hijos en la actualidad cuenta con pocos ingresos  mensuales prestando sus servicios en la Artesanía y se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder comprar una estufa de gas para poder cocinar sus alimentos ya que por el tiempo que le dedica  no son suficientes para poder avanzar en sus labores diariamente, brindándole esta pequeña ayuda ella podrá mejora sus ingresos, como  en su trabajo como también podrá mejor sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Santos Juliana Garcia Menchu is 35 years old, married, and lives with her 3 children. At the moment, she doesn't have much monthly income from her work as a local artisan. She is approaching the ASDIR association for a small loan so that she can buy a gas stove in order to cook her food, since she spends so much time doing this that it is hard to find enough time to advance her artisan work on a daily basis. This stove will offer her some much needed help, which will allow her to increase her income, in addition to improving the quality of life for Ms. Garcia and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a stove

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
L. señora Leticia es casada con el señor José Ramón quien es pensionado y tienen una tiendita D. abarrotes desD. hace 1 año D. nombre “Abarrotes Leticia”; ellos son una familia unida y tienen una hija D. nombre Yesenia quien labora como capturista D. datos en una oficina, sus ingresos contribuyen con los gastos familiares.
Están tramitando este crédito para invertir en mercancía para el negocio familiar y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Leticia is married to Sr. José Ramón, who is a pensioner. They have a grocery store called “Abarrotes Leticia” (Leticia’s Groceries), which has been in operation for one year. They are a close family. Their daughter Yesenia works in an office as a data entry operator. Sra. Leticia’s income goes toward the family expenses.

Her loan will be used to buy merchandise for her family business, which will increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: la sra. Maria del Rosario A. tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, este producto lo vende en su casa y en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias y restaurantes de la ciudad capital,  tambien vende por encargo para reuniones. tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio logro darles estudio, alimentacion y salud a sus hijos, este credito lo necesita para comprar mas materia prima al por mayor para poder abaratar los costos de produccion, su meta es poder tener un negocio grande en el cual pueda contratar varias mujeres y asi contribuir con empleo para gente que necesita trabajar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Rosario A. is 55 years old, and works making tortillas, which she sells out of her house and in various markets, corner grocery stores, and restaurants around the capital city. She also caters large events. She has worked at this for the past 25 years, and thanks to this business she has been able to provide food, schooling, and health care to her children. She needs this loan to buy her raw materials in bulk in order to reduce her production costs. Her goal is to be able to have a large business which will be able to employ several women and in that way provide jobs to people who need them.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lime, water, firewood, and flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tomás Manuel

texts.es: Don Tomás Manuel M.  cuenta con 28 años Tiene 2  hijos lleva Ocho años prestando sus servicios de transportista entregando materiales para construcción de viviendas y otros, actualmente cuenta con un vehículo pesado debido a la demanda de sus clientes su vehículo necesita una reparación para el mantenimiento de la misma, por esos se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para poder adquirir un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cuatro llantas las actuales ya no le permite poder viajar de un lugar a otro, en los diferentes partes de la ciudad donde atiende a la mayoría de sus clientes por tal razón necesita mejorar su herramienta de trabajo para facilitar y seguir mejorando sus ingresos mensuales para el  sostenimiento diario y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas Manual M. is 28 years old and has 2 children. He has worked transporting construction materials in his truck for the past 8 years, and due to the demands of the job, the vehicle is currently in need of repair. For this reason, he is asking for a loan from ASDIR, which he will invest in the purchase of 4 tires, since the ones he currently has prevent him from being able to get anywhere. This investment will allow him to again attend to customers in different parts of the city, and to continue increasing his monthly income to support the day-to-day need of him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: La señora María de la Luz vive con su esposo el señor Adrián Villarreal, quien es pensionado. La señora María tiene su negocio propio de nombre “Abarrotes Imax” establecido desde hace un año, negocio que ha dado ganancias y tiene ya su clientela, por tal motivo la familia esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía y seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de los clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de la Luz lives with her husband, Mr. Adrian Villrreal, who is on pension. Mrs. Maria has her own business called "Abarrotes Imax", which she established a year ago. This business is turning a profit, and she already has her own regular customers. The family is seeking a loan for investment in the purchase of additional merchandise in order to continue meeting the needs of their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jorge Ariel

texts.es: El señor Jorge Ariel es casado con la señora Bertha Alicia la cual es cocinera de una guardería desde hace 1 año, Don Jorge es guardia de seguridad en una empresa con una antigüedad de 6 años, juntos como familia obtiene otros ingresos ya que los fines de semana establecen su negocio de tacos; motivo por el cual solicitan este crédito que es para la inversión en mas mercancía.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Ariel is married to Sra. Bertha Alicia, who has been working as a cook at a nursery school for one year. Don Jorge is a security guard and has 6 years of company seniority. Together as a family, they earn extra money on the weekends by running a taco business. Don Jorge is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona N. hails from the coastal town of Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and is determined and hopeful to bring her family out of poverty. She is married to Diosdado who is 43 years old. She is a strong mother to six children, all underage and still dependent on her.

Her husband is a construction worker. His income is not fixed and insufficient for their needs because he is not always able to find work. This led Chona to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. She makes doormats out of used clothes. She tried to develop it as a business and it went well.

Now on her third loan, she is asking for 15,000 pesos as additional capital to purchase assorted clothes as raw material, scissors, flannel board and other materials needed for doormat making. She is confident that her business will bring them a good income since they have regular customers and they even receive orders.

She hopes to expand her business and to be able to save for her children’s future needs, especially school fees.

loans.use: To pay assorted clothes as raw material, scissors, flannel board and other needed materials for doormat making.

loans.name: María Celestina

texts.es: Doña María Celestina T. C.  es viuda cuenta con 33 años de edad vive con una hija lleva cinco años laborando como costurera  y cuenta con un pequeño local en su comunidad por circunstancias de la vida se encuentra sola sobresaliendo cada día para poder sostener a su pequeña hija, por tal razón se acercó a la asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar una estufa comercial y así facilitar un servicio a la comunidad aledañas vendiendo tortillas alimenticias de maíz, actualmente la demanda a la actividad a la que se dedica, sus ingresos son muy bajos, por las circunstancias ella necesita otro fuente de ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida que  tiene y así poder salir adelante y poder sufragar sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Doña María Celestina T. C. is a 33 year old widow and has a 5 year old daughter. She is a seamstress and operates a small workshop in her community. The circumstances of life have left her standing alone to support her young daughter.

For this reason, she has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan for a commercial oven for making nutritious corn tortillas that she can sell in the neighboring communities. There is a great demand for tortillas, but she doesn’t earn enough money to get started. Given her circumstances, she needs another source of income to improve her living conditions. This will help her get ahead and enable her to cover her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an oven to start a second business selling tortillas

loans.name: Marta Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Marta Graciela es casada con el señor Edilio, ella trabaja en seguridad publica municipal contando con una antigüedad de 6 años, Don Edilio su marido labora como albañil independiente desde hace 20 años. 
Ellos son muy trabajadores y buscan salir adelante, están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de un cuarto de baño, porque con el que cuentan es un baño de letrina el cual es muy antihigiénico y peligroso ya que puede ocasionar enfermedades.
texts.en:
Señora Marta Graciela is married to Señor Edilio. She works in municipal public safety, with a longevity of 6 years. Don Edilio, her husband, has worked as an independent bricklayer for the past 20 years. They are very hard working, and they want to move their lives forward. They are asking for this loan for the construction of a bathroom, because the one they have is a latrine, which is very unhygienic and dangerous, such that it could cause sickness.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a bathroom

loans.name: José Isaías

texts.es: Don José Isaías G. Y. cuenta con 34 años de edad casado vive con sus dos hijos lleva 7 años laborando en la tejeduría como operario debido a la falta de demanda en su trabajo sus ingresos son muy bajos por tal razón se acercó ala asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo y así poder comprar una carreta para la venta de productos alimenticios ya que en su comunidad no existe este tipo de servicios aprovechando la circunstancias el quiere aprovechar este recurso para poder crear otra fuente de trabajo a la anterior y así poder sufragar los gastos de su familia y continuar con la educación de sus dos hijos y aprovechar este recurso para el mantenimiento de los gastos personales.
texts.en:
Don José Isaías G. Y. is 34 years old. He is married, and lives with his two children. He has spent 7 years working in textiles as an operator. Due to the lack of demand for his work, his income has become very small. For this reason, he began his association with ASDIR, in order to ask for a loan and so be able to buy a cart for the sales of food products. At the moment, in his community, this type of service does not exist. To make the most of the circumstances, he wants to take advantage of this chance, in order to create another source of work for the future, and so be able to meet the expenses of his family and to continue with the education of his two sons, taking advantage of this recourse to meet personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: Raymundo Feliciano

texts.es: Don Raymundo Feliciano V. P. tiene 25 años de edad  vive con su familia cuenta con una hija, reside en el paraje Chopetac, del cantón Xolsacmalaja municipio y departamento de totonicapán Guatemala, actualmente se dedica al la artesania en la elaboracion de muebles lleva 7 años en esta activida, la demanda de sus clientes son buenas por eso se aserco a la asociacion ASIR para solicitar un prestamo para la compra de materia prima tiene un pequeño taller de fabricacion de toda clase de muebles y según los pedidos de sus clientes an incrementado por tal razon es una opcion para el incremeto de su pequeño taller a si poder mejorar sus ingresos y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Raymundo Feliciano V. P. is 25 years old. He lives with his family and has one daughter. He lives in Chopetac, in the municipal district of Xolsacmalaja, and in the department of Totonicapán, in Guatemala. At the moment he works as an artisan, making furniture. He has spent 7 years on this activity. The demand from his clients is good, and for this reason he has come to ASIR in order to ask for a loan to purchase raw materials. He has a small workshop for all types of furniture, and the orders from his clients have increased. For this reason, it is an opportunity to grow his small workshop and so increase his income and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Ruth Sotera

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Sotera vive con su esposo el señor Nicolás y tienen hijos en edad escolar, la señora Ruth tiene un negocio propio de nombre “Abarrotes Neftari”
Que lo tiene establecido desde hace 6 años el cual esta dando muy buenas ganancias, Don Nicolás por su parte tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva que trae de la ciudad de Guanajuato, ellos están solicitando este crédito para la inversión en compra de mas mercancía para el negocio de la tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth Sotera lives with her husband Nicolas and they have school aged children. Ruth has her own businesss called "Abarrotes Neftari," which she has had established for six years and which is giving her very good earnings. For his part, Nicolas has a business selling new clothes which he brings from the city of Guanajuato. They are asking for this loan to invest in buying more merchandise for the general store.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the business

loans.name: Santos Delfino

texts.es: Don Santos Delfino B. C., cuenta con 34 años de edad casado vive con sus tres hijos reside en el Paraje Pacruz, del Cantón Chuixchimal, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, es graduado en maestro de instrumentos musicales, cuenta con una pequeña Academia de música trabaja como docente en un establecimiento educativo, hace más de 8 años para querer mejorar sus ingresos se acercó a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo, para poder ampliar su academia actual ya que la demanda de varios alumnos esta creciendo y para poder dar servicios a las demás persona necesita comprar más instrumentos musicales para poder tener mejores opciones, así poder darle a su clientela un servicio mucho mejor, también mejorando sus fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Santos Delfino B. C. is 34 years old, married, and has three children. They reside in Paraje Pacruz in the Chuixchimal sector of Totonicapán, District of Totonicapán. He graduated with a degree in instrumental conducting from a small music academy and now works as a teacher at an educational center. For 8 years, he has wanted to improve his income so he visited the offices of Asociación ASDIR.

Don Santos wants to expand his music program because student demand is increasing and he wants to provide lessons to as many as possible. He needs to buy more musical instruments so that he can provide better options. This way he can give his clients better service, which will improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Acosme Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo llamado Grupo Solidario Acosme, está conformado por Eulalia Carlota García y  Fanny esperanza R. García. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras, las 2 tienen sus propios negocios. Eulalia se dedica a una pulpería y Fanny se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Por lo que ambas tienen mucho tiempo en las diferentes actividades económicas. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para materia prima que es necesaria para sus negocios. Ambas luchan por proporcionarles a sus familias estabilidad económica de sus humildes actividades.
texts.en:
This group is called Grupo Solidario Acosme, which consists of Eulalia Carlota García and Fanny Esperanza R. García. They are hardworking women who have their own businesses. Eulalia has a grocery store while Fanny makes and sells tortillas. Both dedicate a lot of time to their business activities. The loan they are requesting will be used as operating capital for raw materials needed for their businesses. Both women struggle to provide financial stability for their families with their modest efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is 22 years old and is studying law and political science at the National University of Ucayali in the city of Pucallpa. Karina has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a little more than two years and belongs to the communal bank, "Los Manguitos" (The Little Mangoes). Karina dedicates herself to her studies and also works at the social program "A Crecer" (Toward Growth), a government enterprise which helps poor women and their families.

Karina invests in a small food stand/cafe run by her mother and two employees at the Amazonian Intercultural University (UNIA). She plans to use this loan of 1,300 Nuevos Soles to invest in basic food products for her mother's cafe. Karina hopes to continue to finance her university studies with profits from this little business, in which she also invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) from Manuela Ramos.

Karina is very thankful for the financial support from Manuela Ramos. She is committed to being responsible with her loan and punctual in her payments.

loans.use: Basic food products for a cafe/ food stand

loans.name: Ginia Maria

texts.es: Ginia María L. Pérez tiene 40 años de edad. Es cliente de Fundación León 2000 desde hace mucho tiempo, el record crediticio que ella posee es uno de los mejores, pues siempre se ha preocupado por pagar a tiempo. Ginia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que tenía que brindarles un mejor bienestar a sus hijos, su esposo también labora como docente, pero debido al poco salario que gana no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su familia, decide incursionar en este negocio. Por lo que le financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para niños, cremas, perfumes y colonias. Su deseo es que su logre finalizar sus estudios y proveerle lo necesario.
texts.en:
Ginia María L. Pérez, 40, has been a client of Fundación León 2000 for a long time. Her credit record is one of the best. She has always been careful to pay on time. Ginia sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for over three years because she had to improve her children’s well being. Her husband also works as a teacher. But, because the low salary he earns is not sufficient to cover the family expenses, she decided to enter into this business. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy children’s clothes, creams, perfume, and cologne. Her wish is to give her children what they need, and to have them finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Señora Alicia is 31 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Pucallpa. Alicia is a beauty consultant and also dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products. Her husband works as an accountant. 

Alicia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about three years and belongs to the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (“The Little Mangoes”). With her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) from Manuela Ramos, Alicia invested in her first few beauty products. She was pleased to be able to contribute financially to her household.

Alicia is currently requesting a loan of 1,100 soles, which she will use to invest in more beauty products and also in soft drinks, in order to diversify her business venture.

Alicia is pleased to be able to receive loans from Manuela Ramos. She also appreciates the educational sessions given by the organization's loan officers at her communal bank's monthly meetings.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to sell and soft drinks to sell, also

loans.name: Manuela Ramos De Iscuchaca Anta Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “MANUELA RAMOS DE ISCUCHACA ANTA”, están situados en el distrito de Iscuchaka Anta de la provincia y departamento del Cusco. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura (papa. Granos, cereales),  la ganadería (vacunos y ovinos) y con el comercio minorista, ellos venden frutas y comida en el mercado, otros socios se dedican ala albañilería, otras socias compran y venden ropa de casa en casa, todos nuestros socios son gente muy emprendedora con deseos de superación, para lo cual siguen trabajando con mucho empeño y ahora solicitan el préstamo en razón de utilizarlo como capital de trabajo e invertir en sus mismos negocios.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the “MANUELA RAMOS DE ISCUCHACA ANTA” community bank are located in the district of Iscuchaka Anta, in the province and region of Cusco.
Our members divide their time between household activities and work in agriculture (potatoes, grains, and cereals), raising livestock (cattle and sheep) and retail business, selling fruits and food in the market. Some members are bricklayers and others buy clothing and sell it door to door. All of our members are very enterprising people who want to improve their lives, which is why they work hard. They are now requesting a loan to use as working capital and to invest in their businesses.
Our members are grateful for and value this loan granted through Kiva, and are committed to making their repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristina Angelica

texts.es: Doña Cristina originaria de la comunidad de Totonicapán  su principal fuente de ingreso lo obtiene en la venta de productos para dama en las diferentes plazas municipales en Salcaja, Totonicapán Chimaltenago, lo biene ejerciendo  desde cuando tenia doce años hoy necesita de un credito para incrementar su negocio para poder ser competitivo en el mercado  y tener una variedad de producto para la satisfaccion de su clientela.
texts.en:
Doña Cristina is originally from the community of Totonicapán. Her main source of income is from selling products for women in the different municipal markets in Salcaja, Totonicapán, and Chimaltenago. She has done well for herself these past twelve years, but now she needs a loan to expand her business so that she can be competitive in the market and offer a variety of products to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Elias Ramon

texts.es: El joven Elias Es originario de la comunidad de Cantón ChiY.  el cuenta con su pequeño taller de Mecanica en la localidad, el comenta que en año dos mil siete se gradua en dicha profesion el decide prender su propio negocio con la ayuda de sus queridos padres, hasta la fecha todo camina de la mejor manera hoy necesita de un credito donde le servira para la compra de herramientas y materiales, para ir poco a poco a equipar su taller.
texts.en:
Elias is a young man originally from the community of Cantón ChiY.. He runs an auto repair shop in town. Elias says that in 2007, he completed his training to become a mechanic and decided to start his own business. With the help of his beloved parents, all has worked out for the best so far. Today he needs a loan to buy tools and materials so that he can furnish his shop over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & materials

loans.name: Yesenia Marizol

texts.es: La Maestra Marizol es originaria D. la zona cuatro del departamento D. Totonicapán   es graduada D. maestra primaria rural  D. la gloriosa ENRO viene ejerciendo su actividad como docente en la escuela oficial del Municipio D. Totonicapán  en jornada Matutina y por las tarD. es la encargad D. un hogar comunitari en la misma localidad y los fines D. semana esta estudiando  y la cual neseita D. un credito para la presentacion D. un conferencia  a Nivel occidental y la cual no cuenta con el efectivo y por ello necesita el apoyo D. ASDIR en un credito para que dicha actividad sea realizada.
texts.en:
Professor Marizol is originally from area #4 in the Totonicapán District. She graduated with a degree in rural elementary education from the renowned ENRO. She teaches in the mornings at the official school for the town of Totonicapán, and in the afternoon she manages a community home in the same area. On the weekends, she is studying for a presentation at a conference on western education. She needs a loan to pay for her conference expenses because she does not have the funds at the moment. Therefore, she needs the support of Asociación ASDIR so that she will be able to attend.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Conference expenses

loans.name: Antonio Ismael

texts.es: Don Ismael es originario de la zona dos del departamento su oficio es chofer de transporte " Camionetas con lineas de Totonicapán a Quetzaltenango de los transportes Maria Linda dicha actividad lo viene realizando desde hace ya mas de Diez Años con dicho trabajo ha llevado a su familia en el cresimiento economico y principalmente la educacion de sus hijos hoy necesita de un credito para la remodelacion de su humilde hogar, para poder tener un lugar digno para cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Ismael is originally from area #2 of his district. He drives a van with shipping routes from Totonicapán to Quetzaltenango. Don Ismael has been doing this for over 10 years. He says that he works in order to improve his family’s economic situation, with the main goal of educating his children.

Today he needs a loan to remodel his modest home, which will give each of his children a dignified space of their own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovations

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Señora Juana is 44 years old and is married with six children. She lives in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Pucallpa.

Juana dedicates herself to selling home goods such as bedspreads and electronic appliances including radios, cassette players and other items. Her husband is also an independent businessman.

Juana has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about a year and a half and belongs to the communal bank, "Los Manguitos" (“The Little Mangoes”). She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in home goods, which she continues to sell in the rural towns along the long highway from Pucallpa to the capital, Lima. Juana works together with her husband.

Juana is currently requesting a loan of 1,200 soles which she plans to invest in more home accessories and electronics. She hopes to diversify the types of products she has available for her customers.

Juana is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their financial support and appreciates the confidence that the organization places in her. She is committed to making her loan payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: To buy more home goods and electronics for sale

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Doña Marina es originaria de la comunidad de Chuicruz del departamento de Totonicapna  es casada con cuatro hijos su principal activida es  ama de casa  con los diferentes vecinos de la comunidad  vien luchando desde hace mas de quince años con dicha actividad, con los ingreso que obtiene alimenta ha su familia, educacion a sus hijos hoy necesita de un credito para remodelar un cuarto que le servira como lugar de estudios de sus hijos,
texts.en:
Doña Marina is originally from the Chuicruz community in the district of Totonicapán. She is married and has four children. She works as a housekeeper for different neighbors in the community. For more than 15 years, she has struggled to make a living. With the money she earns, she is able to feed her family and educate her children.

Today she needs a loan to remodel her dining room because that is the place her children use to study.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta B. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Loreta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta plants and harvests rice to sell in the local community. Loreta has been in the business for five years.

In 2009, Loreta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Loreta is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Loreta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for rice crops.

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: La Señorita Julia Patricia con residencia en la zona Independencia del municipio de Totonicapán su profesion es perito contador con especialidad en computacion graduada hace cinco años y presta su servicio para area de salud del departamento de Contabilida como asitente de contabilida, visita las oficina de la sucursal Asdir Totonicapan para solicitar un credito que le servira para finalizar la carrera universitara para un seminario en la ciudad de Quetzaltenango.
texts.en:
Miss Julia Patricia lives in the Independencia area of the municipality of Totonicapán. She graduated five years ago as a qualified accountant specializing in computing. She works as an assistant accountant in the Accounting Department of the Health Administration. She came to the local branch of Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan to complete her university studies by a seminar in the city of Quetzaltenango.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education expenses

loans.name: Alith

texts.en:
Alith, 36 years old and married with four children, lives with her family in Yarinacocha, a small town next to the city of Pucallpa. Alith and her husband work together and just finished installing a small sawmill next to their home. Their sawmill business is called "La Luz" (The Light).

Alith has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about six years. She used her first loan to invest in a small grocery shop, and although she had her shop, she also decided to support her husband in his timber business. Alith's husband has worked with timber for 10 years. Alith supported him financially with this business, and continues to do so with her loans from Manuela Ramos. Together, Alith and her husband are progressing financially for the good of their family. Alith has requested this loan of 2600 soles to invest in the implementation of her family's new sawmill.

Alith appreciates the financial support she receives from Manuela Ramos. She is committed to continuing to work with Manuela Ramos as she has learned to trust the organization. Alith appears in this picture with two of her four children.

loans.use: Implementing a small sawmill

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita N. is full of faith and determination to rise above poverty. She is 56 years old, married and mother to Gilbert who is of legal age already. Despite her age, she is still hopeful of bringing her family out of poverty. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2001 she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a dream of having access to capital for her businesses. She is engaged in making kaing (large baskets used as storage of goods) and a hog raising business. Now on her 12th loan, she proposes the amount of 40,000 pesos as additional capital for the purchase of materials for kaing making and also piglets and feed for her hog raising business.

With the consistency of her businesses, she believes that these will grow, bring them good proceeds to have savings and for the sustainability of her businesses, and even to expand her kaing business in other places through deliveries.

loans.use: To purchase materials for kaing making and also piglets and feed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 48 years old and she is married to Dominador D. C. Sr. The couple is blessed with four children: Dennis, 25 years old, college graduate; Precious Joy - 20 years old and still studying in college; Carlo, 18 years old, first year college, and Dominador D. C. Jr., 12 years old, studies in elementary school. Elvira’s family is happily living in the simple village of Gamis Saguday, Quirino. 

Elvira makes preserved flowers out of dried leaves. She sells her product within their village and sometimes goes to sell in other villages so that they can generate an increased income. She is thankful that, through the income generated from the business, she is able to send her three children to school. According to Elvira, she needs increased capital to improve the unique preserved flower product business that she makes. In this regard, she is requesting to borrow a loan amounting to PHP5,000 as additional working capital. This will help to sustain her flower making activity and to make it known and popular to other municipalities and even nationwide. She hopes that her membership to Kiva will be a good start towards the progress of her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en: Otgonsuren D. is 51 years old and currently lives with her husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She has been married to her husband for 36 years and they raised two daughters, 28 and 24 years old. Otgonsuren has a small retail business dealing in raw meat. Since 2003, she has been retailing mutton and beef in small pieces at the Hasu Shopping Center. She rents a small stall for her business. Her husband is a big help in her business. When she purchases whole beef and mutton from the local wholesale market, her husband cuts them into smaller pieces for her retail business. Since the start in 2003, her business has done well. Her business capital has increased from 50,000 MNT to 750,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) in five years. Otgonsuren's ultimate goal is be a herder in the countryside with his own livestock. She requests a loan to purchase more mutton and beef for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more beef and mutton for her business.

loans.name: Beasito

texts.en:
Beasita S. is mother to twelve: four daughters and eight sons. Six of her children are of legal age and the others are still dependent on her. She is married to Jesus, a 52 year old carpenter. Considering the number of her children, Beasita found it hard to sustain the needs of her family her as her husband’s income is unstable. She strives hard to look for income and so, she was driven to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2006.

Beasita’s previous loans were used in retailing charcoal and retailing of ready-to-wear clothes. But she has opted to put a big slice of her loan now to the resale of ready-to-wear clothes. This, she believes, could bring her enough income for her family.

Now, on her 4th loan, she proposes to borrow 20,000 pesos to pay for assorted products such as, pants, t-shirts, shorts and many other products for her retail business. She is positive that her business will be popular as, aside from waiting for customers to arrive, she also roams around the village to sell the products.

Beasita’s dream is really to send her children to school so as they will not suffer the same life that she is experiencing. She also dreams to have her own space for the display of her products.

loans.use: To pay for inventory for retail business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita Z. is optimistic that, in the near future, she can cut the tie of poverty that hinders her way and her family to success. She is 40 years old and married to Alfredo, 47 years old. She has four children. She lives in the beautiful town of Morong, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

Life was not easy for Emerita. She needs to have her own income to sustain the needs of her family. In 2003, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with a hope of having access to capital for her business. Her previous loans were used as additional capital for her sewing business. A portion of those loans were used as additional capital for her secondary business in food vending. Now, on her 8th loan, she proposes the amount of 35,000 pesos as additional capital for her sewing business. This loan will be used to purchase three high-speed sewing machines and thread.

Emerita is looking forward to expanding her business by hiring a labor team, considering the demands of the shop. With the proceeds she receives, she is hopeful to have a dress shop of her own. She hopes that she can help her neighbors by providing job opportunities. She will be able to send all her children to school with the proceeds of her business.

loans.use: To purchase high speed sewing machines.

loans.name: Floribel

texts.en:
Floribel is 25 years old and she manages a cell phone shop in the city of Santiago. She is married to Jerry B., her partner in managing the business. The couple is blessed with two children: Jaybie - 6 years old and Zyra Mae - 4 years old. They are presently living at Barangay Garit Norte in Echague, Isabela. Floribel has been operating her business for six years now. In fact, her cellphone shop is doing well and she now has two branches, in two towns.

However, she still wants to do her best to make her business more successful and to become the leading cell phone shop in the region. She believes that her faith in God and her patience will make her business keep growing. Now that a Kiva loan is possible, Floribel wants to apply for an initial loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos. This amount will be a big help in the progress of her cell phone center. She will buy more accessories to sell, including cell phone spare parts, to use in their cell phone repair business.

Floribel also says, if others can, why can’t I? She is hoping that she can improve her cell shop and that she will be able to achieve success in life. She hopes to be able to save money for the future education of her children and to give them a brighter future.

loans.use: accessories and spare parts

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Purevjav D. is 52 years old and lives with her 54-year-old husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She grows various vegetable on a small piece of land that she owns in the town. She mostly grows potatoes, carrots, cabbage, onions, and tomatoes. After seasonal harvests, she retails her vegetable at the local food market.

She has been growing and retailing vegetable since 2006 and she has done quite well with her agribusiness. She started with little capital, just 150,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) and now her business capital has increased to 800,000 MNT. She says that she would like to open a small wholesale market for various vegetables in the town. In that way it would be easier to sell her products and cheaper for locals to buy them. She requests a loan to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To grow more vegetables

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success," says Lolita S.. She believes also that one necessary thing to consider in order to attain success in the future is sacrifice. That’s why she is always doing her best in everything she does, and she patiently works hard and sacrifices a lot in order to surpass all the trials in life. She is also a God-fearing individual who always believes and trusts God.

She is a vendor and a hog raiser in Barangay Gamis Saguday, Quirino province. She is already 44 years old and she is married to Berdito. The couple is thankful for the unending guidance of our Almighty God because, despite of the trials that they have experienced, they will never lose hope, and they believe that “there is a rainbow after the rain.”

She has been managing her small canteen in their house, which is located near the public school in their village. But her income is not good enough to sustain her business. Thus, Lolita is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP5,000 as additional capital to improve her business and to make it more profitable.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg Tomor is a 42-year-old single mother. She currently lives with her three teenage children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her three children are students in local universities, meaning that she pays tuition money for three children.

Erdenechimeg has a small retail business in food products. She mostly sells convenient food products, including soft drinks, wheat products, candies, etc. She has been in the food retail business since 2006 and she runs the food retail business with her sister. When she started her business in 2006, her business capital was just under 300,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT), and the current business capital has more than doubled to 800,000 MNT. She mostly purchases her inventory products from the local wholesale market or sometimes from the larger wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She requests a loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

She says that she is in middle of building a small house for her family. As the business goes well, she would like to finish off her house with the extra business profit.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her retail food business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Selling charcoal and buying and selling scrap materials are the businesses that Norma manages in the small village of Gamis in Saguday, Quirino. Norma is 55 years old and she is married to Alexander L.. She manages these businesses to provide for every need of her family. She is so grateful for the blessings of God: having six helpful children and a very supportive husband. They help her to maintain her charcoal vending business and to make it progress.

Norma requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva as additional capital for the improvement of her business. Norma wants to save funds for her family's future and, of course, to provide the basic necessities of life. She prays that Kiva will continue to help her achieve her dreams in life.

loans.use: Capital for charcoal business

loans.name: Bianita

texts.en:
Having many children in her family is a difficult thing, says Bianita. She is sending all of her seven children to school to finish at least two year courses so they can apply for better jobs someday. With the limited income from her general store business, Bianita is able to help support the education of her children and meet their daily basic needs. Bianita is using all her best strategies and effort to overcome the trials in life.

To help her in the current financial crisis, Bianita is now seeking 10,000 PHP financial assistance from Kiva as additional capital to make her business progress. This loan will be a great help to make her business grow and provide more income.

loans.use: To expand a general store

loans.name: Tumurhuu

texts.en:
Tomorhuu S. is 61 and currently lives with two of his five children in the Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. The two oldest daughters have grown up and live with their own families. The next two children are 20 and 18, and both are students in local colleges. The youngest daughter is just 2 and stays home. 

Tomorhuu has a small business selling food. He runs a small convenience store where he sells various convenience-food products, including soft drinks, bread, candies, etc. As his convenience store is in a good location with a very limited number of stores around, his daily sales volume is quite good. From the start early this year, his business has been doing well. The business capital has increased from 800,000 MNT to 1,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He says that he would like to expand his business as the opportunity arises. He would like to make his store into a larger store. 

He requests a loan to purchase more inventory of food products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of food products for his business

loans.name: Celenia

texts.en:
Celenia, at the age of 46, is a woman full of dreams that remain unattained due to the unceasing hardships in life that are prevalent in the country. She hopes that with a Kiva loan, she will someday achieve her goals and desires in life. She believes that Kiva lenders are the answer to her financial problems in life.

Celenia is married to Romeo S., who works as a farmer in the village of Santos Quezon, Isabela, where her family lives. They are blessed with three children, namely: Romeo, Nino Roeland and Rocel Ann Mae. With her general store business, she is able to help her husband support the education of their children and provide for their daily needs.

Kiva loans provide an opportunity, says Celenia, because she will be able to generate additional capital for her business to improve. For that, she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, and she is hoping that her request will be approved.

loans.use: Capital for a general store

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio G. is from the village of Cartagena. He is 40 years old. Lucio is married and has one small child. To make a living, Lucio provides transportation services to local community members. Lucio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2001, Lucio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Lucio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair  the vehicle that he uses in the business. This will be Lucio's fifth loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
